en.name: Tactical Advantage
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Boost an allied unit by 5.
en.fluff: Remember, cadets! He who first draws his blade has the advantage over his foe!

en.name: Basilisk Venom
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=poison>Poison</keyword> a unit.
en.fluff: People think a basilisk kills with its eyes, but it's the colorless fumes from its venom that cause death…

en.name: Crystal Skull
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Boost an allied unit by 4 and give it <keyword=veil>Veil</keyword>.
en.fluff: Makes for a perfect paperweight.

en.name: Enchanted Armor
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Boost a unit in your hand by 3 and give it 2 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.
en.fluff: Lean in, listen closely, and you'll hear a whisper…

en.name: Cursed Scroll
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Draw a card of your choice, then put a card from your hand at the bottom of your deck.
en.fluff: The seal states clearly: do not open. But of course… curiosity will win out.

en.name: Ceremonial Dagger
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 3 and give it <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> (2).
en.fluff: Decorated like a prince's coronet. Sharp like a butcher's knife.

en.name: Magic Lamp
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Transform into Lamp Djinn.
en.fluff: It's a little tarnished. A little rubbing will make it shiny again.

en.name: Urn of Shadows
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Trigger an allied unit's <keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword> ability.
en.fluff: Everyone carries some darkness in them. Some have learned to bend it to their will…

en.name: Collar
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=lock>Lock</keyword> an enemy unit and damage it by 3.
en.fluff: Those who fall into debt with the Moorlehems have two options: go into slavery or kill themselves. The smart ones choose option number two.

en.name: Engineering Solution
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Boost an allied unit by 4 and give it <keyword=shield>Shield</keyword>.
en.fluff: Trust me, I'm an engineer.

en.name: Aen Seidhe Sabre
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play a Scoia'tael Neophyte.
en.fluff: When this blade cuts through the air, you don't hear a swish, you hear music…

en.name: Mask of Uroboros
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Draw a card, then <keyword=discard>Discard</keyword> a card and <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> 2 Crows on your <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword> row.
en.fluff: Time doesn't flow, it goes in circles. The past becomes the future, grandfathers repeat the mistakes of their grandsons.

en.name: Tiger's Eye
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Gain 5 <keyword=coin>Coins</keyword>.
en.fluff: A diamond the size of a goose egg. And worth a small country.

en.name: Haunt
en.tooltip:
<keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.
Scenario: Progress whenever you play a unit with <keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword>.
Prologue: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Desert Banshee on this row.
Chapter 1: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play a Barghest.
Chapter 2: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play a Nightwraith.
en.fluff: If you don't finish your oatmeal, a Haunt will come and eat you!

en.name: The Manor’s Dark Secret
en.tooltip:
<keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.
Scenario: Progress whenever you play a unit with <keyword=thrive>Thrive</keyword>.
Prologue: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Cursed Damsel on this row and boost it by 2.
Chapter 1: Whenever you play a unit, if it would not trigger any of your <keyword=thrive>Thrive</keyword> units, boost it by 2 first.
Chapter 2: Play the highest-power bronze non-Neutral unit from your deck.
en.fluff: In this manor, the doors lock YOU up.

en.name: Masquerade Ball
en.tooltip:
<keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.
Scenario: Progress whenever you play an Aristocrat on your side of the battlefield.
Prologue: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Thirsty Dame on this row.
Chapter 1: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play Fangs of the Empire.
Chapter 2: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play Fangs of the Empire.
en.fluff: Ophelie Van Moorlehem loves throwing huge galas. The fact that some attendees then disappear without a trace doesn't seem to bother anyone…

en.name: Amphibious Assault
en.tooltip: <keyword=echo>Echo</keyword>.\nPlay a non-Neutral unit from your deck with a provision cost of 9 or less. Boost it by 1 for each provision below the limit.
en.fluff: One ship here, one ship there, and the kingdom will be ours!

en.name: The Eternal Eclipse
en.tooltip:
<keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.
Scenario: Progress whenever you play a gold Cultist.
Prologue: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> Eternal Eclipse Initiate on this row.
Chapter 1: <keyword=infused>Infuse</keyword> all your non-<keyword=disloyal>Disloyal</keyword> Cultists on the battlefield, in your hand and in your deck with "Whenever you play a Cultist, boost self by 1, then increase this value by 1 if it was a bronze".
Chapter 2: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play Eternal Eclipse Deacon.
en.fluff: For the uninitiated, the Grand Scheme will manifest itself as an avalanche: a series of seemingly insignificant events putting the entire mountain slope in motion to sweep away the ancien régime. Only the madmen and the thorough historians, studying the developments of these days in retrospect, many decades later, will discover the truth:  it was a mechanism as precise as a clock, counting down to the advent of a new world order.

en.name: Siege
en.tooltip:
<keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.
Scenario: Progress whenever you play a Siege Engine.
Prologue: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a reinforced Trebuchet on your <keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword> row.
Chapter 1: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Battering Ram on your <keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword> row.
Chapter 2: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play Bombardment.
en.fluff: There's no fortress that can't be taken. There are just fortresses not worth taking.

en.name: Damsel in Distress
en.tooltip:
<keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.
Scenario: Progress whenever you play a Knight.
Prologue: <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> a bronze Knight from your deck to this row.
Chapter 1: Whenever an allied unit triggers <keyword=grace>Grace</keyword>, boost its adjacent units by 2.
Chapter 2: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play Mad Charge.
en.fluff: Understandably, it had never occurred to any young knight or princeling, that the towers were erected for their own protection.

en.name: Mysteries of Loc Feainn
en.tooltip:
<keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.
Scenario: Progress whenever you play a unit with <keyword=harmony>Harmony</keyword>.
Prologue: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> Lake Guardian: Dawn Aspect on this row and set its power to the number of non-Neutral units with unique primary categories in your starting deck.
Chapter 1: Whenever you play a non-Neutral unit, boost it by 1 for every category it has.
Chapter 2: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play Loc Feainn: Convergence.
en.fluff: Here, all nature returns to its source; all life finds renewal.

en.name: Feign Death
en.tooltip:
<keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.
Scenario: Progress whenever you play an Elf.
Prologue: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Vernossiel's Commando on this row.
Chapter 1: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> 2 Elven Deadeyes on this row.
Chapter 2: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play Waylay.
en.fluff: In order to set a trap, you should usually hide. But… there are exceptions to this rule.

en.name: In Gedyneith's Shadow
en.tooltip:
<keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.
Scenario: Progress whenever you play a Druid.
Prologue: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Crow Clan Preacher on this row.
Chapter 1: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play Crow's-eye Rhizome.
Chapter 2: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play Mardroeme.
en.fluff: Rulers are crowned in its shadow. Traitors are hanged on its branches.

en.name: Endless Voyage
en.tooltip:
<keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.
Scenario: Progress whenever you play a Pirate.
Prologue: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> Bjorn's Drakkar on this row.
Chapter 1: Whenever your opponent plays a unit, <keyword=infused>Infuse</keyword> it with "<keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> <keyword=cataclysm>Cataclysm</keyword> on this row for 1 turn".
Chapter 2: <keyword=purify>Purify</keyword> and <keyword=heal>Heal</keyword> an allied Bjorn's Drakkar, increase its base power by 5 and give it 1 <keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>.
If you don't control Bjorn's Drakkar, <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> it on this row instead.
en.fluff: Time has failed to halt Bjorn's search. What good will the elements do?

en.name: One Night at the Passiflora
en.tooltip:
<keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.
Scenario: Progress whenever you play a Blindeye.
Prologue: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> Sly Seductress on this row.
Chapter 1: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> Passiflora Peaches on this row.
Chapter 2: Gain 6 <keyword=coin>Coins</keyword>.
en.fluff: More pilgrims come here than to the Temple of the Eternal Fire…

en.name: In Search of Forgotten Treasures
en.tooltip:
<keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.
Scenario: Progress whenever you play a Tidecloak.
Prologue: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> Gudrun Bjornsdottir on this row.
Chapter 1: <keyword=hoard>Hoard</keyword> 8: At the end of your turn, gain enough <keyword=coin>Coins</keyword> to fill your pouch.
Chapter 2: Damage the highest-power enemy unit by the number of <keyword=coin>Coins</keyword> you have.
en.fluff: Fabled, elusive, unmapped. This place sparks the wildest dreams and turns stately sailors into swashbuckling adventurers.

en.name: Dagon: Promised
en.tooltip:
<keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=infused>Infuse</keyword> 5 units in your deck with "<keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword>: Boost the lowest-power allied unit by 2 and worship Dagon" and <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> Call of the Depths in your graveyard.
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=consume>Consume</keyword> an allied unit.
Whenever you play a <keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword> unit, boost it by 1.
While in hand or deck, evolve after you win a round.
en.fluff: That is not dead which can eternal lie, and with strange aeons even death may die.

en.name: Viy
en.tooltip: <keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword>: Shuffle Viy back into your deck, then increase its base power by 3.
en.fluff: What has a million legs and can eat a city whole?

en.name: Renfri
en.tooltip: <keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: If your starting deck has at least 25 units, <keyword=create>Create</keyword> a curse to replace your leader ability, then <keyword=create>Create</keyword> a blessing and <keyword=infused>Infuse</keyword> your leader ability with it.
en.fluff: In this fairytale, the princess and the monster are the same person.

en.name: Tyr: Slayer of Yngvar
en.tooltip:
<keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by the difference between its base and current power.
<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: Gain <keyword=resilient>Resilience</keyword>.
While in hand or deck, evolve after you win a round.
en.fluff: His sword, forged in the fires of the deep, worthy of being wielded by a god, could crack the earth like lightning. And yet, only his were the hands capable of such artifice.

en.name: Dana Méadbh: Provider
en.tooltip:
<keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.
<keyword=harmony>Harmony</keyword>. 
At the end of your turn, boost all non-Neutral units in your hand with primary categories that you don't control by 1.
While in hand or deck, evolve after you win a round.
en.fluff: Every living thing is a child of the Queen of the Fields.

en.name: Torres var Emreis: Founder
en.tooltip:
<keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Give <keyword=spying>Spying</keyword> to 3 units with provision costs of 10 or less from your opponent's deck, then <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> base copies of them into your deck. Boost self by 1 for each provision below the limit.
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=banish>Banish</keyword> up to 3 cards from your starting deck from your deck.
While in hand or deck, evolve after you win a round.
en.fluff: Like emperor, like empire: Grandiose, entitled, and hell-bent.

en.name: Fucusya
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Play a non-Neutral unit from your graveyard with a provision cost of 10 or less and give it <keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>, then <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> <keyword=rain>Rain</keyword> on the opposite row with a duration equal to unused provisions.
en.fluff: Like mermaids, the sea witches can experience true love only once in a lifetime. And Fucusya wasted her only time on a human.

en.name: Saint Gregory: Justicar
en.tooltip: <keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost self by 1 for each unit you control and gain a <keyword=coin>Coin</keyword> for each Firesworn card you control.\nWhile in hand or deck, evolve after you win a round.
en.fluff: Retreat, heathen! I will not axe you twice.

en.name: Oneiromancy
en.tooltip: <keyword=echo>Echo</keyword>.\nPlay any card from your deck.
en.fluff: Deciphering the past and the future as they appear in dreams is very difficult, even for a master.

en.name: Beauclair
en.tooltip: <keyword=resilient>Resilience</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Set an allied unit's power to match the highest-power enemy unit.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Reset the power of a unit.
en.fluff: Beauclair, with its ivory spires and amber rooftops against the backdrop of Mount Gorgon, embodies the essential Toussaint: it never feels like anything other than a fairy tale.

en.name: Chapter of Wizards
en.tooltip: <keyword=resilient>Resilience</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play Runeword.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> on this row a base copy of the last bronze allied Mage you played.
en.fluff: In the wake of the Novigradian Union, the Chapter of the Gift and the Art sought to ensure all magic was adequately regulated. Yet, some mages refused to be restrained by the fetters of absolute authority, choosing instead to practice their craft away from prying eyes. Deemed 'enemies of the institution', these renegades were promptly hunted down and punished.

en.name: She Who Knows
en.tooltip: <keyword=sabbath>Sabbath</keyword>: At the end of round, give <keyword=resilient>Resilience</keyword> to the highest base power unit on your side of the battlefield.
en.fluff: She knows well what kind of clay her daughters are made of. After all, she kneaded it herself.

en.name: Keltullis
en.tooltip: <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>: At the end of your turn, destroy the lowest-power unit on the side with the most units.
en.fluff: When she took roost here, they fought 'er for near a century. Then the dragon got weary o' fightin' and they realized she weren't goin' nowheres, so… they cut a deal. She dinnae bother 'em, they give 'er what she needs.

en.name: Vilgefortz: Renegade
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Swap a card from your opponent's graveyard with a card in your hand.
en.fluff: Four times, Geralt struck. To the temple, to the neck, under the arm, to the thigh. Each blow should have been fatal. Yet each was parried by the mage.

en.name: Svalblod
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage all units by 1. \nWhenever a Bear Abomination enters your side of the battlefield, repeat the <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> ability.\nThe first time you deal 6 damage to units each turn, <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> Svalblod Fanatic on this row.
en.fluff: He proclaimed to his worshippers but one commandment: Kill.

en.name: Telianyn aep Collen
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Shuffle an allied unit with a provision cost of 9 or less to your deck, then play the top Elf with a <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> ability from your deck. \n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play Backup Plan. If this unit is Prepared, <keyword=infused>Infuse</keyword> self with "At the end of your turn, damage a random enemy unit by the number of allied Prepared units" instead.
en.fluff: Months spent foolproofing this operation, only to find I should have hired better listeners... My mother must be laughing somewhere.

en.name: Draug
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Transform all Human on an allied row into Kaedweni Revenants without changing their power.
en.fluff: Some men cannot admit defeat. Some keep fighting from beyond the grave.

en.name: Triss: Meteor Shower
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Damage all units on an enemy row by half their base power.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Boost all allied units on a row by half their base power.
en.fluff: "Next time you get the feeling I'm about to piss off Merigold, make sure and knock me upside the head" - Lambert

en.name: Emhyr var Emreis
en.tooltip:
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Play a bronze Soldier or Aristocrat from your hand, then draw a card.
Whenever your opponent plays a unit, give it <keyword=spying>Spying</keyword>.
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=seize>Seize</keyword> a 1-power enemy unit with <keyword=spying>Spying</keyword>.
<keyword=devotion>Devotion</keyword>: At the end of your turn, refresh this card's <keyword=order>Order</keyword>.
en.fluff: They do not call me the Patient. Take care they do not call you the Headless.

en.name: Artaud Terranova
en.tooltip: <keyword=assimilate>Assimilate</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play a base copy of any non-<keyword=disloyal>Disloyal</keyword> unit you gave <keyword=spying>Spying</keyword> to during this game, excluding self.
en.fluff: Ambition can be blinding.

en.name: Aucwenn
en.tooltip: <keyword=symbiosis>Symbiosis</keyword>\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=infused>Infuse</keyword> all your Naiads with the Nature category, wherever they are.\nWhenever you <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Wandering Treant, give it <keyword=vitality>Vitality</keyword> equal to the number of Dryads you control.
en.fluff: They are not born of magic, but of nature's long forgotten ways.

en.name: Quarixis
en.tooltip: <keyword=harmony>Harmony</keyword>.\nWhenever you play another Relict, <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play Loc Feainn: Convergence.
en.fluff: Those who come close enough to feel Loc Feainn's breeze on their skin hear a gentle voice. For the good-hearted, it's a warning to turn back swiftly. For the greedy and irreverent, it's a subtle call to a new life. To a new purpose. To eternal penitence in a new body.

en.name: Sunset Wanderers
en.tooltip: This card starts in the leftmost position of your hand.\nAt the start of your turn, while in hand, move self one position to the right, then boost self by 1.\nAt the end of your turn, if you haven't passed and there are no cards to the right of this card, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> self from your hand to a random allied row, then draw a card.
en.fluff: It seemed like Dandelion meant to journey with the witcher, even to the edge of the world.

en.name: Kraken
en.tooltip: <keyword=disloyal>Disloyal</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Move 3 enemy units to this row, damage them by 2 and <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> <keyword=storm>Storm</keyword> for 3 turns on this row.\n<keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword>: <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> self to the opposite row and boost self by the number of unique allied Beasts.
en.fluff: Once released, there's no un-releasing it.

en.name: Zoltan: Warrior
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage 2 enemy units by 3. For each unit that survived, <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Rowdy Dwarf on this row.\n<keyword=barricade>Barricade</keyword>: At the end of your turn, damage a random enemy unit by 1.
en.fluff: I've decided to do tangible good, that is not wasted. I am good to myself and my immediate surroundings.

en.name: The Brute
en.tooltip:
<keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 0.
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost self by 0.
The boost is equal to the base power of the highest-power enemy unit with a <keyword=bounty>Bounty</keyword> you destroyed this game.
Whenever you place a <keyword=bounty>Bounty</keyword> on an enemy unit, increase the <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> by 1.
en.fluff: He’s a slayer of all things wicked, a saviour of the common folk, and a very good boy. At least, that’s what his mum tells him.

en.name: Saskia: Commander
en.tooltip: <keyword=immune>Immunity</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: If you have at least 10 different primary categories in your starting deck, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> a random bronze non-Neutral unit with a primary category that is not on your side of the battlefield from your deck to this row.\n<keyword=timer>Timer</keyword> 3: Repeat the <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> ability and reset the <keyword=timer>Timer</keyword>.
en.fluff: "We won't be fighting mere minions, but their King! And the King himself will have to recognize our victory! Could a soldier dream of better than defeating a monarch?"

en.name: King Henselt
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Play a <keyword=crew>Crew</keyword> unit from your deck.\nWhenever an adjacent unit's <keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword> decreases, boost self by the same amount.
en.fluff: Fuck with the unicorn and you get the horn.

en.name: Regis: Reborn
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=drain>Drain</keyword> an enemy unit by 3.\nAt the end of your turn, while in hand or deck, if there is an enemy unit with <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword>, increase own base power by 1.
en.fluff: “You surround your dead with veneration, you dream of immortality, and in your myths and legends someone is always being resurrected—conquering death itself. But were your revered late great-grandfather to spring from his grave and order a beer, hysteria would surely ensue.”

en.name: Melitele
en.tooltip:
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost an allied unit by 5.
Whenever this unit is moved back into your deck, trigger an ability from the cycle:
Maiden - Boost all allied units by 0.
Mother - <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a random 4-provision Northern Realms unit on a random row where you control a unit.
Crone - Boost self by 1, then increase ability values by 1.
en.fluff: You've seen one goddess of fertility, you've seen them all.

en.name: Simlas Finn aep Dabairr
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Play all copies of a bronze special card from your deck.
en.fluff: I am a Sage. Naturally I know more than you do.

en.name: Sigi Reuven: Mastermind
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Look at Collusion and a random unit from each <keyword=gang>Gang</keyword> from your deck, then play 1.\n<keyword=tribute>Tribute</keyword> 9: Play 2 instead.\n<keyword=tribute>Tribute</keyword> costs 2 less for each unique <keyword=gang>Gang</keyword> category you control.
en.fluff: Ahh, Novigrad: a veritable cornucopia of culture and beauty. That is, if a shiv up the arse behind the Butcher's Yard's what tickles your fancy.

en.name: Renew
en.tooltip: Play a unit from your graveyard with a provision cost of 9 or less and give it <keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.
en.fluff: Medicus curat, magicae sanat.

en.name: Hanmarvyn's Blue Dream
en.tooltip: Play a unit from your opponent's graveyard with a provision cost of 9 or less and give it <keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.
en.fluff: This spell lets you see the last moments of a dead man's life… if you can survive its casting.

en.name: Shupe's Day Off
en.tooltip: If your starting deck has no duplicates, send Shupe on an adventure.
en.fluff: Other trolls always considered him a bit odd - after all, who in their right mind would prefer colorful scraps of paper to rocks?

en.name: Ale of the Ancestors
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Boost a unit by 3. \n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 2
en.fluff: Boros, the legendary founder of Clan Fuchs, died after overindulging in this beverage - he passed out while reaching for his golden ring, which had fallen into a brook.

en.name: Tir ná Lia
en.tooltip:
<keyword=resilient>Resilience</keyword>.
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost an allied unit by 0. Increase the value by the number of unique bronze Wild Hunt cards in your starting deck.
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play Red Riders.
<keyword=devotion>Devotion</keyword>: Also <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> <keyword=frost>Frost</keyword> on your opponent's <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword> (0) and <keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword> (0) rows equal to the amounts lost during the last round transition.
en.fluff: Great beauty requires great sacrifice. Of entire civilizations, if need be.

en.name: Iorveth's Gambit
en.tooltip: If you have 4 or more Traps in your starting deck, play 2 of them at random.
en.fluff: Iorveth may have only one eye, but his inner vision is unmatched.

en.name: Temple of Melitele: Congregation
en.tooltip:
<keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>. <keyword=immune>Immunity</keyword>. <keyword=resilient>Resilience</keyword>.
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=create>Create</keyword> a legendary unit from your faction that is not in your starting deck 3 times, then shuffle them into your deck.
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Draw a unit of your choice and boost it by your hand size, then shuffle a card back into your deck.
While in hand or deck, evolve after you win a round.
en.fluff: Here in Ellander, mistaking our girls' vows of silence for tacit approval will get your arse tanned right quick.

en.name: Blood Eagle
en.tooltip:
<keyword=echo>Echo</keyword>.
Damage an enemy unit by 2, then play a Warrior from your deck with a provision cost of 7 or less.
<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: Play a Warrior from your deck instead.
<keyword=bloodthirst>Bloodthirst</keyword> 3: Always trigger the <keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword> ability.
en.fluff: Fly like an eagle – Let my spirit carry me – I want to fly like an eagle.

en.name: Portal
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> a random 4-provision cost unit from your deck to the left of this card.\n<keyword=timer>Timer</keyword> 3: <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> a random 4-provision cost unit from your deck to the right of this card.
en.fluff: Some value them highly. Others hate them.

en.name: War Council
en.tooltip: <keyword=resilient>Resilience</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Look at the first 3 cards from the top of your deck and play one of them.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play Battle Preparation.
en.fluff: Nilfgaardians fight every battle twice: first on the map, then in reality.

en.name: Tibor Eggebracht
en.tooltip:
<keyword=immune>Immunity</keyword>.
At the end of your turn, <keyword=infused>Infuse</keyword> a random enemy unit with "Whenever this unit receives a status, damage self by 1".
Whenever this card enters the battlefield, your opponent draws a card.
If your opponent has passed or their hand is full, damage self by 12 instead.
en.fluff: Tibor's zeal was legendary. It was said when the emperor passed, he'd not so much bow as somersault.

en.name: Sove
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> a Beast from your deck to the opposite row and <keyword=infused>Infuse</keyword> it with "<keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword>: Boost the enemy Sove twice by own base power", then damage it by 1 for each damaged enemy unit and gain <keyword=immune>Immunity</keyword>.
en.fluff: The chimera was child's play compared to what awaited at home.

en.name: Syanna
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Repeat the <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> ability of the next unit you play during this turn.
en.fluff: Your Majesty... The princess has been touched by the curse o' the Black Sun. There's no hope, I'm afraid...

en.name: The Great Oak
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by the number of cards to the left of Great Oak, then boost self by the number of cards to the right of Great Oak.
en.fluff: The trees of Brokilon oft rustle amongst themselves, despairing of the ancient oak whose heart now rots with hatred.

en.name: War Elephant
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage adjacent units by 4, then boost self by 4 for each unit damaged.\n<keyword=crew>Crew</keyword>: Boost self by 8 instead.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 6
en.fluff: It's kind of like a fiend, but bald and with a nose that hangs to the ground. What? No, you're making things up!

en.name: Auberon: King
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play a random bronze Wild Hunt unit.\nAt the start of the round, while in hand or deck, evolve.
en.fluff: The end of one world can be the beginning of another.

en.name: Unseen Elder
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Give an enemy unit <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> (4).\nAt the end of your turn, give <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> (2) to a random enemy unit without <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword>.\n<keyword=devotion>Devotion</keyword>: <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> on enemy units also triggers at the end of your turn.
en.fluff: No one, not even among the higher vampires, knows exactly how old the Unseen Elder is. They only know they should never, under any circumstances, defy his will.

en.name: Ardal aep Dahy
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): If neither player has passed and your opponent's hand is not full, move a non-<keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword> enemy unit with power up to 2 to your opponent's hand, then draw a card.\nIncrease the maximum value by the number of Tactics in your starting deck.
en.fluff: “In my home, in the civilized world, a general commands his forces. He does not rush and thrash about like some rabid hound.”

en.name: Viraxas: Prince
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Reset an allied non-Neutral unit's <keyword=order>Order</keyword> ability.\nAt the start of the round, while in hand or deck, evolve.
en.fluff: Parents often envy their children's strength and vigor. And children rarely notice it.

en.name: Rience
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Look at the top 3 units in your deck. Move 1 to your graveyard, then destroy an enemy unit with power equal to that unit's power\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Set the power of a unit to match the number of cards in your deck.
en.fluff: “I, Rience, taught her pain. With these hands, with these fingers. And I promised her that should you fall into my hands, princess, I would also teach you pain. With these hands, with these fingers…” - Rience

en.name: Yennefer: Illusionist
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> Yennefer's Illusion on this row.\nThe first time you <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a unit on your side of the battlefield each turn, damage the lowest-power enemy unit by the <keyword=spawn>Spawned</keyword> unit's base power.\n<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: Boost self by 1.
en.fluff: Have limited trust in your sight when a mage is around.

en.name: Usurper: Officer
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> an Operative on an enemy row and give it <keyword=spying>Spying</keyword>.\n<keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=seize>Seize</keyword> all <keyword=spying>Spying</keyword> Operatives.\nAt the start of the round, while in hand or deck, evolve.
en.fluff: He was an ordinary soldier until his mind was open to the madness around him.

en.name: Regis
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage all units on an enemy row by 1.\n<keyword=initiative>Initiative</keyword>: If any were destroyed, repeat this ability.
en.fluff: Some consider me a monster. A blood-crazed, savage monster.

en.name: Hemdall
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Deal 1 damage to random enemy units on a row, multiplied by the number of units on that row.
en.fluff: When the time of the White Frost comes, Hemdall will sound the call for battle.

en.name: Eithné: Young Queen
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Young Dryad on this row.\nAt the start of the round, while in hand or deck, evolve.
en.fluff: She used to instruct her Dryads to warn people two or even three times before shooting with lethal intention. Used to anyhow.

en.name: Munro Bruys
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Transform 1 allied Rowdy Dwarf into a Dwarf Berserker.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 2\n<keyword=barricade>Barricade</keyword>: Set the <keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword> to 1.
en.fluff: Munro dreamed of building steam and water-powered hammerworks. But he ended up as bouncer at the worst bar in Vizima…

en.name: Roche: Merciless
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 2.\n<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: Gain <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Blue Stripes Commando and <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> it to this row.
en.fluff: Fear does not befit us. Yet, there is a certain d'hoine... Vernon Roche. Be wary of him.

en.name: Harald an Craite
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Play a bronze Warrior from your graveyard, give it <keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword> and damage self by 2.\nAt the start of the round, while in hand or deck, evolve.
en.fluff: His battle with the bear made him a different man, no doubt. But many argue if for the better.

en.name: Gezras of Leyda
en.tooltip: <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>: At the end of your turn, move self to the <keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword> row and boost a random allied unit on this row by 1.\n<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>: At the end of your turn, move self to the <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword> row and damage a random enemy unit on the opposite row by 1.\n<keyword=adrenaline>Adrenaline</keyword> 3: Instead of a random unit, affect all other units on that row.
en.fluff: “Take a contract from Aen Seidhe over a dh'oine any day, as you’re far less likely to receive a knife between the ribs in place of coin.” ⁠— Gezras

en.name: Erland of Larvik
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost all units in your deck by 1.\n<keyword=adrenaline>Adrenaline</keyword> 3: Also gain <keyword=immune>Immunity</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Remove boosts from all units in your deck, then boost this unit by the same amount.
en.fluff: Erland founded the School of the Griffin, and hoped his emphasis on knightly values would help elevate the reputation of witchers among the common folk. Alas, his efforts would go in vain.

en.name: Fulmar
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play Tears of Siren.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Replace <keyword=rain>Rain</keyword> on an enemy row with <keyword=storm>Storm</keyword> of the same duration.
en.fluff: “Praise the Goddess for all the paths that she opens before you, and turn your greedy gaze away from those She closes in her wisdom” - Fulmar

en.name: The Witchfinder
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> 3 Syndicate Crowns.\nAt the end of your turn, if no enemy unit has a <keyword=bounty>Bounty</keyword>, place a <keyword=bounty>Bounty</keyword> on the highest-power enemy unit.
en.fluff: Woe to all those who find themselves on the wrong side of Octavia Hale, the self-proclaimed world-renowned finder⁠—and punisher⁠—of witches, warlocks, and were-things.

en.name: Sigismund Dijkstra
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Play a boosted unit from your deck.\nWhile in deck, whenever this unit receives a boost from other abilities, boost self by the same amount.
en.fluff: Checkmate... your majesty.

en.name: Professor
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Put a <keyword=bounty>Bounty</keyword> on an enemy unit and damage it by 4.\n<keyword=tribute>Tribute</keyword> 3: Ignore a target's <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.
en.fluff: I fear our conventicle may end disastrously for you.

en.name: Jacques: Miracle Child
en.tooltip: <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 4.\n<keyword=tribute>Tribute</keyword> 4: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> 2 Firesworn Zealots on this row.\nAt the start of the round, while in hand or deck, evolve.
en.fluff: As a child he loved two things: playing with his toy soldiers and a game called “Kill the Elf”.

en.name: Fallen Rayla
en.tooltip:
<keyword=veil>Veil</keyword>.
<keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 3.
<keyword=tribute>Tribute</keyword> 3: Remove <keyword=poison>Poison</keyword> from an allied unit, then boost self by 5.
Whenever your opponent plays a unit, <keyword=poison>Poison</keyword> it and remove a Counter.
When the Counter reaches 0, the <keyword=tribute>Tribute</keyword> becomes a <keyword=fee>Fee</keyword>. 
Counter: 2
en.fluff: Slain by the arrows of those she had hunted. Or so many thought. The Salamandra had different plans for her.

en.name: Filavandrel aén Fidháil
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): <keyword=create>Create</keyword> and play a Scoia'tael special card with a provision cost equal to this unit's power.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): <keyword=create>Create</keyword> and play a Scoia'tael special card with a provision cost equal to or lower than this unit's power.
en.fluff: He has pride⁠—the pride of someone who has never had to bow.

en.name: Yaga
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=sabbath>Sabbath</keyword>): Gain <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=consume>Consume</keyword> a 4-provision cost unit, then increase the provision value by 1.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 2
en.fluff: The Witch Queen sat upon her throne of bones, gorging herself on all and sucking the life out of everything that came her way. For centuries, she feasted, until one day, she could no longer stand at all. And so, she ate some more.

en.name: Boholt
en.tooltip: <keyword=formation>Formation</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a base copy of an allied bronze Soldier on its row.\nWhenever you <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Soldier, boost self by 2.
en.fluff: The bounty was often more than whatever the peasants were willing to offer, for the advance payments of lesser hunters also awaited the Reavers in the beasts' lairs.

en.name: Philippa: Blind Fury
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 4, then damage a random enemy unit by 3, then 2, then 1.
en.fluff: Philippa Eilhart, though very attractive, was decidedly very unkind.

en.name: Eist Tuirseach
en.tooltip:
<keyword=veteran>Veteran</keyword>.
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=bloodthirst>Bloodthirst</keyword> 3): Draw a card, then <keyword=discard>Discard</keyword> a card.
Whenever you <keyword=discard>Discard</keyword> a non-Neutral unit during your turn, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> it from your graveyard to this row.
Counter: 2
<keyword=devotion>Devotion</keyword>: Also works whenever a non-Neutral unit enters your graveyard during your turn.
en.fluff: Eist came to Cintra to help Crach an Craite win the hand of Princess Pavetta, yet wound up winning her mother's heart for himself.

en.name: Cyrus Engelkind Hemmelfart
en.tooltip:
<keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 4.
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play Congregation.
<keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 2: Destroy an allied Firesworn Token, then <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> a bronze Firesworn unit from your graveyard to the same position.
<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 1
en.fluff: Behind the Hierarch's pious pageant, his luxurious silks and exotic wines, his whores and slaves, beneath all that lust, greed, and vanity, stands an honorable man.

en.name: Mammuna
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=banish>Banish</keyword> a bronze unit from your graveyard and boost self by its power, then <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> a copy of it from your deck to this row.\n<keyword=sabbath>Sabbath</keyword>: Play the copy instead.
en.fluff: Finders keepers.

en.name: King of Beggars
en.tooltip:
<keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 1: Boost self by 1.
While in deck, whenever you pay a <keyword=tribute>Tribute</keyword>, remove a Counter for each <keyword=coin>Coin</keyword> spent. For each removed Counter, gain 1 <keyword=coin>Coin</keyword>.
When the Counter reaches 0, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> self from your deck to a random allied row.
Counter: 12
en.fluff: "You say tribute, I say taxes." ⁠— Francis Bedlam

en.name: Sihil
en.tooltip: Damage an enemy unit by 1.\n<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: Play a bronze card from your hand, then move Sihil back to your hand.\n<keyword=initiative>Initiative</keyword>: Also increase the damage by 1 for the rest of the game. If the damage was 3, transform into Masterful Sihil instead.
en.fluff: "What's written on this blade? That a curse?" "No. An insult."

en.name: Lilit's Omen
en.tooltip: <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> 2 non-Neutral units without <keyword=veil>Veil</keyword> from your deck to an allied row, then give them <keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword> and <keyword=rupture>Rupture</keyword>.
en.fluff: If you ever happen to witness what looks like the overwhelming shadow of humanity's hatred and cruelty suffocating the skies ... be thankful it's just an omen.

en.name: Ard Feainn
en.tooltip:
<keyword=resilient>Resilience</keyword>.
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Look at the top 2 cards from your deck, and choose one to move to the bottom.
If it was an Agent, give an enemy unit <keyword=spying>Spying</keyword>. If it was an Aristocrat, give an enemy unit <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> (2).
Whenever you play an Aristocrat, refresh the <keyword=order>Order</keyword>.
While in deck, when you play a gold Aristocrat, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> self to your <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword> row.
en.fluff: The Great Sun does not extend its light to those destined for the gutters.

en.name: Water of Brokilon
en.tooltip: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> 2 Dryad Fledglings on an allied row.
en.fluff: Drink, child. Wash away your past, your worries. Drink and become our sister!

en.name: Scorch
en.tooltip: Destroy the highest-power unit.\n<keyword=initiative>Initiative</keyword>: Destroy all highest-power units instead.
en.fluff: Geralt took one step back. He'd seen men hit by Scorch before. Or more accurately, seen what remained of them afterwards.

en.name: Garrison
en.tooltip: <keyword=resilient>Resilience</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play a base copy of a bronze Soldier from your starting deck.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Boost an allied Soldier and all its copies by 1 and give them 1 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.
en.fluff: Knock, knock… anybody home?

en.name: Count Reuven's Treasure
en.tooltip:
<keyword=resilient>Resilience</keyword>.
<keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 0.
Increase the <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> by 1 for each Crime in your starting deck.
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=create>Create</keyword> a bronze Crime with provisions equal or less to the excess <keyword=coin>Coins</keyword> gained from the <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword>.
Whenever you gain <keyword=coin>Coins</keyword>, gain Counters equal to excess amount gained.
At the end of your turn, lower the Counter by 1 and gain a <keyword=coin>Coin</keyword>.
Counter: 0
en.fluff: Dijkstra's famed profanity - expressed in more than words.

en.name: The Heist
en.tooltip: <keyword=echo>Echo</keyword>.\n<keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> 3 Cargos on an allied row.
en.fluff: Plan's simple: same as last time, but better.

en.name: Old Speartip
en.tooltip: No ability.
en.fluff: Oh, you're in a heap of trouble now…

en.name: Villentretenmerth
en.tooltip: <keyword=timer>Timer</keyword> 2: Destroy the highest-power unit on the battlefield, excluding self.
en.fluff: Also calls himself Borkh Three Jackdaws… he's not the best at names.

en.name: Alzur
en.tooltip: Whenever you play a Spell, <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a random unit with the same provision cost on this row.\nCounter: 3
en.fluff: A rebel… outcast... knight… even sorcerer if you can believe that.

en.name: Bloody Mistress
en.tooltip: <keyword=sabbath>Sabbath</keyword>: At the end of your turn, <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Gernichora's Fruit on each sides of this unit and transform self into Gernichora without changing power.
en.fluff: Once the effigy is on a tree, even the most virtuous of souls will find themselves inexplicably drawn toward her domain.

en.name: Eltibald
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=infused>Infuse</keyword> an enemy unit with "Whenever your opponent plays a card, damage self by 1".\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 3\nWhenever you play a Cursed card, reduce the <keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword> by 1.
en.fluff: A torturer, a doomsayer, a madman. Eltibald was the first mage to delve into the secrets of the Black Sun curse. He heeded the warnings found in ancient texts and started the widespread hunt for the cursed children. Never hesitated to follow the voice of lesser evil...

en.name: Brewess: Ritual
en.tooltip: <keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword>: <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> 2 random bronze <keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword> units from your deck to this row.
en.fluff: We'll cut you up, boy. A fine broth you'll make.

en.name: Triss: Telekinesis
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): <keyword=create>Create</keyword> and play a bronze special card from either player's starting deck.
en.fluff: Bindings won't suffice. Nor will a gag render her any less dangerous. No, dimeritium is the only solution.

en.name: Dandelion: Poet
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Draw a card, then play a card.
en.fluff: The quill is mightier than the sword.

en.name: Falibor
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 3.\n<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: Repeat the <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> ability and decrease the damage by 1.
en.fluff: From afar, he looks like a bear. From up close, well... A larger bear.

en.name: Damien de la Tour
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Reset your leader ability.
en.fluff: I served Beauclair well. At least... I hope I did.

en.name: Gerhart of Aelle
en.tooltip: <keyword=patience>Patience</keyword>.\n<keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=create>Create</keyword> and play a [4]-provision cost Spell.
en.fluff: Gerhart of Aelle, otherwise known as Hen Gedymdeith, was the oldest living sorcerer. That is, until his death on Thanedd Island during the coup, where his heart, feeble from inconceivable age, simply gave out among the ruckus.

en.name: Stefan Skellen
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play Ace up the Sleeve for each 3 Tactics in your starting deck.
en.fluff: My mark scars the face of our future empress. That is my proudest achievement.

en.name: Angoulême
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=create>Create</keyword> and play an artifact from your opponent's starting deck. If your opponent has no artifact in their starting deck, boost self by 6 instead.
en.fluff: Don't matter if it crawls, slithers, climbs—you name it, I've eaten it. As for things that fly... I once ate a kite just 'cause it had flour stuck to it.

en.name: Geralt: Axii
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=seize>Seize</keyword> a unit with power up to the number of allied Witchers on this row.
en.fluff: Placing his left arm around the horse's neck, Geralt makes the Axii sign with the fingers of his right hand above the steed's head and whispers the incantation.

en.name: Geralt: Professional
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage 3 units by 1. If you control another Witcher, also gain <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 3. If its power is a multiple of 3, destroy it instead.
en.fluff: I accepted a job once, did it. Asked to choose my reward, I invoked the Law of Surprise.

en.name: Geralt: Yrden
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Reset the power of all units on a row.\n<keyword=adrenaline>Adrenaline</keyword> 2: Reset the power of all units on an allied row instead.
en.fluff: He lay down next to Adda's mummified remains, drawing the Yrden Sign on the inner side of her sarcophagus' lid.

en.name: Brouver Hoog
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Gain 1 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword> for each Dwarf in your hand.\n<keyword=barricade>Barricade</keyword>: At the end of your turn, boost all Dwarves with <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword> on this row by 1, then lose 1 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.
en.fluff: That doddery dolt? Ye cannae even tell if he's alive or stuffed!

en.name: King Foltest
en.tooltip: The first time a bronze non-Neutral unit on your side of the battlefield is boosted each turn, <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a base copy of it at the bottom of your deck.\n<keyword=devotion>Devotion</keyword>: Also boost the <keyword=spawn>Spawned</keyword> copy by 1.\nAt the end of your turn, boost a unit to the right by 1.
en.fluff: Don't need advisors and their schemes. I place my trust in my soldiers' blades.

en.name: Vattier de Rideaux
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=lock>Lock</keyword> an enemy unit.\n<keyword=conspiracy>Conspiracy</keyword>: <keyword=seize>Seize</keyword> it instead.
en.fluff: There's never been a problem a well–planned assassination couldn't solve.

en.name: Saskia
en.tooltip:
<keyword=harmony>Harmony</keyword>.
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> an Elven Deadeye, Rowdy Dwarf, or Young Dryad on this row.
Gain an additional effect based on the unit you <keyword=spawn>Spawned</keyword>.
Elven Deadeye - Damage a random enemy unit by 2.
Rowdy Dwarf - Boost it by 3 and give it 1 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.
Young Dryad - Give it <keyword=vitality>Vitality</keyword> (3).
en.fluff: I care not for kings and their titles. In the east lives one who truly deserves a crown.

en.name: Vernossiel
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Each allied Elven Deadeye damages a random enemy unit by 2.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> 2 Elven Deadeyes on this row.
en.fluff: It turns out that the forest isn't inhabited by, to quote the captain of the guard, "some furry fucking thing", but Scoia'tael commandos. They were led by someone named Vernossiel…

en.name: Braathens
en.tooltip: <keyword=assimilate>Assimilate</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=create>Create</keyword> and play a bronze <keyword=disloyal>Disloyal</keyword> unit from your starting deck.
en.fluff: His name sounded so similar to “urchin” in Nilfgaardian that Braathens decided to turn him into one. Years later Emhyr paid the mage back in kind. Braathens sounds just like “fried” after all.

en.name: Forest Protector
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Play a bronze Nature card from your graveyard.
en.fluff: You know today is not your day when you go searching for firewood but the wood ends up seeing you as good fertilizer instead.

en.name: King Bran
en.tooltip: <keyword=veteran>Veteran</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost self by 0. Increase the value by 1 whenever excess damage is dealt to enemy units.\nAt the start of the game, trigger the <keyword=veteran>Veteran</keyword> ability of your units.
en.fluff: He lived life on his own terms—died on them, too.

en.name: Casimir Bassi
en.tooltip: <keyword=veil>Veil</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Spend all your <keyword=coin>Coins</keyword>, then boost self by the number of <keyword=coin>Coins</keyword> spent.\nOnce per turn, when you reach 0 <keyword=coin>Coins</keyword>, <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> Explosives on this row.
en.fluff: He would have done anything for love, but a fireworks display never quite felt this warranted.

en.name: Artis
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Play a 4-provision Cultist from your deck.\n<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>: Whenever a unit is played, damage it by half its power.
en.fluff: Not all Svalblod priests were forced from the isles... Unfortunately.

en.name: Wild Boar of the Sea
en.tooltip: <keyword=Deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Damage all damaged enemy units by 1, then damage all enemy units by 1.
en.fluff: Merely mention this name to a Nilfgaardian, and they'll feel a spreading warmth in their knickers…

en.name: Cerys an Craite
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Drummond Shieldmaiden on this row.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Drummond Queensguard on this row.
en.fluff: They call me Sparrowhawk. Know why? Because I eat rats like you for breakfast.

en.name: Milva: Sharpshooter
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 1.\n<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: Shuffle self back into your deck.\nWhenever an enemy unit moves during your turn, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> self from your deck to the opposite row, then damage it by 1.
en.fluff: Rarely did Milva hunt beasts larger than red deer or armor-clad men.

en.name: Lippy Gudmund
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Swap your graveyard with your deck.
en.fluff: The coast's picked clean since long! So we set our longships up the Yaruga – for gold and glory!

en.name: Sigi Reuven
en.tooltip: <keyword=intimidate>Intimidate</keyword>.\n<keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 4.\nFor every unique <keyword=gang>Gang</keyword> category in your starting deck, increase Sigi Reuven's initial <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> by 1.
en.fluff: You sure he don't look the least bit familar...?

en.name: Tinboy
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage all units on an enemy row by 2.\n<keyword=tribute>Tribute</keyword> 8: Damage all enemy units by 2 instead.
en.fluff: Tinboy's old man labored as a metalworker. On his sober days, he smelted tin. On his drinking days, he smelted his son's face.

en.name: Ulrich
en.tooltip: <keyword=intimidate>Intimidate</keyword>. \n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play a base copy of a bronze Firesworn unit from your hand.\n<keyword=devotion>Devotion</keyword>: Boost it by 2.
en.fluff: When the Order was disbanded, those who didn't join the witch hunters formed the Fallen Knights, of which Ulrich became the Grand Master.

en.name: Cleaver
en.tooltip:
<keyword=intimidate>Intimidate</keyword>.
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play Shakedown.
Increase this card's <keyword=intimidate>Intimidate</keyword> by 1 for each adjacent Crownsplitter.
<keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 4: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Cleaver's Muscle on this row.
en.fluff: Me hogs willnae go hungry th' day thanks to ye.

en.name: Korathi Heatwave
en.tooltip: <keyword=banish>Banish</keyword> a unit or an artifact.
en.fluff: Vicovaro scholars have determined that, in the absence of imperial aid, drought-stricken provinces lose half their population, two-thirds of their livestock and all their will to rebel.

en.name: Uma's Curse
en.tooltip: <keyword=create>Create</keyword> and play a gold unit from any faction.
en.fluff: I give you three solid leads, trails as fresh as morning dew, the aid of my spies and my court sorceress. Yet in my daughter's stead, you bring me this… monstrosity?

en.name: Vigo's Muzzle
en.tooltip: <keyword=lock>Lock</keyword> an enemy unit with 6 or less power and <keyword=seize>Seize</keyword> it.
en.fluff: Never has there been a beast Fringilla Vigo could not tame.

en.name: Aerondight
en.tooltip: <keyword=echo>Echo</keyword>.\nDamage an enemy unit by 0, then boost the lowest-power allied unit by the excess damage dealt.\nAt the end of your turn, if you have more points than your opponent, increase the damage by 1 wherever this card is.
en.fluff: A deceptively light blade, razor-sharp, and perfectly balanced.\n\nThe sword is said to only reveal itself to worthy champions and therefore spends most of its time hidden, patiently awaiting its next bearer.

en.name: Land of a Thousand Fables
en.tooltip: <keyword=resilient>Resilience</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Play a special card from your deck.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Transform a special card in your hand into a random unit of the same provision cost from the same faction.
en.fluff: The girls told me if I ever wished to visit alone, I need but crack open "The Land of a Thousand Fables" and utter out loud the incantation "Expecto ludum!"

en.name: Hive Mind
en.tooltip: Choose 4 different bronze Kikimore units.\nWhile in your graveyard, the first time you <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Drone on the battlefield each allied turn, transform it into the next chosen Kikimore unit.
en.fluff: A thousand mindless horrors, all racing toward you in perfect accord, relentless, ravenous.

en.name: Crimson Curse
en.tooltip: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> <keyword=blood_moon>Blood Moon</keyword> on an enemy row for 5 turns, then <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> 2 Ekimmaras on the opposite row.
en.fluff: When the moon burns red, latch the door and put your lambs to bed...

en.name: The Mushy Truffle
en.tooltip: <keyword=resilient>Resilience</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play a <keyword=bonded>Bonded</keyword> unit from your starting deck.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play Golden Froth.
en.fluff: Some drink to celebrate. Others, to forget. But here? Here we don't need no reason.

en.name: Coup de Grace
en.tooltip:
<keyword=echo>Echo</keyword>.
Damage an enemy unit by 3.
<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play a base copy of it.
<keyword=conspiracy>Conspiracy</keyword>: Always trigger the <keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword> ability.
en.fluff: Sometimes death is but a simple act of mercy.

en.name: Dragon's Dream
en.tooltip: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> <keyword=dragons_dream>Dragon's Dream</keyword> on an enemy row for 3 turns.
en.fluff: In Zerrikania, dragon worship dominates every aspect of daily life. Thus it comes as no surprise they name weapons in their honor.

en.name: Ornate Censer
en.tooltip: Boost an allied unit by the amount of damage dealt to enemy units this turn, or damage an enemy unit by the amount of boost given to allied units this turn.
en.fluff: The burner is suited for such tasks as warding off evil spirits, diffusing pleasant aromas, or creating spooky atmospheres for one’s lair.

en.name: Witches' Sabbath
en.tooltip: <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> up to 3 highest-power units from your opponent's graveyard to an enemy row, then <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> as many highest-power non-Neutral units from your graveyard to the opposite row and give them <keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.
en.fluff: For the sabbath, at least three witches are required. With two, it’s only a quarrel.

en.name: Svalblod Totem
en.tooltip:
<keyword=resilient>Resilience</keyword>.
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Svalblod Fanatic on each side of this card. 
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage an allied unit by 2.
<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 1
en.fluff: All totems to Svalblod were ordered destroyed, yet on distant, forgotten shores some yet stand tall... And continue to collect new victims.

en.name: Novigradian Justice
en.tooltip: Play a bronze Dwarf or Crownsplitter unit from your deck.\nIf you already control a Dwarf or Crownsplitter, also <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Cleaver's Muscle on your <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword> row.
en.fluff: "With both arms tied behind me back," recall ye said. So feel free to start kickin' me in the arse when the mood strikes ye.

en.name: Yghern
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Gain <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword> equal to the number of cards in your hand.\nIf this unit has no <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>, destroy self.
en.fluff: Its other name is scolopendromorph. Rarely used, as it's hard to say without spitting all over oneself.

en.name: Living Armor
en.tooltip: This unit's power is always equal to its <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.
en.fluff: Sure it's expensive. But considering how much you'll save on room and board, you'll get a return on the investment by the end of this century!

en.name: Radeyah
en.tooltip: If your starting deck has no duplicates,\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> your faction stratagem on this row.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): <keyword=create>Create</keyword> a Neutral stratagem on this row.
en.fluff: You can hide a lot behind a beautiful smile.

en.name: Avallac'h
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play Biting Frost, Impenetrable Fog, or Torrential Rain.
en.fluff: You humans have… unusual tastes.

en.name: Gaunter O'Dimm
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Give an enemy unit <keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Destroy a <keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword> enemy unit.
en.fluff: He always grants exactly what you wish for. That's the problem.

en.name: Lambert: Swordmaster
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit and all its copies by 2.
en.fluff: Go teach your grandma to suck eggs.

en.name: Plague Maiden
en.tooltip: <keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> 7 Rats on this row.
en.fluff: To bring down humanity, she will awaken her rats and send them to die in the happy city.

en.name: Eredin Bréacc Glas
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> <keyword=frost>Frost</keyword> on an enemy row for 2 turns.\n<keyword=dominance>Dominance</keyword>: Increase damage dealt by <keyword=frost>Frost</keyword> by 1
en.fluff: Any last words?

en.name: Jan Calveit
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Sort the cards in your deck from the highest to the lowest provision cost.\nAt the start of the game, move self up by one position in the deck for each Tactic in your starting deck.
en.fluff: “To prepare for the future, it’s best to first know it.”

en.name: The Scoundrel
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> the top bronze unit from your opponent's deck to the opposite row, then place a <keyword=bounty>Bounty</keyword> on it.\n<keyword=tribute>Tribute</keyword> 2: Choose a bronze unit to <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> instead, then place a <keyword=bounty>Bounty</keyword> on it.\n<keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 1: Damage the enemy unit with a <keyword=bounty>Bounty</keyword> by 1.
en.fluff: There have been sightings of a slender, sinister-looking man slipping in and out of shadow⁠. The Hales must be in town.

en.name: Ciri: Dash
en.tooltip: <keyword=timer>Timer</keyword> 4: Draw a card.
en.fluff: Know when fairy tales cease to be tales? When people start believing them.

en.name: Olaf
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Boost Olaf by twice the amount he is damaged.
en.fluff: 10-time winner of the venerable title of Champion of the An Skellig Arena.

en.name: Dandelion: Vainglory
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Destroy an enemy Beast.
en.fluff: Dandelion told me all about your adventures. How he'd ready you for battle with his songs, how he tamed the kayran by playin' his lute...

en.name: Allgod
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost 3 units in your deck by 2.\nIncrease the number of targets by 1 for each Offering in your starting deck.
en.fluff: Make your sacrifices or face divine anger! The food better be good or prepare to face my wrath nonetheless.

en.name: Arachas Queen
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=consume>Consume</keyword> an allied unit.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play Arachas Nest.\n<keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a base copy of the <keyword=consume>Consumed</keyword> unit on this row.
en.fluff: Her children inherited her beauty.

en.name: Saesenthessis: Blaze
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 1. \n<keyword=charge>Charges</keyword>: 5
en.fluff: I inherited my father's ability to assume other forms - well, one other form, in my case.

en.name: Dettlaff: Higher Vampire
en.tooltip: <keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword>: <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> self from your graveyard to the same row. \nThis unit's ability is limited to 2 uses and does not refresh when leaving the battlefield.
en.fluff: In his true form, the Beast of Beauclair could cause even a witcher to quake in his boots.

en.name: Dettlaff van der Eretein
en.tooltip:
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> <keyword=blood_moon>Blood Moon</keyword> on an enemy row for 2 turns. Increase the duration by 1 for each adjacent Vampire.
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit with <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> by 1.
<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> an Ekimmara on this row.
<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 1
en.fluff: He did not love like a man, but like an animal. Madly, deeply, unconditionally. Wildly.

en.name: Regis: Higher Vampire
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): <keyword=drain>Drain</keyword> an enemy by the amount of boost it has.
en.fluff: He becomes invisible at will. His glance hypnotizes into a deep sleep. He then drinks his fill, turns into a bat and flies off. Altogether uncouth.

en.name: Weavess: Incantation
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=consume>Consume</keyword> an allied unit.\n<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>: Whenever you play a unit with <keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword>, trigger its <keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword> ability.
en.fluff: I sense your pain. I see your fear.

en.name: Phoenix
en.tooltip: On round start, if Phoenix is in your graveyard, <keyword=banish>Banish</keyword> it, then <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> Phoenix Hatchling and <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> it to a random allied row.
en.fluff: What came first, the chicken or the egg? Compared to the conundrum that is the phoenix, that question seems downright trivial.

en.name: Regis: Bloodlust
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Damage an enemy unit by 4.\n<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: <keyword=banish>Banish</keyword> it.
en.fluff: I've been called a monster, a bloodthirsty freak. Among other, shall we say, more colorful names.

en.name: Gascon: Iron Falcon
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=create>Create</keyword> and play a bronze Neutral Bandit unit.
en.fluff: I'm doing what I used to do and they're paying me for it!

en.name: Runemage
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: For the rest of the game, your <keyword=create>Create</keyword> effects show you 5 options instead of 3. <keyword=create>Create</keyword> and play a Runestone.
en.fluff: To you, perhaps, they are mere rocks, but to me they are the cornerstones to building a new world. In each etch I see a city; in each resonance I hear the anthems of a generation!

en.name: Ihuarraquax
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Each player <keyword=summon>Summons</keyword> the highest-provision cost unit from their deck to their <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword> row.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Each player <keyword=summon>Summons</keyword> the lowest-provision cost unit from their deck to their <keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword> row.
en.fluff: "Inconceivable. Impossible," Ciri thought, returning to her senses. "Unicorns don't exist, not any more, not in this world. Unicorns are extinct."

en.name: Geralt of Rivia
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Destroy an enemy unit with 9 or more power.
en.fluff: If that's what it takes to save the world, it's better to let that world die.

en.name: Geralt: Aard
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Damage 3 enemy units by 2, then move them to the <keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword> row.
en.fluff: A blast of concentrated energy that pummels everything in its path. Great for when you forget your keys.

en.name: Bloody Baron
en.tooltip: <keyword=formation>Formation</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Reset the power of a unit.\n<keyword=inspired>Inspired</keyword>: If it was boosted, give it <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> equal to the amount of boost it lost.
en.fluff: I've not been a good father, I know, but… perhaps it's not too late.

en.name: Letho: Kingslayer
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Transform into a base copy of a unit without changing power.
en.fluff: Why does this monk wear studded gloves…?

en.name: Ivar Evil-Eye
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Swap this unit's power with an enemy unit.\n<keyword=adrenaline>Adrenaline</keyword> 2: Damage an enemy unit by 4 instead.
en.fluff: There’s a terrible tale behind each and every scar⁠—you’d be surprised just how many are true.

en.name: Koshchey
en.tooltip: <keyword=thrive>Thrive</keyword>.\nWhenever this unit's <keyword=thrive>Thrive</keyword> is triggered, <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Drone on this row.\n<keyword=adrenaline>Adrenaline</keyword> 4: Whenever this unit's <keyword=thrive>Thrive</keyword> is triggered, <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> an Endrega Larva on this row instead.
en.fluff: If I tell you koshchey is death, you'll go to the creek anyway, right?

en.name: Tissaia de Vries
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: At the end of this turn, reset the <keyword=order>Order</keyword> of all allied Mages that used their <keyword=order>Order</keyword> during this turn.
en.fluff: “They will not enter here. No one invited those royalist lackeys, who carry out the orders of their short-sighted kings!” - Tissaia de Vries

en.name: King Radovid V
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: If the base version of your leader ability has more than 1 <keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>, give it an additional <keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Repeat the <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> ability.
en.fluff: “They say it’s the game of kings. That chess teaches one to think strategically. What a load of rubbish! Both sides have identical pieces, the rules stay invariably the same. How does that mirror real life?”

en.name: Madoc
en.tooltip: Whenever you play a Bomb, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> self from your deck or graveyard to random allied row.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> <keyword=cataclysm>Cataclysm</keyword> on the opposite row for 1 turn, then destroy self.
en.fluff: In a flash, Madoc pulled out a leathery orb with a fuse, ignited it with a snap of his fingers, and tossed it at the feet of the caterwauling behemoth.

en.name: Francesca Findabair
en.tooltip:
<keyword=veil>Veil</keyword>.
Whenever you play a special card, remove one Counter.
Counter: 2
When the Counter reaches 0, <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play a base copy of the last special card you played. If it is Neutral, give it <keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.
en.fluff: Francesca Findabair's blue elven eyes were as impenetrable and hard as glass. When he was introduced to her, the Daisy of the Valleys smiled. The smile, though incredibly beautiful, filled the witcher with terror.

en.name: Yennefer of Vengerberg
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Damage all other units by 2. \n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Boost all other units by 2.
en.fluff: Magic is Chaos, Art and Science. It is a curse, a blessing and a progression.

en.name: Avallac'h: Sage
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Play an artifact from your deck.
en.fluff: Amongst the free elves were a handful of Aen Saevherne, or Sages. They were an enigma, bordering on a legend.

en.name: Ithlinne Aegli
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost a non-Neutral unit in hand by 4.
en.fluff: Famed for constantly prophesying the world's doom. Not much fun at parties.

en.name: Aguara: True Form
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): <keyword=create>Create</keyword> and play a special card from any faction.
en.fluff: Ever heard of an "anterion"? Think of it as the opposite of a lycanthrope: a beast which can take on human form.

en.name: Ramon Tyrconnel
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play a base copy of a bronze Soldier from your hand and give it 2 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.
en.fluff: Colonel Ramon Tyrconnel, the young commander of the "Ard Feainn" division, whistled softly, staring at a point somewhere off in the distance…

en.name: Eldain
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Transform all your face-up Traps into Elven Deadeyes.\n<keyword=devotion>Devotion</keyword>: Also transform your other artifacts.
en.fluff: The king once dispatched an envoy to Eldain… despite my advice to the contrary. Found the envoy the next day, eyes gouged out, shaft of his white flag jammed down his throat.

en.name: Melusine
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Gain <keyword=veil>Veil</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> <keyword=rain>Rain</keyword> on an enemy row for 2 turns then damage self by 2.\nAt the end of your turn damage adjacent units by 1, then gain 1 base power for every unit damaged. If any unit damaged was a Cultist, refresh this <keyword=order>Order</keyword>.
en.fluff: The Lady sits on her throne, devouring our offerings and demanding more. Yet, She does not try to rule over us in any particular way, so She is actually better than any jarl.

en.name: Geralt: Igni
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Destroy the highest-power units on an enemy row with a total of 40 or more power.\n<keyword=initiative>Initiative</keyword>: Destroy the highest-power units on an enemy row with a total of 25 or more power instead.
en.fluff: A twist of a witcher's fingers can light a lamp… or incinerate a foe.

en.name: Shani
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> a bronze Human unit from your graveyard to this row and give it <keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 7
en.fluff: I'm a medic. I tend to know what I'm doing when I prescribe something.

en.name: Geralt: Quen
en.tooltip: <keyword=shield>Shield</keyword>. \n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Play a Witcher from your deck.\n<keyword=adrenaline>Adrenaline</keyword> 4: Also give it a <keyword=shield>Shield</keyword>.
en.fluff: Geralt, feeling the iron taste of blood in his mouth, shouted a spell, throwing his hand out in front of him with his fingers open in the Quen Sign.

en.name: Arnaghad
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Gain 1 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword> for each damaged unit.\n<keyword=adrenaline>Adrenaline</keyword> 4: Whenever your opponent plays a unit on their side of the battlefield, it <keyword=clash>Clashes</keyword> with Arnaghad.
en.fluff: “A witcher’s job is to kill monsters and collect coin. No more, no less.” ⁠— Arnaghad

en.name: Crach an Craite
en.tooltip:
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Give 3 Pirates or Ships in your hand 2 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage a unit by 1.
<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 2
Whenever you play a Pirate or Ship next to Crach, it <keyword=clash>Clashes</keyword> with the lowest-power enemy unit.
en.fluff: Nilfgaardians call 'im Tirth ys Muire, the Wild Boar o' the Sea. Use 'im to scare their kiddies!

en.name: Ocvist
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage all enemy units by 1.
en.fluff: The Master of Quartz Mountain, the Destroyer, Trajan's Slayer. In his free time, he likes long walks and candlelight dinners.

en.name: Leo Bonhart
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Destroy an enemy unit with 9 or more power.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Destroy an enemy Witcher.
en.fluff: He would just sit there and stare at me, not saying a word. His eyes, they were… fish-like, somehow. No brows, no lashes… Just these balls of water, with a black stone sunk in each. He would devour me with those eyes in total silence. That frightened me more than the beatings.

en.name: Prince Anséis
en.tooltip: <keyword=formation>Formation</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 4.\n<keyword=inspired>Inspired</keyword>: <keyword=duel>Duel</keyword> an enemy unit instead.
en.fluff: Your presence at this tourney is an affront to my honor!

en.name: Free Company
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Choose an allied <keyword=bonded>Bonded</keyword> unit, then play its top copy from your deck.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 3
en.fluff: It's because we're free to do whatever we want! Ha, ha, ha!

en.name: Affan Hillergrand
en.tooltip: When you use your last leader <keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>, play this unit from your deck.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Boost all allied Soldiers with <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword> by 1.
en.fluff: Jarre doesn't mention him in his books. Maybe he never heard of him. Maybe he heard too much.

en.name: Dracoturtle
en.tooltip: Whenever this unit loses <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>, boost it by the amount of <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword> lost.\n<keyword=barricade>Barricade</keyword>: At the end of your turn, gain 1 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.
en.fluff: Oxenfurt monstrologists claim the brain of a dracoturtle is the size of a peanut. Its maw, however, is the size of a wide-open gate.

en.name: Vincent Van Moorlehem
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Destroy an enemy unit with status.
en.fluff: Everyone gives the Moorlehems a wide berth. Even tax collectors.

en.name: Enraged Ifrit
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 5.
