en.fluff: A certain mage thought them cute. It was his fate that gave rise to the saying "Don't play with fire…"

en.name: Aglaïs
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: On turn end, double the amount of boosts on self.
en.fluff: Brokilon bleeds… and not even I can heal it.

en.name: Rainfarn of Attre
en.tooltip: <keyword=disloyal>Disloyal</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost an allied unit by the combined power of units adjacent to self.
en.fluff: When Cintra fell, Attre followed, leaving its defenders a choice: accept the Nilfgaardian leash or die.

en.name: Queen Adalia
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play a base copy of a bronze non-Neutral unit from your hand, then give it a <keyword=shield>Shield</keyword>.
en.fluff: Queen Adalia of Cintra possessed the power to raise a drawbridge with a twitch of her brow. A frightening thought what she could do with a wave of her hand...

en.name: Grand Inquisitor Helveed
en.tooltip: <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 4.\n<keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 2: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Firesworn Zealot on this row.
en.fluff: No sinful wretch shall escape his fate in the Fire. Of that, I will make sure.

en.name: Morkvarg: Heart of Terror
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 1. Repeat until target is damaged.
en.fluff: He showed no mercy, didn't respect our laws or our gods. He knew how it must end. And it still didn't stop him.

en.name: Tyrggvi Tuirseach
en.tooltip: <keyword=veteran>Veteran</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Give an enemy unit <keyword=rupture>Rupture</keyword>.
en.fluff: It’s not betrayal if you side with the winner.

en.name: Colossal Ifrit
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage all units on the opposite row by 1.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 3
en.fluff: Can't stand the heat? Then you don't stand a chance.

en.name: Germain Piquant
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> 2 Cows to the right, then <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> 2 Cows to the left of this unit.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Cow on this row.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 3
en.fluff: The hero Toussaint needs, but not the one it deserves.

en.name: Schirrú
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Destroy all other units with power equal to Schirrú.
en.fluff: Time to look death in the face.

en.name: Kambi
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=discard>Discard</keyword> the rightmost card in your hand, then your opponent <keyword=discard>Discards</keyword> the rightmost card in their hand.
en.fluff: When the time comes, the cockerel Kambi shall crow and awaken Hemdall.

en.name: Crowmother
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> 2 Crows on this row.\nWhenever you play an Alchemy card, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> Crowmother from your graveyard to a random allied row.
en.fluff: Some crows learn human words. And some humans learn the language of the crows.

en.name: Cerys: Fearless
en.tooltip: After you've dealt damage to allied units 9 times, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> self from your deck to your <keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword> row.\n<keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=heal>Heal</keyword> an allied unit and damage another allied unit by the amount <keyword=heal>Healed</keyword>.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 1
en.fluff: “If you want something done, send your best man. If you want something done right, send a woman.”

en.name: Carlo Varese
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Damage an enemy unit by 1 for each card in your hand.
en.fluff: Everyone wantin' to trade in Novigrad's got a clear choice - agree terms with Cleaver or kiss their knees farewell.

en.name: Sandor de Baccalà
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Shuffle a card from your deck into your opponent's deck.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Drone at the bottom of your opponent's deck and set its power to the difference between the number of cards in the players' decks.\nWhenever a card enters or leaves your opponent's deck, boost self by 1.
en.fluff: Having been denied a rightful tract of land by his duke of an uncle, Sandor set out to build his own duchy from the ground up, starting with the realm of seedy, bottom-shelf operations within the Imperial Military Intelligence best suited for fools and madmen...

en.name: Whoreson Junior
en.tooltip:
<keyword=insanity>Insanity</keyword>.
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage a boosted enemy unit by 6. Gain a <keyword=coin>Coin</keyword> for each point of excess damage dealt.
<keyword=devotion>Devotion</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit instead.
<keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 3: Destroy an enemy unit with 3 or less power.
en.fluff: A war with Whoreson will see Novigrad's gutters run red with blood.

en.name: Joachim de Wett
en.tooltip: <keyword=disloyal>Disloyal</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Play the top non-<keyword=disloyal>Disloyal</keyword> unit from your deck and boost it by 8.
en.fluff: To describe the manner in which Duke de Wett led the Verden Group as "incompetent" would be far too kind.

en.name: Philippa Eilhart
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Spend a number of <keyword=coin>Coins</keyword> equal to an enemy unit's power, then <keyword=seize>Seize</keyword> it.
en.fluff: Soon the power of kings will wither, and the Lodge shall seize its rightful place.

en.name: Raffard’s Vengeance
en.tooltip:
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Play a bronze unit from your hand, then draw a card.
<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 5
<keyword=crew>Crew</keyword>: Whenever you play a unit next to this card, damage a random enemy unit by 2.
Mages contribute to this card's <keyword=crew>Crew</keyword> ability.
en.fluff: Step 1. Lock the long arm lever to the hook trigger, and place the load into the sling harness.\nStep 2. Set the counterweight to no less than eighty times the load, and line the glide track with pyrite.\nStep 3. Conjure and align the portal to target location, and unleash hell.

en.name: Dagur Two Blades
en.tooltip: <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>: Whenever an enemy takes damage, boost self by 1.
en.fluff: Shields are for flower-pickin' saps.

en.name: Ragh Nar Roog
en.tooltip: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> <keyword=cataclysm>Cataclysm</keyword> on an enemy row for 4 turns.
en.fluff: In the Final Age, Hemdall will come forth to face the evil issuing from the land of Morhogg – the legions of wraiths, demons and specters of Chaos.

en.name: Royal Decree
en.tooltip: Play a unit from your deck.
en.fluff: We, Foltest, by divine right King of Temeria, Prince of Sodden, Senior Protector of Brugge, etcetera, etcetera, do hereby decree the following…

en.name: Hen Gaidth Sword
en.tooltip: <keyword=echo>Echo</keyword>.\nDamage an enemy unit by 5, then <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play a base copy of the stored unit and give it <keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.\n<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: <keyword=banish>Banish</keyword> the unit and store its soul in the Hen Gaidth Sword.
en.fluff: Legend tells that wounds carved from this blade never heal. Blood shall flow until not a drop remains...

en.name: Golden Nekker
en.tooltip: If your starting deck does not have cards with a provision cost of 10 or more, play the top unit, special and artifact from your deck.
en.fluff: For what seems like centuries, the most brilliant minds in the world⁠—from theorists to fanatics⁠—have frequently gathered to speculate and debate the purpose of the Golden Nekker. Although they have not yet agreed upon the nature and origin of the strange, elusive statuette, they vow to have an answer “soon”.

en.name: Naglfar
en.tooltip: Look at 2 random gold cards from your deck, then play one and move the other back to the top of it.
en.fluff: Waves pummel the shore, waves pushed by the prow of the spectral Naglfar. Hemdall's horn rings in the air, and Hemdall stands facing his enemies atop Bifrost, the burning rainbow. The White Frost is nigh, nigh is the time of gale and storm…

en.name: Abduction
en.tooltip: <keyword=echo>Echo</keyword>.\nPlay a unit that isn't from your opponent's starting deck from their deck with a provision cost of 10 or less. Boost it by 1 for each provision below the limit.
en.fluff: Steady, steady, just a little lower... There we go. That thing ate the Captain's helmet. We'll need to get it back.

en.name: Yennefer's Invocation
en.tooltip: Move an enemy unit to the top of your deck.
en.fluff: It's best not to get in Yennefer's way. Especially when she's in a hurry.

en.name: Call of the Forest
en.tooltip: Play a non-Neutral unit from your deck and boost it by 1.
en.fluff: I hold Brokilon dearer than my own life. She is a mother who cares for her children. I will defend her to my final breath.

en.name: Shaping Nature
en.tooltip:
<keyword=echo>Echo</keyword>.
Choose one:
Boost an allied unit by 7 and give it <keyword=veil>Veil</keyword>.
Boost an allied unit by 9.
Boost an allied unit by 6 and give it <keyword=vitality>Vitality</keyword> (6).
en.fluff: You talk to me of kings and princes. Who are they? Those whom I know are white skeletons lying in the necropolises of Craag An, deep in the forest.

en.name: Ring of Favor
en.tooltip:
This card starts in your hand.
Boost an allied unit by 3.
While in hand, at the end of your turn, increase the boost by 2.
When your opponent passes, <keyword=banish>Banish</keyword> self from hand and draw a card. 
When moved to the deck, <keyword=banish>Banish</keyword> self.
en.fluff: Wearing it provides its bearer with a surge of lucky encounters, like meeting a friendly stranger or stumbling upon a treasure. Although, some say such happenings are mere coincidence.

en.name: Curse of Corruption
en.tooltip: Destroy the highest-power unit.
en.fluff: Black magic – the grislier the better.

en.name: Vivaldi Bank
en.tooltip: <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 3.\nLook at the top card from your deck plus an additional card for every <keyword=coin>Coin</keyword> you possess. Play the top card for free, or play another card for a <keyword=coin>Coin</keyword> cost equal to its distance from the top. Shuffle the remaining cards back into your deck.
en.fluff: We're sorry to lose your business, but we wish ye well with those dunderhe-- er... With those fine folk over at Cianfanelli Bank.

en.name: Collusion
en.tooltip:
If you control a unit with the gang category:
Blindeyes - Increase all other effects by 1.
Crownsplitters - Boost the lowest-power allied unit by 4.
Cutups - Damage the highest-power enemy unit by 4.
Firesworn - <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> 2 Firesworn Zealot on a random allied row.
Tidecloaks - Gain 4 <keyword=coin>Coins</keyword>.
en.fluff: There's enough gold in this city for everyone. Well, at least for us.

en.name: Dies Irae
en.tooltip: <keyword=echo>Echo</keyword>.\nDamage an enemy unit by 3 and boost all allied Firesworn units by 1.\n<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: Boost all allied units instead.
en.fluff: The righteous wrath of the Eternal Fire! Justice of the Flaming Rose!

en.name: Tainted Ale
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage a unit by 2. \n<keyword=charge>Charges</keyword>: 3
en.fluff: That beer supposed to be green…?

en.name: Frightener: Dormant
en.tooltip: After 3 allied units are destroyed, awaken Frightener.
en.fluff: ”What have I done?” the mage cried out, frightened of his own creation.

en.name: Knighthood
en.tooltip: Play a Knight from your deck and boost it by 1 for each Knight you control.
en.fluff: Kneel an everyman, arise a knight!

en.name: Drakenborg
en.tooltip: <keyword=resilient>Resilience</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> a unit from your deck to this row, <keyword=lock>Lock</keyword> it and remove its boost.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Boost an allied unit by 0. Increase this value by the amount of boost that was removed.
en.fluff: It's not exactly a holiday, no, but there is plenty of singing, if that's what you're into.

en.name: Magic Compass
en.tooltip: <keyword=echo>Echo</keyword>.\nLook at the top 3 cards in your deck. Play one, then move the rest to your graveyard.\nIf there are fewer than 3 cards in your deck, <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play a Legendary card from your faction that was not in your starting deck instead.
en.fluff: Helps you find exactly what you need. Or what you think you need.

en.name: Olgierd: Immortal
en.tooltip: This card's power cannot be changed by other abilities.
en.fluff: All of my dreams have come true. Unfortunately.

en.name: Ciri: Nova
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: If your starting deck does not have cards with a provision cost of 10 or more, gain <keyword=resilient>Resilience</keyword>, <keyword=shield>Shield</keyword> and <keyword=veil>Veil</keyword>.
en.fluff: Zireael possesses a great power she cannot control. She is a danger - to herself, to others. Until she learns to control it, she should remain isolated.

en.name: Caretaker
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=purify>Purify</keyword> a unit.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 2
en.fluff: There are more things in heaven and earth than all the world's philosophers have dreamt.

en.name: Ignatius Hale
en.tooltip: At the start of the game, or when <keyword=spawn>Spawned</keyword>, set own power to 1.\nWhile in hand, deck, or on the battlefield, whenever an enemy unit with a <keyword=bounty>Bounty</keyword> is destroyed, <keyword=heal>Heal</keyword> self by its base power.
en.fluff: He’s a good boy.

en.name: Eskel: Pathfinder
en.tooltip: <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>: At the end of your turn, boost self by 1.
en.fluff: Heard you panting from three miles away. Just didn't wanna give up that vantage point.

en.name: Cave Troll
en.tooltip: <keyword=defender>Defender</keyword>.
en.fluff: Trolls have very tiny brains and huge stomachs. That's a very dangerous combination.

en.name: Matta Hu'uri
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): If neither player has passed and your opponent's hand is not full, they draw the lowest-cost card, and you draw the highest-cost card.
en.fluff: Sorceresses use magic to hypnotize. I use dance.

en.name: Master Mirror
en.tooltip: <keyword=veil>Veil</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Transform the leftmost card in your hand into a random legendary card from your faction that was not in your starting deck.\nRepeat this ability whenever you play the rightmost card from your hand.
en.fluff: Some figures prefer to always remain hidden while playing the role of shadow in the most crucial events in history. One figure especially, to be precise.

en.name: Miruna
en.tooltip: <keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword>: <keyword=seize>Seize</keyword> a random enemy unit with 4 or less power.
en.fluff: Why fight? There are much better ways to work off excess energy…

en.name: Cahir Dyffryn
en.tooltip: <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>: Whenever an enemy unit receives a boost during your turn, boost self by the same amount.
en.fluff: His eyes flashed under his winged helmet. Fire gleamed from his sword's blade.

en.name: Maraal
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=poison>Poison</keyword> an enemy unit.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): <keyword=poison>Poison</keyword> an enemy unit.
en.fluff: I know how to kill in a thousand and one ways.

en.name: Cosimo Malaspina
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Transform adjacent units into random units that cost 1 provision more.
en.fluff: Children keep asking him for gifts. He doesn’t know why, but it really helps with finding subjects for his experiments.

en.name: Yennefer: Conjurer
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Deal 1 damage to the highest-power enemy units.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown:</keyword> 1
en.fluff: A good sorceress must know when to conjure ice… and when to conjure fire.

en.name: Unicorn
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost an allied unit by 3. If you control Chironex, boost it by 6 instead.\nIf you have Chironex in your hand, play it, then draw a card.
en.fluff: They say unicorns are fond of virgins. Since finding a virgin these days is as hard as finding a unicorn, no one has been able to verify the theory.

en.name: Chironex
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 3. If you control Unicorn, damage it by 6 instead.\nIf you have Unicorn in your hand, play it, then draw a card.
en.fluff: "Gods, that's no unicorn! That's…!" – the last words of Vilemar, a famed collector of curiosities.

en.name: Triss: Butterflies
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Shuffle a card from your hand into your deck, then draw a unit of your choice and boost it by 3.
en.fluff: Cap'n… our arrows, they've… they've got wings!

en.name: Primordial D'ao
en.tooltip: <keyword=shield>Shield</keyword>.
en.fluff: How do you fight an earth elemental? You don't. You run. Fast as you can.

en.name: Saesenthessis
en.tooltip: <keyword=immune>Immunity</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Remove this unit's <keyword=immune>Immunity</keyword> until the start of your next turn.
en.fluff: I inherited my father's ability to assume other forms - well, one other form, in my case.

en.name: Donimir of Troy
en.tooltip: <keyword=defender>Defender</keyword>. <keyword=shield>Shield</keyword>.
en.fluff: I fought twice at Sodden and lived. I think you can surmise I'm not so bad at this sword thing.

en.name: Queen Meve
en.tooltip: <keyword=timer>Timer</keyword> 3 (<keyword=inspired>Inspired</keyword>): Boost all allied units by 1 and reset the <keyword=timer>Timer</keyword>.\nWhenever this unit receives a boost, gain 1 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.
en.fluff: We're at war, when rulers don't strive nor choose. When rulers grasp sword and shield and ride out to defend their subjects.

en.name: Ciri
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage 3 enemy units by 1.\nWhen you lose a round, return this unit to your hand.
en.fluff: I go wherever I please, whenever I please.

en.name: Vesemir: Mentor
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost all Witchers you control by 1.\n<keyword=adrenaline>Adrenaline</keyword> 4: Also boost all Witchers in your hand and deck.
en.fluff: Killing monsters is not something to be taken lightly. Ciri must understand that if she's to become one of us.

en.name: Caranthir Ar-Feiniel
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a 1-power base copy of a non-Neutral unit with a provision cost of 10 or less from your hand on this row.
en.fluff: A favorite son who chose a life of villainy.

en.name: Vilgefortz
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Destroy an enemy unit, then your opponent <keyword=summon>Summons</keyword> the top unit from their deck to a random enemy row.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Destroy an allied unit, then <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> the top unit from your deck to a random allied row.
en.fluff: We are all pawns on his board. Playing a game whose rules we do not know.

en.name: Xarthisius
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=reveal>Reveal</keyword> a random card in your deck. If it's a unit, boost self by its power and shuffle it back. If it's an artifact or a special card, play it.
en.fluff: Astrology, hydromancy, haruspicy, ceromancy. Ovomancy, spodomancy, metroscopy, brontoscopy…

en.name: Vandergrift
en.tooltip: <keyword=resilient>Resilience</keyword>, <keyword=shield>Shield</keyword>.\n<keyword=grace>Grace</keyword> 12: Gain <keyword=resilient>Resilience</keyword>.
en.fluff: The general thought the war for the Lormark would end quickly, with minimal losses… yet wound up fighting it for all eternity.

en.name: Orianna
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Give an enemy unit <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> equal to the number of allied Vampires.\n<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>: At the end of your turn, boost self by the number of <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> enemy units.
en.fluff: Lady Orianna's been a blessin' for us... She 'elps the beggarly, supports the arts – why, she even runs a home for them poor orphans!

en.name: Figgis Merluzzo
en.tooltip: <keyword=defender>Defender</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Move self to the other row.
en.fluff: I'm a simple guy. I like drinking, eating, singing lewd songs… And when the party dies down, pissing on the dying bonfire.

en.name: Ildiko
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Boost an allied unit by 4.\nWhenever you play a non-Neutral unit, give it <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>.
en.fluff: The necklace was Ildiko’s gift to king Belohun in honor of their impending marriage. By choking the old fool, it solved that problem quite nicely.

en.name: Saber-Tooth Tiger
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Transform self into Saber-Tooth Tiger: Stealth.
en.fluff: The prized possession of a royal menagerie, until a commando of Scoia'tael assaulted the exhibition, released the beast, and set it upon its cruel masters. Since that day, it has acquired a selective taste for human flesh.

en.name: Keira Metz
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Give adjacent units <keyword=vitality>Vitality</keyword> equal to their base powers.
en.fluff: If I'm to die today, I wish to look smashing for the occasion.

en.name: Dandelion
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Boost a unit in your deck by 2.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 2\n<keyword=inspired>Inspired</keyword>: At the end of your turn, boost the top unit in your deck by 1.
en.fluff: Dandelion, you're a cynic, a lecher, a liar – and my best friend.

en.name: Priscilla
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=heal>Heal</keyword> an allied unit by 4 and reset its <keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>.\n<keyword=inspired>Inspired</keyword>: Boost an allied unit by 4 and reset its <keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword> instead.
en.fluff: Picture Dandelion in a dress and you've got the general idea.

en.name: Shilard Fitz-Oesterlen
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Set the power of the highest-power unit in your opponent's hand to 1.
en.fluff: A diplomat is a man who uses many more words than necessary to express much less than he knows.

en.name: Kikimore Queen
en.tooltip: <keyword=thrive>Thrive</keyword>.\nWhenever this unit's <keyword=thrive>Thrive</keyword> is triggered, boost all allied Insectoids on this row by 1.\nWhenever you play an Organic card, trigger own <keyword=thrive>Thrive</keyword>.
en.fluff: Many insectoids live in a matriarchy. A bloody one at that.

en.name: Dire Bear
en.tooltip: Units on this row and the opposite row can't be boosted.\n<keyword=berserk>Berserk</keyword> 7: Affects only the opposite row.
en.fluff: After countless attempts to slay the savage beast, one could now easily consider it… a mobile armory.

en.name: Archgriffin
en.tooltip: At the end of the round, shuffle this card back into your deck, keeping its boost.
en.fluff: Considered the embodiment of courage, loyalty and fighting spirit, the very essence of what Griffin Witchers are known for. However, the School of the Griffin was actually named after a knight errant known as "Gryphon", who had long ago instilled these values into its founder.

en.name: Yarpen Zigrin
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 3.\n<keyword=barricade>Barricade</keyword>: At the end of your turn, lose <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword> and boost self by that much.
en.fluff: Ever hear o' the dragon Ocvist? From Quartz Mountain? Well, Yarpen Zigrin and his band o' dwarves did 'im in.

en.name: Seltkirk of Gulet
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): <keyword=duel>Duel</keyword> an enemy unit.
en.fluff: Though famed for his many virtues, his indomitable courage first and foremost, Seltkirk was not spared the fate which met all those killed in the Battle of Upper Aedirn.

en.name: Ruehin
en.tooltip: <keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword>: <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> self from your graveyard to your <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword> row and <keyword=consume>Consume</keyword> your lowest-power unit, excluding self.
en.fluff: No one has ever entered that forest and lived to tell the tale…

en.name: Imlerith
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Draw a card, then <keyword=discard>Discard</keyword> a card. If the <keyword=discard>Discarded</keyword> card was a unit, boost self by its power.
en.fluff: The sisters said you would come. They saw you arrive in the water's surface.

en.name: Covenant of Steel
en.tooltip: <keyword=defender>Defender</keyword>.\n<keyword=berserk>Berserk</keyword> 6: At the end of your turn, gain 1 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.
en.fluff: If you want to give Skelligers a laugh, tell them they're outnumbered.

en.name: Gabor Zigrin
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Gain <keyword=resilient>Resilience</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Gain <keyword=immune>Immunity</keyword>.\nWhenever you play a Dwarf, boost self by 1.
en.fluff: Brouver Hoog wanted to kick him out of Mahakam once for having a llama in his living room… it's a long story.

en.name: Anna Henrietta
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Replace your leader ability with a base copy of your opponent's leader ability.
en.fluff: As head of state, I must judge her fairly. But she is my sister, thus my heart bleeds for her…

en.name: Idr
en.tooltip: Whenever your opponent plays a unit on their side of the battlefield, damage it by 1 and gain a <keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Drone on this row.\n<keyword=charge>Charges</keyword>: 0
en.fluff: "Who's a good boy?" ⁠— Idarran

en.name: Coral
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Draw a card, then <keyword=discard>Discard</keyword> a card.\nWhenever you <keyword=discard>Discard</keyword> a card, damage a random enemy unit by 2.
en.fluff: Her true name's Astrid Lyttneyd Ásgeirrfinnbjornsdottir, but that never fit on any forms.

en.name: Vernon Roche
en.tooltip: <keyword=disloyal>Disloyal</keyword>. \n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Play the top 2 cards from your deck.
en.fluff: A patriot… and a real pain in the rear.

en.name: Iorveth
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Return an allied Trap to your hand, then play a Trap.
en.fluff: King or beggar, what's the difference? One dh'oine less.

en.name: Zoltan Chivay
en.tooltip: <keyword=resilient>Resilience</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost adjacent Dwarves by 2.
en.fluff: Drinkin' alone's like crappin' with company.

en.name: Stregobor
en.tooltip: <keyword=timer>Timer</keyword> 2 (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Each player draws a unit and sets its power to 1.
en.fluff: The witcher had met thieves that looked like town councilors, town councilors that looked like beggars and kings that looked like thieves. Stregobor, though, always looked exactly like the commonly accepted imagining of what a mage should look like.

en.name: Gimpy Gerwin
en.tooltip: Whenever you play another unit, damage all enemy units with the same provision cost by 1.
en.fluff: Keep the vermin on a short leash. And don't be afraid to use that whip!

en.name: Glustyworp
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Destroy all units with 1 power. For each unit destroyed, boost self by 2.
en.fluff: The swamp underfoot suddenly exploded with a powerful splash. Two long, mantis-like forelimbs bristling with spikes shot out from the murk. The monstrous, green hooks seized an unlucky footman, dragging him beneath the water's surface.

en.name: Madame Luiza
en.tooltip: <keyword=intimidate>Intimidate</keyword>.\n<keyword=tribute>Tribute</keyword> 3: Gain <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Your next <keyword=tribute>Tribute</keyword> this round costs 0.
en.fluff: We've bedded more men than all Redania's army barracks combined.

en.name: Sukrus
en.tooltip: Prevent the unit to the left of Sukrus from taking any damage.
en.fluff: One of many who sought fortune in Novigrad. And one of many more who never found it.

en.name: Savolla
en.tooltip: <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 2.\n<keyword=tribute>Tribute</keyword> 9: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> Savolla's Frightener on this row.
en.fluff: Witcher mutagens are a forgotten treasure. It's time the world learned of their potential.

en.name: Ivo of Belhaven
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Damage an enemy unit by 2.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 2\nWhenever you play a Witcher, decrease the <keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword> by 1.
en.fluff: It's not reason I'm devoid of, just emotion.

en.name: Igor the Hook
en.tooltip: <keyword=insanity>Insanity</keyword>.\n<keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 5: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> a base copy of a bronze allied unit to Igor's row.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 1
en.fluff: In the left corner, a bloodthirsty shaelmaar, and in the right co--oh bollocks... Fight's over, hold your bets!

en.name: Roach
en.tooltip: Whenever you play a gold card, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> this unit from your deck to a random allied row.
en.fluff: Geralt, we gotta have a man–to–horse talk. No offense, but your riding skills? They leave a bit to be desired, buddy.

en.name: Katakan
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> an Ekimmara on this row.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 4\nReduce the <keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword> by 1 whenever <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> is applied to an enemy unit.
en.fluff: Drinking the blood of the Continent since the Conjunction.

en.name: Gregoire de Gorgon
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Damage an enemy unit by 1.\n<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: Boost self by 5 and gain a <keyword=shield>Shield</keyword>.
en.fluff: Gregoire? That mountain o' muscle wrapped in armor? Course, I 'eard of 'im! Who hasn't?

en.name: Imke
en.tooltip: <keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>: At the end of your turn, gain 2 <keyword=coin>Coins</keyword>.\n<keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 3: Gain a <keyword=shield>Shield</keyword>.
en.fluff: No sooner had she caught Gudrun's attention than sought to exploit it.

en.name: The Sausage Maker
en.tooltip: <keyword=intimidate>Intimidate</keyword>.\n<keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 3.\n<keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 3 (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Gain <keyword=resilient>Resilience</keyword>.
en.fluff: Body disposal and sausage makin', that's what I do. And judgin' by that expression, I'd say ye already ken th' answer to your follow-up question.

en.name: Azar Javed
en.tooltip: <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 3.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Scarab on this row.\n<keyword=tribute>Tribute</keyword> 3: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> 2 Scarabs on this row instead.
en.fluff: Azar Javed's specialty is the element of fire. The sorcerer not only deftly manipulates the power of fire, it can be said that fire has become a part of his very being.

en.name: Ffion var Gaernel
en.tooltip: <keyword=defender>Defender</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play Battle Preparation.
en.fluff: Everyone will die somehow. I'll die last.

en.name: Hjalmar an Craite
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): <keyword=banish>Banish</keyword> a unit in your graveyard and damage an enemy unit by its power.
en.fluff: Instead of mournin' the fallen, let's drink to their memory!

en.name: She-Troll of Vergen
en.tooltip: <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>: Whenever a unit is destroyed during your turn, boost self by 2.
en.fluff: Lover of elf and onion soup.

en.name: Protofleder
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Give an enemy unit <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> (3), then boost self by the amount of <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> on that unit.
en.fluff: Limited to only one region of the Continent, scholars consider them critically endangered. Gods be praised...

en.name: Vanadáin
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Move up to 2 cards from your hand to the bottom of your deck. Add Waylay to your hand for each card moved that way.\nWhenever you play Waylay, <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> an Elven Deadeye on this row.
en.fluff: It’s better to first gag humans, then listen to what they have to say.

en.name: Lydia van Bredevoort
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): <keyword=create>Create</keyword> and play a bronze special card from your opponent's faction.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Play a bronze special card from your opponent's graveyard.
en.fluff: Whether by brush or by sorcery, there was no event, emotion, or scene beyond Lydia's power to depict. Apart from joy.

en.name: Ele'yas
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Destroy an allied unit, then <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> 2 Elven Deadeyes on this row.
en.fluff: Love justifies madness in any of its forms.

en.name: The Flying Redanian
en.tooltip: <keyword=hoard>Hoard</keyword> 9: On turn end, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> this unit from your deck or graveyard to a random allied row.
en.fluff: Legend tells of a Redanian crew from generations past who unearthed a treasure so great they became forever destined to argue amongst themselves on how to divide their spoils.

en.name: Nenneke
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Boost a unit by 1. \n<keyword=charge>Charges</keyword>: 4
en.fluff: Few know more about healing than Nenneke.

en.name: Vivienne: Oriole
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost self by the provision cost of the card on the right.
en.fluff: Who'd not like to live free as a bird? Well, just ask Vivienne de Tabris.

en.name: Junod of Belhaven
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Destroy a damaged enemy unit.
en.fluff: Rumour has it he was born of an unusual love between a lady giant and one VERY brave dwarf.

en.name: Keldar
en.tooltip: Whenever you play a special card, <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Witcher Student on this row. \n<keyword=adrenaline>Adrenaline</keyword> 4: At the end of your turn, <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Witcher Student on this row.
en.fluff: “You blunt, brainless humanoids! What do you mean by ‘I don't know?’. You would go hunt the vampires with the Lebioda idol, smeared in garlic!” ⁠— Keldar

en.name: The Maiden's Shield
en.tooltip:
<keyword=shield>Shield</keyword>.
<keyword=grace>Grace</keyword> 8: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> Bronwen the Bold on the right.
<keyword=grace>Grace</keyword> 14: Boost the allied Bronwen the Bold by 3.
<keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword>: <keyword=lock>Lock</keyword> the allied Bronwen the Bold.
en.fluff: Her great, quiet guardian, now known to most only as Scruffy, had soon abandoned his old name after meeting fierce little Bronwen for the first time. In this tribulation, he saw his one opportunity for penance.

en.name: Milaen
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Damage an enemy unit by 4.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Damage 4 enemy units by 1.
en.fluff: The old baron treated poachers mercilessly. Luckily for Milaen, the old baron was dead and his men, desperate outlaws.

en.name: Artorius Vigo
en.tooltip: <keyword=assimilate>Assimilate</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=create>Create</keyword> and play a 1-power copy of a bronze unit from your starting deck.
en.fluff: It is said he created an illusion so realistic that he began to believe it himself...

en.name: Salamander
en.tooltip:
<keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 1.
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=poison>Poison</keyword> a unit. 
<keyword=tribute>Tribute</keyword> 9: <keyword=poison>Poison</keyword> all units on the battlefield instead.
Increase the <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> by 1 for each allied Salamandra unit.
en.fluff: Despite their cute little faces, it's best to avoid petting them, as the salamander, when threatened, secretes a deadly toxin that boils the very skin it comes into contact with.

en.name: Kelpie
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> <keyword=rain>Rain</keyword> on an enemy row for 0 turns. This value is increased by 1 for each 3 Beasts in your starting deck.\nWhenever an enemy unit takes damage from <keyword=rain>Rain</keyword> or <keyword=storm>Storm</keyword>, boost a random unboosted allied Beast by 1.
en.fluff: Tis a malevolent spirit! 'Tis animated seaweed! Nay, ye hallucinatin' dolts, 'tis clearly a horse!

en.name: Kolgrim
en.tooltip: <keyword=adrenaline>Adrenaline</keyword> 1: At the end of your turn, boost self by the difference between the number of cards in the players' decks.
en.fluff: Fortune only smiled upon him if it was accompanied by a stroke of very bad luck.

en.name: Éibhear Hattori
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=create>Create</keyword> and play a Trap card from your starting deck.
en.fluff: Only thing that can rival his swords? His dumplings.

en.name: Moreelse
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 4.\n<keyword=tribute>Tribute</keyword> 6: Destroy it instead.
en.fluff: Some witch hunters truly believed the eradication of mages and sorceresses would make the world a better place. Moreelse did not require such a lofty justification.

en.name: Bincy Blumerholdt
en.tooltip: <keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>: Whenever you gain <keyword=coin>Coins</keyword>, boost self by 1 for each <keyword=coin>Coin</keyword> gained.
en.fluff: In all Novigrad, she has the hairiest feet and the stickiest hands.

en.name: Graden
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Destroy the enemy unit with a <keyword=bounty>Bounty</keyword>.\n<keyword=tribute>Tribute</keyword> 5: Boost self by that unit's base power.
en.fluff: Initially, we burned any tomes on black magic we found. Recently we decided it might be wise to read them first.

en.name: Wolfsbane
en.tooltip: Damage all units with even power by 2, or damage all units with odd power by 2.
en.fluff: Also known as 'the queen of poisons,' wolfsbane is used in many witcher Potions and alchemic brews.

en.name: Imlerith's Wrath
en.tooltip: Damage an enemy unit by the power of your highest-power unit. If it was on a row with <keyword=frost>Frost</keyword>, destroy it instead.
en.fluff: He boasted that no weapon would ever pierce his armor. And he was right — even in death.

en.name: Whispering Hillock
en.tooltip: Play a <keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword> unit from your deck.
en.fluff: It will rise again. Elsewhere, beyond our reach. Blood will flow once more.

en.name: Ard Gaeth
en.tooltip: <keyword=echo>Echo</keyword>.\n<keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> <keyword=frost>Frost</keyword> on both enemy rows for 3 turns.
en.fluff: Very useful for travels to other dimensions and bringing apocalypse upon the world.

en.name: Bribery
en.tooltip: <keyword=create>Create</keyword> and play a unit from your opponent's starting deck.
en.fluff: Many believe the empire's power rests upon the shoulders of its disciplined army and dutiful mages. In truth, the Nilfgaardian floren rules the world.

en.name: Dol Dhu Lokke
en.tooltip: <keyword=resilient>Resilience</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play a Succubus, Phooca, Chimera, or Hybrid.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Move the highest-power unit to the top of your deck and <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Drone on each side of this card.
en.fluff: A monster lair unlike any other. Home to countless horrors and monstrosities. Even a witcher would think twice about setting foot near this hellhole.

en.name: Gorthur Gvaed
en.tooltip: <keyword=resilient>Resilience</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play a Viper Witcher Adept, Viper Witcher, Viper Witcher Mentor, or Viper Witcher Alchemist.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Move a card from your opponent's graveyard to the top of their deck.
en.fluff: There were many scrolls and manuscripts about the legend of the Wild Hunt in the stronghold—and for a good reason.

en.name: Isengrim's Council
en.tooltip: Look at a random Dwarf, Dryad, and Elf from your deck, then play one and boost it by 2.
en.fluff: Before us lies Elskerdeg Pass, and beyond that, Zerrikania and Hakland. Before us lies a long and dangerous road. If we are to walk it together… let us put aside our mistrust.

en.name: Kaer Seren
en.tooltip: <keyword=resilient>Resilience</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play a Griffin Witcher Adept, Griffin Witcher, Griffin Witcher Mentor, or Griffin Witcher Ranger.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Boost a unit in your deck by 3.
en.fluff: Kaer Seren’s literary collection was its greatest treasure and the envy of a group of overzealous mages. In their attempt to seize it for themselves, they destroyed the very thing they desired most.

en.name: The Last Wish
en.tooltip: Look at the top 2 cards from your deck, then play one and <keyword=banish>Banish</keyword> the other.
en.fluff: A djinn, good sirs, fulfills but three wishes. Thus freed, it flees to dimensions unknown.

en.name: Merigold's Hailstorm
en.tooltip: Damage 5 enemy units by 2.
en.fluff: The sky dimmed of a sudden, and clouds amassed over the town. It grew fiendishly dark, and a cold gust swept in. "Oh my," gasped Yennefer. "We're about to make quite the mess, I think."

en.name: Alzur's Double-Cross
en.tooltip: Play the highest-power unit from your deck.
en.fluff: A few of Alzur's monstrous creations roam the world still. Not least among them the horrid viy, who massacred its mage-creator and destroyed half of Maribor before fleeing into Riverdell's gloomy woodland.

en.name: Manticore Venom
en.tooltip: Damage 3 enemy units by 3.
en.fluff: Kills quicker than you can recite the Emperor of Nilfgaard's title in full.

en.name: Bekker's Dark Mirror
en.tooltip: Choose a unit. If it's boosted, damage it by double the amount boosted. If it's damaged, boost it by double the amount damaged.
en.fluff: Gaze long into the abyss, and the abyss will gaze back into you.

en.name: Marching Orders
en.tooltip: Play the lowest-power unit from your deck.
en.fluff: We are but pawns in a game played by old men, sent to fight and die on their senile whims…

en.name: Mandrake
en.tooltip: Reset a unit.
en.fluff: There you all stand! With wonderment awake, doubting the plan and high-discovery. Some, as if grappled by the fell mandrake, some, by the black dog's devilry.

en.name: Bekker's Rockslide
en.tooltip: Damage a unit by 8.
en.fluff: All it takes is one pebble and we're all done for.

en.name: Glorious Hunt
en.tooltip: Destroy the unit with the highest base power.
en.fluff: By the gods' gonads, witcher, why'd you bring me this filth?! "I want that beast's head!" - that was a ploughin' figure of ploughin' speech!

en.name: Blizzard
en.tooltip: Destroy the lowest-power unit.\n<keyword=initiative>Initiative</keyword>: Destroy all lowest-power units instead.
en.fluff: Behold Tedd Deireadh, the Final Age. The world destroyed by the White Frost.

en.name: Triangle Within a Triangle
en.tooltip: Boost an allied unit by its provision cost, or damage an enemy unit by its provision cost.
en.fluff: Adepts of magic often confuse it with a pentacle, which can lead to an infernal disaster.

en.name: Stygga Castle
en.tooltip: <keyword=resilient>Resilience</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play a Cat Witcher Adept, Cat Witcher, Cat Witcher Mentor, or Cat Witcher Saboteur.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Move 3 allied units to the other row.
en.fluff: The Feline witchers did not stay in Stygga Castle for long. Nor anywhere else, actually.

en.name: Acid Spit
en.tooltip: <keyword=infused>Infuse</keyword> an enemy unit with "If this unit has more than 1 power, whenever your opponent <keyword=spawn>Spawns</keyword> one or more units, damage self by 1. When own power reaches 1, <keyword=infused>Infuse</keyword> this ability to adjacent units which don't have it".
en.fluff: Bugspray doesn't always mean what you think it means.

en.name: Summoning Circle
en.tooltip: <keyword=resilient>Resilience</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Look at the units in your deck in order from top to bottom, then choose a unit from your deck and set the Counter equal to that unit's provision cost.\nBefore the end of your turn, remove a Counter from self for each adjacent unit. When the Counter reaches 0, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> the chosen unit from your deck to this row and destroy self.
en.fluff: There exist a great many realities outside our own… With the right knowledge, one can contact them and summon beings beyond human fathoming.

en.name: Haern Caduch
en.tooltip: <keyword=resilient>Resilience</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play a Bear Witcher Adept, Bear Witcher, Bear Witcher Mentor, or Bear Witcher Quartermaster.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=heal>Heal</keyword> the adjacent units by 2.
en.fluff: Carved into the icy rock of the Amell Mountains, hidden amid jagged crags and snowdrifts, the location of the long-abandoned School of the Bear remains a well-kept secret.

en.name: Sacred Flame
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Firesworn Zealot on each side of this card.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Boost all allied Firesworn units by 1.
en.fluff: Do you feel it? I sense something else beyond its warmth, something more...

en.name: Salamandra Hideout
en.tooltip: <keyword=resilient>Resilience</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play a Failed Experiment, Salamandra Abomination, Salamandra Mage, or Salamandra Lackey.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Move <keyword=poison>Poison</keyword> from an allied unit to another unit.
en.fluff: Those who go lurking in the sewers beneath Vizima better watch out, as there are things far worse than rats hidden amid the darkness of the city’s underbelly.

en.name: Necromancer's Tome
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Trigger a bronze allied unit's <keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword> ability.\nWhenever you play a bronze unit, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> a random copy of it from your graveyard to the same row and give it <keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.
en.fluff: Some of the pages are made of human flesh, and the various prophecies, burial rites, and resurrection passages found enclosed are inked in blood.

en.name: Sabrina's Inferno
en.tooltip: Damage each non-Specter unit by 1. If any were destroyed, repeat this ability once.
en.fluff: With her dying breath, Sabrina Glevissig cast a powerful curse that struck not only her executioners, but all who stood nearby.

en.name: Vandergrift's Blade
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 5.\n<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: Store destroyed unit's base power. The next time you play a unit, boost it by the stored amount, then destroy self.
en.fluff: Seltkirk shattered Vandergrift's sword during a knights' tourney in Ard Carraigh. Afterwards Vandergrift, enraged at his weapon's failure, ordered a new one forged, this time with powerful runestones enchanted into it.

en.name: Frog Mating Season
en.tooltip: Choose 2 allied units, then give them <keyword=vitality>Vitality</keyword> (4) and <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Frog on each side of chosen units.
en.fluff: "Would ya look at all those eyeballs?"\n"Ya! They sure look tasty!"

en.name: Sigrdrifa's Rite
en.tooltip: <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> a non-Neutral unit from your graveyard to an allied row and give it <keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.
en.fluff: Fall on your knees and beg Modron Freya for forgiveness.

en.name: Mahakam Horn
en.tooltip: <keyword=Spring>Spring</keyword>: Boost adjacent units by 3.\n<keyword=ambush>Ambush</keyword>: When your opponent passes, boost adjacent units by 4.
en.fluff: Once upon a time, Mahakam held a horn-blowing contest. That day the dwarves made an important discovery: loud noises and snow-capped peaks do not play well together.

en.name: Aguara
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): <keyword=lock>Lock</keyword> a unit.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Remove a unit's <keyword=lock>Lock</keyword>.
en.fluff: Smarten up right now, or it's off to an aguara with you!

en.name: Letho of Gulet
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: If Auckes is in your hand, <keyword=lock>Lock</keyword> an enemy unit. If Serrit is in your hand, damage an enemy unit by 3. If both are in your hand, <keyword=lock>Lock</keyword> a unit and damage it by 3.
en.fluff: Witchers never die in their beds.

en.name: Idarran of Ulivo
en.tooltip: The first time you <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a unit on your side of the battlefield each turn, <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a 1-power copy of it on this row, then give it <keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.
en.fluff: They say beauty is in the eye of the beholder, but no one wants to see what Idarran considers beautiful...

en.name: Kayran
en.tooltip: <keyword=immune>Immunity</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=consume>Consume</keyword> 3 allied units.
en.fluff: How to kill a kayran? Simple! Take your best sword… then sell it, and hire a witcher.

en.name: Vypper
en.tooltip: At the end of the round, move self to your opponent's graveyard. \nAt the end of your turn, while in the graveyard, <keyword=banish>Banish</keyword> the lowest-cost card from it.\nIf Vypper is the only card in the graveyard, give it <keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword> and <keyword=spying>Spying</keyword>, then <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> self to a random enemy row.
en.fluff: "Vicious, cunning. Known to wait patiently for hours before striking their prey. Once it uncoils to strike, there is no escape. Death is inevitable." ⁠— Ivar Evil-Eye

en.name: Zoltan: Scoundrel
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play Duda: Agitator.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play Duda: Companion.
en.fluff: Apologies. My exotic pet's a clever birdie, but a wee bit lewd. Paid ten thalers for the beaute.

en.name: Reynard Odo
en.tooltip: Whenever you play a unit, boost it by 1.\n<keyword=grace>Grace</keyword> 12, <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Boost all boosted allied units by 1.
en.fluff: Under your husband I served ten years, under you another eight. And never in that time did I fight for a more worthy cause.

en.name: Triss Merigold
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): <keyword=reveal>Reveal</keyword> a random unit from your deck and damage an enemy unit by its power.
en.fluff: I can take care of myself. Trust me.

en.name: Mad Kiyan
en.tooltip: <keyword=formation>Formation</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by the amount Mad Kiyan is boosted.\n<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: Reset own power.
en.fluff: We live on a placid island of ignorance in the midst of black seas of infinity, and it was not meant that we should voyage far.

en.name: Yennefer: Divination
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): <keyword=reveal>Reveal</keyword> a random unit from your deck, then boost an allied unit by its power.
en.fluff: Yes, I have seen the future. And you're not in it.

en.name: Eyck of Denesle
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: If you have a Dragon in your hand, gain <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Destroy an enemy unit with 9 or more power.
en.fluff: The Good Book says the world is a garden which the gods once conferred upon man. And we men have this garden neglected!

en.name: Isbel of Hagge
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): If your opponent's hand is not full, look at the top card from both decks. Keep one and give the other to your opponent.
en.fluff: I promised I would never again use magic to harm others.

en.name: Lady of the Lake
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Play an <keyword=echo>Echo</keyword> card from your deck.
en.fluff: Take this sword as a sign of my favor. For centuries it lay in these depths, waiting... for you.

en.name: Knickers
en.tooltip: This unit may raid the battlefield to aid you in battle.
en.fluff: Leave it alone, Knickers! Damn it, leave it alone!

en.name: Olgierd von Everec
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=heal>Heal</keyword> self.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 1
en.fluff: At least you now know I don't easily lose my head.

en.name: Isengrim Faoiltiarna
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost all other allied Elf units by 1.\nWhenever you play an Elf, boost self by 1.
en.fluff: It dawns on them once they notice my scar: a realization of imminent death.

en.name: Knut the Callous
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage an allied unit by half of its current power, then damage an enemy unit by the same amount.\n<keyword=berserk>Berserk</keyword> 5: At the end of your turn, refresh this ability.
en.fluff: Knut, son of Oluf? Aye, never has a jarl's moniker fit so well.

en.name: Prophet Lebioda
en.tooltip: Whenever you play a unit next to Prophet Lebioda, give it a <keyword=shield>Shield</keyword>.
en.fluff: To thine own self be judge and ruler for thou alone shalt answer for thine deeds before thee.

en.name: One-Eyed Betsy
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Draw up to 2 <keyword=bonded>Bonded</keyword> units, then shuffle the same number of cards back into your deck.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Replay an allied <keyword=bonded>Bonded</keyword> unit.
en.fluff: Maybe it lacks depth perception, but it sure packs a wallop.

en.name: Gascon
en.tooltip: While in hand, deck, or on the battlefield, whenever you play the second copy of a <keyword=bonded>Bonded</keyword> unit this match, boost self by 3.
en.fluff: Th' Strays of Spalla – 'tis you who lead them? 'Tis you they call the Duke of Dogs?

en.name: Vivienne de Tabris
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Set a unit's power equal to its provision cost.
en.fluff: Vivienne's a bit of an odd duck for a lady-in-waitin'. But by the Gods, ye can't deny her beauty an' grace!

en.name: Doadrick Leumaerts
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: If you control an Agent, gain <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Draw a card, then move a card from your hand to the bottom of your deck.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 1
en.fluff: The emperor has high expectations for you. See that you do not disappoint him. Hael Ker'zaer!

en.name: Snowdrop
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Draw up to 2 cards, then shuffle the same number of cards back into your deck.\nWhenever you draw a card, boost self by 2.
en.fluff: There’s more to life than song and dance, probably...

en.name: Francis Bedlam
en.tooltip: At the end of your turn, boost the lowest-power unit in your hand by 1.
en.fluff: I might just discover I look great without ears… or hands. Apparently the King of Beggars accepts both as partial payment.

en.name: Ge'els
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Play a Wild Hunt special from your deck.\n<keyword=devotion>Devotion</keyword>: Play a Wild Hunt card from your deck instead.
en.fluff: Paintings should convey emotion, not words.

en.name: Aelirenn
en.tooltip: At the end of your turn, if you control 5 or more Elves, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> this unit from your deck to your <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword> row.
en.fluff: Better to die standing than to live on bent knee.

en.name: Birna Bran
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Draw up to 2 cards, then <keyword=discard>Discard</keyword> the same number of cards.
en.fluff: Skellige must have a strong king. No matter what it takes.

en.name: Whispess: Tribute
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Play an Organic card from your deck.
en.fluff: I'd be your best – and last.

en.name: King Roegner
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Remove <keyword=shield>Shields</keyword> from all units, then boost self by 3 for every <keyword=shield>Shield</keyword> removed.
en.fluff: King Roegner of Cintra, once grievously wounded at the bottom of a ravine, hollered for aid. Alas... His call was answered only by the hisses of vipers and the howls of ravenous werewolves...

en.name: Alissa Henson
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Shuffle a special card from your graveyard into your deck. If it was a bronze, also shuffle one additional copy of that special.
en.fluff: You either die a hero, or live long enough to be exposed as a villain.

en.name: Cyprian Wiley
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=banish>Banish</keyword> a unit with power 3 or less.
en.fluff: Ever since his father died, he's become a real whoreson.

en.name: Morvudd
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost all allied Beast units by 1.
en.fluff: Ate only the entrails. Fussy.

en.name: Whoreson Senior
en.tooltip: <keyword=intimidate>Intimidate</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Transform an adjacent unit into a Cutup Lackey.\n<keyword=tribute>Tribute</keyword> 3: Transform adjacent units into Cutup Lackeys instead.
en.fluff: Like father, like son.

en.name: Menno Coehoorn
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Play a Tactic from your deck.
en.fluff: I'll take an attentive reconnaissance unit over a fine brigade any day.

en.name: Vysogota of Corvo
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Boost a unit by 1. \n<keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>: 1\nWhenever either player plays a card, gain 1 <keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>.
en.fluff: It's been near half a century since I last practiced medicine. The years haven't been kind to my memory... Nor the dexterity of my fingers.

en.name: Warritt The All-Seeing
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Move the highest-cost card in your opponent's deck to the top of it.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Move the lowest-cost card in your opponent's deck on the top of it.
en.fluff: By slightly modifying the Supirre sign, Warritt gained the ability to see... everything.

en.name: John Natalis
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Play a Warfare card from your deck.
en.fluff: That square should bear the names of my soldiers, of the dead. Not mine.

en.name: Madman Lugos
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Damage an enemy unit by twice the number of damaged enemies.
en.fluff: WAAAAAAAAAAGH!!!!

en.name: Ethereal
en.tooltip: <keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Gain <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Transform unit to the right into base copy of self.
en.fluff: Her worst nightmare can easily be yours too.

en.name: Armored Arachas
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: If there is another card on this row, <keyword=lock>Lock</keyword> self.\n<keyword=timer>Timer</keyword> 3: If this row is full, boost self by 12.
en.fluff: It can cut half-inch thick metal like a tailor cutting silk.

en.name: Nithral
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Damage a unit by 1.\n<keyword=dominance>Dominance</keyword>: Damage a unit by 2 instead.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 1
en.fluff: Each Wild Hunt warrior has gone through a rigorous selection process, but Eredin's personal cavalcade includes only the most brutal and most ferocious of the Aen Elle.

en.name: Caleb Menge
en.tooltip: <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 3.\n<keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 3 (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Place a <keyword=bounty>Bounty</keyword> on an enemy unit.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 1
en.fluff: Deceivers, heretics, witches! They flood our city, corrupt our virtue, and threaten our very way of life!

en.name: Philippe Van Moorlehem
en.tooltip:
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: If you control a Vampire, gain <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>.
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Give an enemy unit <keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.
If it already has a status, <keyword=lock>Lock</keyword> it instead.
If it already has more than 1 status, <keyword=poison>Poison</keyword> it instead.
<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 1
en.fluff: It's said that Vincent Van Moorlehem fears only one man. It's not Emhyr var Emreis or Geralt of Rivia - it’s his own son.

en.name: Princess Pavetta
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Shuffle a bronze non-Neutral unit and all copies of it from your graveyard into your deck.
en.fluff: They said the queen was prone to outbursts, but I did not expect that…

en.name: Traheaern var Vdyffir
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Look at the top 3 cards in your opponent's deck and move 1 to their graveyard.
en.fluff: The Nilfgaardians proceeded in the queen's very direction without a sign of panic. The man leading the Nilfgaardians was clad in rich robes. He exuded pride... and the scent of musk.

en.name: Fauve
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Play a Nature card from your deck.
en.fluff: At the edge of the wood, a lone dryad awaited them. Dandelion recognized her at once – the very same with green hair who had given them light in dark of night and urged the bard to continue his ballads.

en.name: Walter Veritas
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=create>Create</keyword> and play a bronze Syndicate card.
en.fluff: In a city that feeds on lies, truth can be a weapon.

en.name: King Belohun
en.tooltip: Whenever you play a unit with power less than 5, set its power to 5.\n<keyword=devotion>Devotion</keyword>: Increase the power limit to 6.
en.fluff: The king, quite rightly, didn’t trust anyone. He also didn’t believe anybody capable of outsmarting him. This proved a fatal assumption.

en.name: Dethmold
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Boost all allied Mages by 1.
en.fluff: I once made a prisoner vomit his own entrails… Ah, good times…

en.name: Winter Queen
en.tooltip: At the end of your turn, if there is <keyword=frost>Frost</keyword> on both enemy rows, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> this unit from your deck to your <keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword> row.\n<keyword=devotion>Devotion</keyword>: Once both players have passed, boost self by 2 for each turn of <keyword=frost>Frost</keyword> remaining on your opponent's side.
en.fluff: Truth is but a shard of ice.

en.name: Rioghan the Undying
en.tooltip: This card starts in your graveyard. \nWhen played or <keyword=summon>Summoned</keyword> from the graveyard, trigger all remaining <keyword=rain>Rain</keyword> and <keyword=storm>Storm</keyword> on your opponent's side of the battlefield.
en.fluff: “Your life will burn as bright as the love between us.” - Fucusya

en.name: Sir Scratch-A-Lot
en.tooltip:
At the start of the game, gain <keyword=immune>Immunity</keyword>.
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost self by 0.
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Increase the boost value by 2, then replay self.
Units played on your opponent's side can trigger your <keyword=thrive>Thrive</keyword> abilities.
en.fluff: If you value your eyesight... Don't call him a pussy.

en.name: Arachas Behemoth
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> 2 Drones and boost all other Insectoids on this row by 1.
en.fluff: Like a cross between a crab, a spider… and a mountain.

en.name: Toad Prince
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): <keyword=consume>Consume</keyword> a unit with 4 or less power.
en.fluff: Big, bad, ugly. Squats in the sewers.

en.name: Sheldon Skaggs
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Damage an enemy unit by the amount Sheldon is boosted.
en.fluff: I was there, on the front lines! Right where the fightin' was the thickest!

en.name: Ermion
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Play an Alchemy card from your deck.
en.fluff: Only the ignorant dismiss the importance of myths.

en.name: Sweers
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): <keyword=seize>Seize</keyword> an enemy unit with 3 or less power.
en.fluff: And hands off the girl! Whatever we may be, we're not savages.

en.name: Foltest's Pride
en.tooltip:
<keyword=resupply>Resupply</keyword>.
<keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 2 and units adjacent to it by 1.
<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 4
<keyword=crew>Crew</keyword>: Set <keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword> to 2.
en.fluff: As King Foltest likes to say, it's not size that counts, but whether it gets the job done.

en.name: Sigvald
en.tooltip: Whenever this unit is damaged by other non-status abilities, gain <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> for the same duration instead.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage a unit by the duration of <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> on self, then <keyword=purify>Purify</keyword> self. If it was an enemy unit, damage self by that amount. If it was an allied unit, boost self by that amount.
en.fluff: A vildkaarl that lives to old age earns the respect of his clan.

en.name: Saer Qu'an
en.tooltip: <keyword=timer>Timer</keyword> 2: Boost self by 10.
en.fluff: Every tiger is dangerous. Especially one that has taken a liking to human flesh…

en.name: Vabjorn
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Play a Raid from your deck.
en.fluff: Blood for Svalblod! Skulls for his throne!

en.name: Hefty Helge
en.tooltip:
<keyword=shield>Shield</keyword>.
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage a unit by 2.
<keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>: 1
Whenever you play a Tactic, gain 1 <keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>.
en.fluff: Not the best for taking cities, but great for razing them to the ground.

en.name: Hubert Rejk
en.tooltip: Whenever you use an <keyword=order>Order</keyword> ability while this card is in your deck, remove a Counter from it. When the Counter reaches 0, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> this card from your deck to your <keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword> row.\nCounter: 10
en.fluff: The coroner is a calm, peaceful person. He even treats corpses with the utmost delicacy.

en.name: Black Rayla
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Damage a unit by 1.\n<keyword=inspired>Inspired</keyword>: Damage a unit by 2 instead.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 1
en.fluff: Exceptions are a clear road to human blood spilt. All Scoia'tael must die. Leave the gods to sort the wheat from the chaff.

en.name: Vissegerd
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Gain <keyword=charge>Charges</keyword> equal to the number of boosted allied units.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 1.\n<keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>: 1
en.fluff: I will raise Cintra from the ashes no matter how great the cost.

en.name: Dudu
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Transform into a base copy of an enemy unit.
en.fluff: A mimic, among the many other names for his sort: changelings, doublings, vexlings… or dopplers.

en.name: Prince Stennis
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Boost an allied unit by 4.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Boost 4 allied units by 1.
en.fluff: He wears armor made of gold. Of course he's a jerk.

en.name: Holger Blackhand
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage a unit by 2.\nWhenever you play a ship, boost it by 1.\nWhenever you play a pirate, deal 1 damage to a random enemy.
en.fluff: Now let's drink to the Emperor of Nilfgaard – may he die of somethin' hideous!

en.name: Barnabas Beckenbauer
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost an allied Elf, Dwarf, and Dryad unit by 3.
en.fluff: Arrived here with his peddler's wagon full o' tricks an' gadgets. Went from house tae house, praised his rubbish tae the high heavens. An' what's it he sold us? Bombs that go off in yer hand! Beard-growth formula that makes yer hair catch fire!

en.name: Hammond
en.tooltip: <keyword=Deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Move an enemy unit to the other row and give it <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> (2).\nIncrease the <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> duration by 1 for each adjacent Pirate.
en.fluff: Once mistaken for a whale calf and nearly harpooned. He's avoided swimming ever since.

en.name: Ferko the Sculptor
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Play a Crime from your deck.
en.fluff: Some call it base thuggery. But me, I consider it the highest art form.

en.name: Torque
en.tooltip: This card starts in your hand.\nWhenever this card is boosted in your hand, boost a random different unit in your hand by the same amount.
en.fluff: Where an elf cannot go himself, he sends a devil.

en.name: Ulula
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage a unit by 2.\nWhenever an enemy unit takes damage from your Warriors, damage it by 1, ignoring its <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.
en.fluff: Not all beann'shies float around, foul and rotten. Some happen to be great beauties who will kick your arse, rip your ears off, and impale your intestines before shrieking in your face.

en.name: Pavko Gale
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Damage a unit by 1.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 1\nIf you control only non-Neutral units, damage a unit by 2 instead.
en.fluff: No one smuggled as much food to the elves of the Blue Mountains as Gale. He'd bring them sacks of turnips and, prized most of all, leeks.

en.name: Freixenet
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Young Dryad on this row.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 4\n<keyword=devotion>Devotion</keyword>: At the end of your turn, lower the <keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword> by the duration of <keyword=vitality>Vitality</keyword> on self.
en.fluff: He was only meant to be a breeding stud to her. But in the end, they fell in love regardless.

en.name: Toruviel
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Damage the units on each end of an enemy row by 2.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Damage all units on an enemy row by 1.\nIf you control an Elven Deadeye, use both abilities.
en.fluff: I'd gladly kill you from up close, stare in your eyes… But you reek, human.

en.name: Ozzrel
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): <keyword=consume>Consume</keyword> a unit from your opponent's graveyard.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): <keyword=consume>Consume</keyword> a unit from your graveyard.
en.fluff: Some necrophages have taken such a liking to human flesh, they no longer are content to merely dig up corpses...

en.name: Adriano the Mink
en.tooltip: <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 2.\nIncrease the <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> by 1 for each allied Sly Seductress.\n<keyword=tribute>Tribute</keyword> 5: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Sly Seductress on this row.
en.fluff: Right here, beautiful. Have a sit on daddy's lap.

en.name: Brehen
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Destroy the rightmost unit on an enemy row with at least 5 units.\n<keyword=adrenaline>Adrenaline</keyword> 3: Destroy the rightmost unit on an enemy row with at least 3 units instead.
en.fluff: Known as the Cat of Iello. A moniker earned not from origins, but as a result of slaughtering peasants there. More of a massacre, really.

en.name: Caranthir: Golden Child
en.tooltip: At the start of your turn, while in hand or deck, reset own power and boost self by the damage dealt by <keyword=frost>Frost</keyword> in the last 5 enemy turns (0, 0, 0, 0, 0).
en.fluff: The future of the Aen Elle spans not kingdoms, but worlds, and mine is the hand that guides us toward that destiny.

en.name: Bart
en.tooltip: Whenever you play a unit with a <keyword=gang>Gang</keyword> category you don't control, gain a <keyword=coin>Coin</keyword> for each unique <keyword=gang>Gang</keyword> category you control.
en.fluff: Bart brain hurt.

en.name: Guillaume de Launfal
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost self by the number of allied Knights on this row, then boost self and an enemy unit by half of both units' power.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=grace>Grace</keyword> 14): Move all statuses from an enemy unit to self.
en.fluff: A true exemplar of the five knightly virtues, save perhaps wisdom.

en.name: Bride of the Sea
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Play an Alchemy card from your graveyard with a provision cost 4 or less. Increase the cost by the total duration of <keyword=rain>Rain</keyword> and <keyword=storm>Storm</keyword> on your opponent's side.
en.fluff: Chosen from among the descendants of Rioghan the Undying. A man whose deeds have cast a dark shadow over his kin for decades.

en.name: Boris
en.tooltip: At the beginning of your turn, wherever this card is, randomly change own <keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> to a different cost between 1 and 9.\n<keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 1: Move self to the other row, then boost self by the <keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> cost. If you have 0 <keyword=coin>Coins</keyword>, also gain 1 <keyword=coin>Coin</keyword> for each allied unit on that row.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 1
en.fluff: After getting a taste of human flesh, he won't eat anything else.

en.name: Hvitr and Aelydia
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Damage a unit by 1. \n<keyword=hoard>Hoard</keyword> 5: Damage an enemy unit by 2 instead.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 1
en.fluff: Inseparable. Invincible. Irresponsible.

en.name: Bjorn Stormursson
en.tooltip: <keyword=veteran>Veteran</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=clash>Clash</keyword> with an enemy unit.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=bloodthirst>Bloodthirst</keyword> 2): <keyword=discard>Discard</keyword> a card, then move self back to your hand.
en.fluff: Bjorn, son of Stormur the Feared, known to his village as Storm Son, to his friends as Thundersocket, to his enemies as Whale Eater, to continentals as the Cyclops of Skellige, to his daughter as Stuffy Old Fuck, and to history as the Unreturned...

en.name: Sabrina Glevissig
en.tooltip: <keyword=disloyal>Disloyal</keyword>.\n<keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword>: Damage all units on this row by 3.
en.fluff: The Daughter of the Kaedweni Wilderness.

en.name: Svanrige Tuirseach
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost self by the base power of the last non-Neutral unit that went to your graveyard this round.
en.fluff: The emperor also thought him an accidental king. At first.

en.name: Whoreson's Freak Show
en.tooltip: <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 2.\n<keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 2 (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Damage an enemy unit by 2.
en.fluff: Why the long face, friend?

en.name: Caesar Bilzen
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Trigger the <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> abilities of adjacent units.\n<keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 2: Boost an allied unit by 2.
en.fluff: Avid angler, meticulous collector, and a real piece of work.

en.name: Dire Mutated Hound
en.tooltip: <keyword=barricade>Barricade</keyword>: At the end of your turn, boost self by 2.\n<keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 4: Gain 1 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.
en.fluff: We couldn't decide what to name him and it just kind of came up…

en.name: Skjordal Drummond
en.tooltip: <keyword=devotion>Devotion</keyword>: <keyword=veteran>Veteran</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by Skjordal's base power.
en.fluff: He believed in honor, and that became his undoing.

en.name: Lieutenant Von Herst
en.tooltip: At the end of your turn, if you control a Cleric, <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Firesworn Zealot on this row.\n<keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 1: Transform a Firesworn Zealot into a Flaming Rose Footman.
en.fluff: The fall of the Order wasn’t so hard for him like for the others. He is still required to count the goods and manage supplies, only now it has become even easier… Less strict at least.

en.name: Lake Guardian: Dusk Aspect
en.tooltip: <keyword=harmony>Harmony</keyword>.\nThis unit's <keyword=harmony>Harmony</keyword> is also triggered in hand and deck.
en.fluff: Like a moonflower, it lives to curtail the dark of night.

en.name: Flyndr's Crew
en.tooltip:
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> 3 base copies of self on this row. Reduce the number of copies by 1 for every Counter.
Your <keyword=hoard>Hoards</keyword> require 1 less <keyword=coin>Coins</keyword> to trigger.
<keyword=hoard>Hoard</keyword> 9: Once per round, at the end of your turn, while in hand or deck, remove a Counter.
Counter: 3
en.fluff: Wretches and thieves drunk on grog, bloodshed and booty - could you ever hope for a better crew?

en.name: Tesham Mutna Sword
en.tooltip: Damage an enemy unit by 5. Repeat once for each status it has.
en.fluff: Millenia have passed, but its thirst for blood has not.

en.name: Commander's Horn
en.tooltip: Boost 5 adjacent units by 2. Boost bronze units by an additional 1 for each gold unit adjacent to them.
en.fluff: Plus one to morale, minus one to hearing.

en.name: Necromancy
en.tooltip: Play a bronze unit from your graveyard and give it <keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.
en.fluff: We have ways of making you talk… alive or dead.

en.name: Surrender
en.tooltip: Remove 2 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword> from all units on a row and damage them by 2.
en.fluff: There's no shame in waving the white flag.

en.name: Black Blood
