en.tooltip: The next time an enemy receives a boost, destroy that unit and self.
en.fluff: Vampires all agree: use of this potion is bad sportsmanship.

en.name: Treason
en.tooltip: Give <keyword=spying>Spying</keyword> to an enemy unit and damage adjacent units by its power.
en.fluff: In Nilfgaard, trustful people are considered an endangered species.

en.name: Cadaverine
en.tooltip: <keyword=poison>Poison</keyword> an enemy unit, then <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a base copy of it on the opposite row.
en.fluff: I don't trust my life to chance. I trust it to a thick coating of Cadaverine on my blade.

en.name: Dead Man's Tongue
en.tooltip: <keyword=banish>Banish</keyword> a card from your deck. If it was a bronze, <keyword=banish>Banish</keyword> another bronze card from your deck.\nBoost an allied unit by the combined provision cost of <keyword=banish>Banished</keyword> cards.
en.fluff: They say the dead tell no tales. Truth is, they speak no lies.

en.name: Saov Ainmhi'dh
en.tooltip: Boost an allied unit by 5. When this card enters your graveyard, transform self into Saov Ainmhi'dh: Unity.
en.fluff: Expecto pa⁠— No, wait. That’s not right.

en.name: Champion's Charge
en.tooltip: Deal 5 damage to a unit.\n<keyword=bloodthirst>Bloodthirst</keyword> 3: Destroy a unit instead.
en.fluff: At close range, trolls never use weapons. And why would they?

en.name: Raiding Fleet
en.tooltip: Give an enemy unit <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> (4), then play a random bronze Ship from your deck.
en.fluff: The rocky Skellige lands, battered by cold winds, give life only to nettles and moss. But the islanders know that there is fertile soil on the other side of the sea…

en.name: Offering to the Sea
en.tooltip: Damage all units on the battlefield by 1, then <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Deafening Siren on a random allied row and boost it by the number of allied targets.
en.fluff: Cultists proclaim that the maidens are "offered to the sea," not "eaten by its monsters." Yet, for the latter, the semantics makes no difference.

en.name: Serpent Trap
en.tooltip: <keyword=ambush>Ambush</keyword>: When your opponent plays a special card, destroy the highest-power enemy unit.\n<keyword=spring>Spring</keyword>: Destroy the lowest-power enemy unit.
en.fluff: You exact from the earth a blood ransom, ripping out its riches by force. To us it bloomed, bore fruit and gave freely, for it loved us as we loved it.

en.name: Tavern Brawl
en.tooltip: Force an enemy unit to <keyword=duel>Duel</keyword> an adjacent unit.
en.fluff: About time we had some entertainment! My knuckles are itchin'!

en.name: Conjurer's Candle
en.tooltip:
<keyword=resilient>Resilience</keyword>.
<keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 4.
<keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 1: Boost an allied unit by 1. Increase the boost by this card's <keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> cost.
Each time you pay this card's <keyword=fee>Fee</keyword>, increase its cost by 1, up to 9.
en.fluff: The ornament’s aesthetic is particularly pleasing to those with a fondness for the macabre, yet its true allure lies with its mystical properties; for any old candle can light up a dark space, but only a few can illuminate the truth.

en.name: Iris: Shade
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Remove a unit's <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword> and boost self by that amount.
en.fluff: Olgierd's betrothed was like a dream…

en.name: Golyat
en.tooltip: <keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword>: Your opponent <keyword=summon>Summons</keyword> the highest-power unit from their deck to the opposite row.
en.fluff: Some claim Golyat was once a famous knight. Sadly, one day he earned the wrath of the Lady of the Lake, who turned him into a monster.

en.name: Rat Catcheress
en.tooltip: Whenever this unit is damaged, reduce its base power by 1.\n<keyword=sabbath>Sabbath</keyword>: Cancel the ability above.\nWhenever you play a Relict, increase this unit's base power by 1.
en.fluff: The witch grabbed the bells and started to play a lively melody that attracted small rodents and children alike.

en.name: Frenzied D'ao
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Move a unit to the other row.
en.fluff: They're easily mistaken for rocks. Many a troll's been unpleasantly surprised by gastric grief on that very account.

en.name: Jutta an Dimun
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: If Jutta an Dimun is the highest-power unit, damage self by 6.
en.fluff: Some call her the "Iron Maiden."

en.name: Dulla kh'Amanni
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: If you control Runewright, <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> Desert Treasure on this row.
en.fluff: To know the world is to praise god's name.

en.name: Runewright
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: If you control Dulla kh'Amanni, <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> Desert Treasure on this row.
en.fluff: Great power lies in words. But it's not easy to enchant it into steel.

en.name: Siegfried of Denesle
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=purify>Purify</keyword> all other units.
en.fluff: We're on the same side, witcher. You'll realize this one day.

en.name: Prophet
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage self by 2, then <keyword=lock>Lock</keyword> all units in your opponent's hand until the end of round. The next time your opponent plays a <keyword=lock>Locked</keyword> unit, remove <keyword=lock>Lock</keyword> from all units in your opponent's hand.\n<keyword=adrenaline>Adrenaline</keyword> 2: <keyword=lock>Lock</keyword> self instead.
en.fluff: In his vision, he saw a mage beckon to a black sky as it split open. From the breach, he saw an enormous monstrosity with hooked limbs descending upon a city, smashing and crushing it to rubble. He saw destruction, death, and chaos incarnate, and he was paralysed with fear.

en.name: Myrgtabrakke
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage 2 enemy units by 2.
en.fluff: Never get between a mother dragon and her young.

en.name: Operator
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> a base copy of a bronze unit from your hand to this row on each player's side.
en.fluff: As time and space collapse before us, they expand behind us. In that way one moves forward through both.

en.name: Whispess
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 2. Increase this damage by 2 whenever you play a Crone.
en.fluff: I'd be your best – and last.

en.name: Weavess
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost an allied unit by 2. Increase this boost by 2 whenever you play a Crone.
en.fluff: I sense your pain. I see your fear.

en.name: Iris' Companions
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Draw a card of your choice, then <keyword=discard>Discard</keyword> a random card.\nIf you have Iris in hand, choose which card to <keyword=discard>Discard</keyword> instead.
en.fluff: We'd rather keep our names to ourselves. Think of us as… friends of the house.

en.name: Tatterwing
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Destroy an allied unit and boost self by its base power.
en.fluff: She seems a bit sluggish. A few quick jabs to the ribs oughta liven her up.

en.name: Pugo Boom-Breaker
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage a random allied unit by 3. If there are no allies, damage self by 5 instead.
en.fluff: Listen, troll, I can promise you a hundred crowns if you take the fa--AAAAAAGH!!!

en.name: Vlodimir von Everec
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Swap a unit's power with <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.
en.fluff: Vlodimir liked to have a good time when he was alive and greatly missed having fun after his death.

en.name: Brewess
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=consume>Consume</keyword> an allied unit.\n<keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>: 1\nIncrease the number of <keyword=charge>Charges</keyword> by 1 whenever you play a Crone.
en.fluff: We'll cut you up, boy. A fine broth you'll make.

en.name: Master of Ceremonies
en.tooltip: At the start of the game, <keyword=infused>Infuse</keyword> 2 random gold non-Cultist units in your starting deck with Cultist category and <keyword=infused>Infuse</keyword> them with "After this card is played or <keyword=summon>Summoned</keyword>, if you control 3 or more Cultists, damage the lowest-power <keyword=infused>Infused</keyword> enemy unit by 3".
en.fluff: With the indepth understanding of both human and heavenly affairs comes the realisation that the Grand Scheme is not a chessboard at all. It is a clockwork.

en.name: Thaler
en.tooltip: <keyword=formation>Formation</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: If neither player has passed and your opponent's hand is not full, both players draw a card.
en.fluff: Piss off! We aren't all philanderers. Some of us have depth…

en.name: Imperial Manticore
en.tooltip: <keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword>: Destroy the lowest enemy.
en.fluff: One of the world's oldest and deadliest monsters. I used to feel excitement at moments like this. Now the beast is only an obstacle in my way. Its meat and hot blood will help me survive this icy hell.

en.name: Milva
en.tooltip: <keyword=immune>Immunity</keyword>.\nWhenever an allied unit moves, boost self by 1.
en.fluff: With each arrow I loose, I think of my da. He'd be proud. I think.

en.name: Adda: Striga
en.tooltip: <keyword=Deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 2.\n<keyword=dominance>Dominance</keyword>: Damage it by 4 instead.
en.fluff: And the striga's doin' fine. Sure, she takes a bite outta someone from time to time, but you get used to that.

en.name: Ulfhedinn
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Damage an enemy unit by half its current power.
en.fluff: Werewolf? Oh, no, no… this is something far, far worse.

en.name: Bone Talisman
en.tooltip: Boost all allied units by 1.
en.fluff: The simplest of objects sometimes possess the greatest power.

en.name: Milton de Peyrac-Peyran
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost an enemy unit by 3, then boost self by 3.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Boost self by the last boost you gave to an enemy unit this round.
en.fluff: Glinting under the rays of the Beauclair sun, there was no mistaking this knight-errant who bore the head of a great, white bull on his shield.

en.name: Tamara Strenger
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost all allied Witch Hunters by 1.\n<keyword=tribute>Tribute</keyword> 3: Boost all allied Witch Hunters in hand, deck and on the battlefield by 1 instead.
en.fluff: Once the heat of the Fire has set your heart aflame, it gives you strength and leads you down the path of truth for the rest of your life.

en.name: Greater Brothers
en.tooltip: <keyword=insanity>Insanity</keyword>.\n<keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 2: Gain 2 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.\n<keyword=exposed>Exposed</keyword>: Destroy self.
en.fluff: A battering ram? No need, we'll handle it another way.

en.name: Leo
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost self by 1 for every Witcher you control.
en.fluff: He would have caught the arrow if he only had some heads-up.

en.name: Assire var Anahid
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Shuffle a card from your opponent's graveyard into their deck.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Shuffle a card from your graveyard into your deck.
en.fluff: Nilfgaardian mages do have a choice: servile submission, or the gallows.

en.name: Cynthia
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> The Guardian on top of your opponent's deck.
en.fluff: Cynthia's talents can be deadly. She needs a tight leash.

en.name: Eskel
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=adrenaline>Adrenaline</keyword> 4): <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> Vesemir and Lambert from your deck.
en.fluff: I'm a simple witcher, Wolf. Don't fight dragons, don't fraternize with kings and don't sleep with sorceresses…

en.name: Vesemir
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=adrenaline>Adrenaline</keyword> 4): <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> Eskel and Lambert from your deck.
en.fluff: If you're to be hanged, ask for water. Anything can happen before they fetch it.

en.name: Lambert
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=adrenaline>Adrenaline</keyword> 4): <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> Eskel and Vesemir from your deck.
en.fluff: Now that's the kind of negotiating I understand.

en.name: Dennis Cranmer
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost adjacent units by an amount equal to their <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.
en.fluff: I know how to execute orders, so take your advice somewhere else.

en.name: Serrit
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 2. If Auckes is in your hand, damage that unit by 4 instead.
en.fluff: We do what we must. I am not ashamed of that.

en.name: Immortals
en.tooltip: <keyword=shield>Shield</keyword>.\n<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>: Whenever this unit loses its <keyword=shield>Shield</keyword>, boost it by 2.\nAt the end of your turn, gain <keyword=shield>Shield</keyword>.
en.fluff: Where one falls, another will take his place.

en.name: Van Moorlehem's Cupbearer
en.tooltip: <keyword=assimilate>Assimilate</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): <keyword=poison>Poison</keyword> a unit.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): <keyword=purify>Purify</keyword> a unit.
en.fluff: My specialty? Tartar. Of what? Ah, that depends on the host's mood…

en.name: Gerd
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Deafening Siren on the opposite row and damage all units on that row by 1.\n<keyword=adrenaline>Adrenaline</keyword> 3: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Deafening Siren on the opposite row and damage it by 1 instead.
en.fluff: He was contracted to slay a dragon, a siren, and a striga. He was also being pursued by a vengeful knight, bounty hunters, and bandits. Despite all this, he still found time for a round of Gwent.

en.name: Leticia Charbonneau
en.tooltip: <keyword=patience>Patience</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): At the end of this turn, the <keyword=patience>Patience</keyword> value of allied units is increased by [1] instead.
en.fluff: “You cannot control what the world throws at you, but you can decide on how to react.” - Leticia Charbonneau

en.name: Kennet and Gar
en.tooltip: <keyword=formation>Formation</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Destroy an enemy unit with 2 or less power.\nWhenever you <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Soldier, increase the limit by 1.
en.fluff: "What tattoo should we get after this 'un?"\n'"Ow 'bout a pair of flamin' tits?"

en.name: The Beast
en.tooltip: At the end of your turn, if this is not the highest-power unit on the battlefield, boost it by 2.
en.fluff: The Beast didn't come from nowhere. You all summoned it. With your lust, your greed and your cruelty.

en.name: The Apiarian Phantom
en.tooltip: <keyword=veil>Veil</keyword>.\n<keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Damage an enemy unit by 3.\nAt the end of your turn, if the <keyword=order>Order</keyword> is not used, boost self by 1.
en.fluff: Who's a good boy? Well, surely not him.

en.name: Trollololo
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Lose all <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>, then boost self by that amount.\nWhenever an allied unit uses its <keyword=order>Order</keyword>, gain 1 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.
en.fluff: Join me King Ravodid army. Order got – guard boatses.

en.name: Botchling
en.tooltip: At the end of your turn, damage the highest-power enemy unit by 1. \n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Transform into Lubberkin.
en.fluff: Admit your mistakes and bury them proper – else they'll come back to haunt you.

en.name: Albrich
en.tooltip: When moved to the top of your deck, boost a random allied unit by 2 and boost self by 2.
en.fluff: A ball of fire? Why, naturally. Whatsoever Your Imperial Majesty desires.

en.name: Fringilla Vigo
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 2. Increase the number of targets by 1 for each adjacent Mage or Construct.
en.fluff: Magic is the highest good. It transcends all borders and divisions.

en.name: Werecat
en.tooltip: <keyword=thrive>Thrive</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage all enemy units on the opposite row by 1.\n<keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword>: Repeat the <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> ability.
en.fluff: He hates it when you scratch his belly.

en.name: Palmerin de Launfal
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Choose an unboosted enemy unit, then play the top card from your deck and boost that unit by that card's provision cost.\nIf you control Milton de Peyrac-Peyran, you may choose from the top 3 cards of your deck instead.
en.fluff: Rumor had it the esteemed baron Palmerin de Launfal had fallen into a profane affair with a succubus. The duchess, however, gave no credence to such baseless hearsay.

en.name: Voymir
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost an allied unit and all its copies by 1 and give them 1 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.
en.fluff: Quietly, on tiptoes, no noise, no fuss. Through the back alleys. In Loxia and the port keep your mouth shut! Go!

en.name: War Chariot
en.tooltip:
<keyword=resupply>Resupply</keyword>. <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>.
<keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Give an enemy unit <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> (4).
<keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Move an enemy unit to the other row.
<keyword=crew>Crew</keyword>: Combine both <keyword=order>Order</keyword> abilities.
<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 3
en.fluff: The chariot drove into the crowd and its enemies fell to the ground like wheat before the scythe…

en.name: Ves
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 2.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Give an allied unit <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 3
en.fluff: Better to live one day as a king than a whole life as a beggar.

en.name: Treant Boar
en.tooltip:
<keyword=Deploy>Deploy</keyword>: If you control a Dryad, gain <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>.
<keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Move self to the <keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword> row and <keyword=heal>Heal</keyword> self.
<keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Move self to the <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword> row and damage an enemy unit by 2.
<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 1
en.fluff: Dryads wield a mystifying power to shape the forest's trees into any form they wish. So why not a giant boar?

en.name: Urcheon of Erlenwald
en.tooltip: <keyword=veil>Veil</keyword>.\n<keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Transform self into Duny.\nAt the end of your turn, boost a random allied unit by 1.
en.fluff: This is how I look, which you well knew, Calanthe. King Roegner, in telling you of the oath, would not have omitted such a detail in his tale.

en.name: Blueboy Lugos
en.tooltip: Whenever this unit takes damage, damage a random enemy unit by 2.
en.fluff: I'm near ready to puke from boredom.

en.name: Xavier Moran
en.tooltip: <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>: Whenever you play a Dwarf, gain 1 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.\n<keyword=barricade>Barricade</keyword>: At the end of your turn, boost self by 1.
en.fluff: Well? Somethin' wrong? Venison a wee bit rank for ye? Ehh, princess?

en.name: Hym
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Swap this unit's power with a damaged unit's power.
en.fluff: The gods' speak to me… I hear them whisper from the shadows…

en.name: Anna Strenger
en.tooltip: At the end of your turn, boost the unit to the right by 1.\n<keyword=inspired>Inspired</keyword>: Boost adjacent units by 1 instead.
en.fluff: Anna hated her husband so much that she was ready to do anything in order to be free of the man — and the child he had put inside her.

en.name: Windhalm of Attre
en.tooltip: <keyword=shield>Shield</keyword>\nAt the end of your turn, if this unit has <keyword=shield>Shield</keyword>, boost it by 2.\n<keyword=grace>Grace</keyword> 10, <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Gain a <keyword=shield>Shield</keyword>.
en.fluff: Off with his head! But slowly, drag it out, put on a show for all to see. His death must serve as an example.

en.name: Weeping Willow
en.tooltip: <keyword=harmony>Harmony</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Boost self by the number of unique primary categories among units you control.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): <keyword=poison>Poison</keyword> an enemy unit.
en.fluff: Its name misleads, for 'tis not the tree who weeps.

en.name: Fercart
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Play a special card from your hand, then draw a card.\nWhenever you play a special card, give <keyword=spying>Spying</keyword> to a random non-<keyword=spying>Spying</keyword> enemy unit.
en.fluff: Pawns will never know of the unseen hands, maneuvering them toward certain doom.

en.name: Penitent
en.tooltip: <keyword=thrive>Thrive</keyword>.\n<keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword>: <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> a random 7-provision cost unit from your deck to this row.
en.fluff: The places this monster haunts are quickly covered by fog and darkness. Those that get lost in it usually don't return to the living.

en.name: Egmund
en.tooltip: <keyword=veil>Veil</keyword>.\n<keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Damage an enemy unit by 3.\nAt the end of your turn, if the <keyword=order>Order</keyword> is not used, boost the unit to the right by 1.
en.fluff: Since father has never appreciated nor trusted Egmund, it was but a simple decision to betray him.

en.name: Gaetan
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Move all other cards from this row to the other row.\nDamage a random enemy unit for each card moved by 1.
en.fluff: “Murder me just to save few crowns? I’m supposed to protect whoresons like that?” ⁠— Gaetan

en.name: Mourntart
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): <keyword=banish>Banish</keyword> all units in your graveyard, then boost self by 1 for each.
en.fluff: Most grave hags feed on rotten remains dug out of graves. Yet some sneak into huts, steal children, kill the elderly and in general make very undesirable neighbors.

en.name: Yaevinn
en.tooltip: <keyword=Deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by the number of Elf units on this row.
en.fluff: We are the drops of rain that together make a ferocious storm.

en.name: Donar an Hindar
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 2.\n<keyword=bloodthirst>Bloodthirst</keyword> 2: Damage an enemy unit by 4 instead.
en.fluff: I've gathered all the jarls together. Now make your case.

en.name: Morkvarg
en.tooltip: When this unit enters your graveyard during the round, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> it to your <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword> row and give it <keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.
en.fluff: The vilest man Skellige's ever known.

en.name: Sirssa
en.tooltip: <keyword=harmony>Harmony</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 2 then boost a random unit in your hand by 2.\n<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: Boost a unit in your hand instead.
en.fluff: With silent grace, a dark-haired dryad nimbly descended a spiralling cascade of mushrooms along the tree's trunk, her lithe body camouflaged with fallen leaves.

en.name: Axel Three-Eyes
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play Crow's-eye Rhizome.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Transform adjacent Crows into Crow Messengers.
en.fluff: Though his words contain much wisdom, it is easily drowned out by its madness.

en.name: Dunca
en.tooltip: <keyword=veil>Veil</keyword>.\n<keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Damage an enemy unit by 3. \nAt the end of your turn, if the <keyword=order>Order</keyword> is not used, boost a random non-Neutral unit in your hand by 1.
en.fluff: She does no warning shot, always aims to kill. No mercy, even for the little ones.

en.name: Roland Bleinheim
en.tooltip: Whenever a unit gains <keyword=poison>Poison</keyword>, gain 2 <keyword=coin>Coins</keyword>.
en.fluff: “How's my brother doing in the sewers, I wonder...” ⁠— Roland

en.name: Fabian Hale
en.tooltip: <keyword=intimidate>Intimidate</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Place a <keyword=bounty>Bounty</keyword> on an enemy unit. If there already was an enemy unit with a <keyword=bounty>Bounty</keyword>, gain <keyword=coin>Coins</keyword> equal to its base power.
en.fluff: Fabian takes great pride in his work, with each “victory” etched upon his skin as a permanent reminder of memories most pleasant.

en.name: Vildkaarl
en.tooltip: <keyword=berserk>Berserk</keyword> 2: Transform into Champion of Svalblod.
en.fluff: Strike me! C'mon, harder! You call this pain?!

en.name: Cantarella
en.tooltip: <keyword=disloyal>Disloyal</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Play the top card from your opponent's deck.
en.fluff: Men require constant alluring. Mystique and refinement do the job quite well.

en.name: Ewald Borsodi
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 2.\nIf Horst Borsodi is in your graveyard, damage an enemy unit by 4 instead.\n<keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 1: Give an enemy unit <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> (1).
en.fluff: I've crafted this plan for over a year, but now the time's come for action. Can I count on your help?

en.name: Nathaniel Pastodi
en.tooltip: Whenever Nathaniel receives a boost, give random enemy unit <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> (2).
en.fluff: Novigrad – where the impossible becomes possible. A professional torturer turned reverend, for instance.

en.name: Tunnel Drill
en.tooltip:
<keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 2.
<keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 2: Damage an enemy unit by 3.
<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 1
Whenever you play a Crime, reduce the <keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword> by 1.
en.fluff: Though originally designed for mining excavations under Mount Carbon, the machine struck more gold under the streets of Novigrad.

en.name: Ludovicus Brunenbaum
en.tooltip: <keyword=timer>Timer</keyword> 3: Gain 9 <keyword=coin>Coins</keyword>.\n<keyword=tribute>Tribute</keyword> 5: Gain 9 <keyword=coin>Coins</keyword> immediately instead.
en.fluff: They say he'd sell his own mother. But no one was buying.

en.name: Gellert Bleinheim
en.tooltip:
<keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 2.
<keyword=immune>Immunity</keyword>.
<keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 1: <keyword=poison>Poison</keyword> an allied unit and boost it by 2.
<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 1
<keyword=adrenaline>Adrenaline</keyword> 6: At the end of your turn, <keyword=purify>Purify</keyword> self.
en.fluff: “How's my brother doing in the woods, I wonder...” ⁠— Gellert

en.name: Eveline Gallo
en.tooltip: At the end of your turn, if you have 0 <keyword=coin>Coins</keyword>, gain 3 <keyword=coin>Coins</keyword>.
en.fluff: One somersault into a crossbow shot, aimed with the feet, through a pigeon, mid-flight, blindfolded—and suddenly nothing's impossible.

en.name: Harald Houndsnout
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> 3 Harald's Pals and <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> them to your other row.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage an allied unit by 1.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 1
en.fluff: Once proud jarl of Clan Tordarroch, now a muttering madman.

en.name: Corrupted Flaminica
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost self by 2 for every unique Beast in your graveyard.
en.fluff: At times, even druids succumb to Svalblod's whispers...

en.name: Terror of the Seas
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Lose all <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword> and damage an enemy unit by that amount.\nWhenever you play a Pirate, gain 1 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.
en.fluff: All it takes is a small hole for the largest ship to sink.

en.name: Herkja Drummond
en.tooltip: <keyword=veil>Veil</keyword>.\n<keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Split 3 damage randomly between enemy units on a row.\nAt the end of your turn, if the <keyword=order>Order</keyword> is not used, damage a random enemy unit by 1.
en.fluff: Faithful to her clan and its jarl, her father – to the very end.

en.name: Horst Borsodi
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Gain 3 <keyword=coin>Coins</keyword>.\nIf Ewald Borsodi is in your graveyard, gain 6 <keyword=coin>Coins</keyword> instead.\n<keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 1: Give an allied unit <keyword=vitality>Vitality</keyword> (1).
en.fluff: My auction house is, above all, a gathering place for the elite of the elite.

en.name: Saul de Navarette
en.tooltip: <keyword=hoard>Hoard</keyword> 3: At the end of your turn, boost self by 1.\n<keyword=hoard>Hoard</keyword> 6: At the end of your turn, boost self by 2 instead.\n<keyword=hoard>Hoard</keyword> 9: At the end of your turn, boost self by 3 instead.
en.fluff: A connoisseur with bottomless pockets and a soul black as tar.

en.name: Harald Gord
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost self by 0.\nIncrease the boost by 1 for each special card you played this game. The boost cannot exceed 12.
en.fluff: The last occasion Harald's grim countenance betrayed a smile was in 1211 when Brouver Hoog drunkenly ate five bowls of goat and cabbage stew then promptly shat his trousers.

en.name: Trial of the Grasses
en.tooltip: Set a unit's power to 13. If it's not a Witcher, damage it by 6 and <keyword=infused>Infuse</keyword> it with the Witcher category first.
en.fluff: Imagine a lump of clay. In order to shape it, you must first moisten it or it will crumble. The Trial's initial part does just that. It opens the body to change, so to speak. Only then can the mutagens produce a witcher.

en.name: Arcane Tome
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Play a special card from your deck, then move self to the opposite row. If there is no space on the opposite row, destroy self.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 1\nAt the end of your turn, if not on <keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>, destroy self.
en.fluff: Alzur’s opus magnum. Contains the accumulated knowledge of the legendary mage.\n\nMages across the realms knew of the simplicity and elegance of Alzur's repertoire, but the sheer, overwhelming mechanics behind them remained forever guarded.

en.name: Decoy
en.tooltip: Shuffle an allied unit on the battlefield into your deck, then play the top unit from your deck.
en.fluff: When you run out of peasants, decoys also make decent arrow fodder.

en.name: Skellige Storm
en.tooltip: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> <keyword=storm>Storm</keyword> on an enemy row for 2 turns.
en.fluff: This ain't no normal storm. This here's the wrath of the gods.

en.name: Sangreal
en.tooltip: <keyword=purify>Purify</keyword> and boost a unit by 12, then <keyword=infused>Infuse</keyword> it with "Once both players have passed, damage self by 12".
en.fluff: It is the duchess's exclusive privilege to delight in the prized, oaky flavor of Sangreal... A pleasure she partakes in very, very often.

en.name: Selective mutation
en.tooltip: Draw a card with <keyword=adrenaline>Adrenaline</keyword> of your choice, then shuffle a card from your hand back into your deck. <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Witcher Student on each allied row.
en.fluff: We can destroy what we have created, but we cannot uncreate it.

en.name: Parasite
en.tooltip: Damage an enemy unit by 6, or boost an allied unit by 6.
en.fluff: A real eye-catcher.

en.name: Armory
en.tooltip: <keyword=resilient>Resilience</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost an allied unit by 6.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Give an allied unit 3 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.
en.fluff: Guisarmes? Maces? Spiked Maces? I have everything you could possibly need.

en.name: Reinforcements
en.tooltip: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play a base copy of a bronze allied unit.
en.fluff: Sound the retreat! Regroup! And wait for reinforcements!

en.name: Bloody Flail
en.tooltip: Give an enemy unit <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> (8).\nFor each Soldier you control, decrease the <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> duration by 1 and damage that unit by 1 instead.
en.fluff: There are weapons banned in all the Northern Realms, for the wounds they deal are horrible beyond all imagining.

en.name: Zoltan's Company
en.tooltip: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> 2 Rowdy Dwarves on an allied row. Increase the number of <keyword=spawn>Spawned</keyword> Rowdy Dwarves by 1 for each Zoltan in your starting deck.
en.fluff: They'd follow each other into the fire. And laugh about it.

en.name: Mutagenerator
en.tooltip: Whenever you play a unit on your <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword> row, boost 5 random units on your side of battlefield with the same provision cost by 1.\nWhenever you play a unit on your <keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword> row, boost 5 random units in your deck with the same provision cost by 1.
en.fluff: An alchemy device capable of storing the essence of slain creatures. Transmutes the energy into mutagens.\n\nPrimitive in its current form, the apparatus usually produces haphazard results, making experimentation exceedingly difficult to replicate.

en.name: Treant Mantis: Stalk
en.tooltip: <keyword=Spring>Spring</keyword>: Transform into Treant Mantis: Strike.\n<keyword=ambush>Ambush</keyword>: Give the next unit played by your opponent <keyword=poison>Poison</keyword> and transform into Treant Mantis: Strike.
en.fluff: Feel to you like we're bein' followed?

en.name: Gigascorpion Decoction
en.tooltip: Damage a unit by 1 six times.
en.fluff: How much of a dose would be lethal? Any.

en.name: Prism Pendant
en.tooltip: Whenever you target an allied unit with a special, give it <keyword=vitality>Vitality</keyword> equal to the special's provision cost.\nWhenever you target an enemy unit with a special, give it <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> equal to the special's provision cost.
en.fluff: Its light, glassy design—inspired by a simple wonder of nature—makes channeling magical energy as easy as breathing.

en.name: Pitfall Trap
en.tooltip: <keyword=ambush>Ambush</keyword>: When your opponent plays a card face up, split damage equal to its provision cost randomly between all enemy units.\n<keyword=Spring>Spring</keyword>: Split 6 damage randomly between all enemy units.
en.fluff: Simple, cheap and deadly efficient - no wonder it's one of the Scoia'tael's favorite traps.

en.name: Pickpocket
en.tooltip: <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 8.
en.fluff: My apologies, miss... Always been a clumsy one, I have.

en.name: Damnation
en.tooltip: Destroy an allied unit and <keyword=create>Create</keyword> and play a 4-provision cost Firesworn unit. Increase the provision value by the power of the destroyed unit.
en.fluff: I can't bloody breathe! Won't they burn the wretches someplace else?

en.name: Mastercrafted Spear
en.tooltip: Damage an enemy unit by 6. \n<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: Damage another enemy unit by the excess damage dealt.
en.fluff: Hold that spear up, weakling! Not a single horse shall pass!

en.name: Berengar
en.tooltip: At the start of your turn, if there are no other Witchers on this row, destroy self.
en.fluff: Talking the vodyanoi out of sacrificing the prize-winning cow wasn’t an easy task.

en.name: Runeword
en.tooltip: <keyword=create>Create</keyword> and play a bronze Northern Realms Mage and give it a <keyword=shield>Shield</keyword>.
en.fluff: Probably best not to utter that.

en.name: Imperial Golem
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=reveal>Reveal</keyword> the top unit from your opponent's deck and damage self by its power, then shuffle it back.
en.fluff: The most powerful of Nilfgaard's mages have mastered the art of creating golems. On a few occasions, they've even managed to make them fight for the imperial cause…

en.name: Bountiful Harvest
en.tooltip: <keyword=create>Create</keyword> and play a bronze Scoia'tael Elf, then, depending on the position of chosen unit, boost the left-most, random, or the right-most unit in your hand by 2.
en.fluff: Never have we tilled nor torn up the land, unlike you dh'oine with your hoes and ploughs. You wrest bloody tributes from the Queen of the Fields, while we celebrate her every gift.

en.name: Count Caldwell
en.tooltip: At the end of your turn, move this unit to the row with the highest-power unit on the battlefield, excluding self. If it changed sides, gain <keyword=spying>Spying</keyword>. If it already had <keyword=spying>Spying</keyword>, remove <keyword=spying>Spying</keyword> instead.
en.fluff: Your Majesty… For the queen to question commoners, why, it's simply not proper…

en.name: Orb of Insight
en.tooltip: Boost an allied unit by 2 and give it <keyword=vitality>Vitality</keyword> (2).\nWhile in your graveyard, lower the Counter by 1 whenever you play a special card. When the Counter reaches 0, play this card and give it <keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.\nCounter: 3
en.fluff: It shows only one of many possible futures.

en.name: Crushing Trap
en.tooltip: <keyword=spring>Spring</keyword>: Damage all units on a row by 1.\n<keyword=ambush>Ambush</keyword> (<keyword=timer>Timer</keyword> 2): Damage all enemy units on the row with the most units by 2.
en.fluff: When this knocks you down, you don't get up again.

en.name: War of Clans
en.tooltip: Damage an enemy unit by 2.\n<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: Play a 4-provision cost Warrior from your graveyard and give it <keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.\n<keyword=devotion>Devotion</keyword>: Always trigger the <keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword> ability.
en.fluff: Brother against brother, sister against sister. One blood that soaks up the ground.

en.name: Tourney Shaelmaar
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Damage an enemy Nilfgaard unit by 7.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Boost self by 2 for each non-Neutral allied unit from a different faction than your starting one.
en.fluff: Releasing a monster that dangerous in front of a crowd? Plain irresponsible.

en.name: Dorregaray of Vole
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=lock>Lock</keyword> a unit.
en.fluff: Like the witchers, Dorregaray is a monster aficionado, though he's developed his own classification system. Instead of dividing them into necrophages, ogroids and the like, he just thinks they're all wonderful.

en.name: Fisher King
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Move any card from your deck to the top.
en.fluff: Mhmm.

en.name: Musicians of Blaviken
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Gain randomly <keyword=shield>Shield</keyword>, <keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>, <keyword=resilient>Resilience</keyword> or <keyword=poison>Poison</keyword>.
en.fluff: Cock-a-doodle-doo! Meeeooow! Woof woof! Hee-haw!

en.name: Procession of Penance
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage self by 10. Reduce the damage by 2 for every Firesworn Token you control.
en.fluff: Careful not to stand too close. Got blood splattered on me favorite tunic last time.

en.name: Marlene de Trastamara
en.tooltip: <keyword=veil>Veil</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Give a unit <keyword=veil>Veil</keyword>.
en.fluff: None shall sit and dine with you at your table, no spoon you have shall sate you, never again shall you wish to spy your reflection in the mirror.

en.name: Troll Porter
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): <keyword=banish>Banish</keyword> all cards in your hand, then draw as many cards.
en.fluff: Although he came from a known line of haberdashers, Kurtz' Kart was certainly a far cry from his grandfather's legacy, Wurr's Wares.

en.name: Vaedermakar
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Increase all row effect durations by 1.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Decrease all row effect durations by 1.\nIf you control Scepter of Storms, increase or decrease the durations by 3 instead.
en.fluff: The druid Vaedermakar controls the elements. He soothes storms into silence, musters destructive hail, summons lightning to turn foes into ash. So I advise you well… treat him with utmost respect.

en.name: Xavier Lemmens
en.tooltip:
<keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>.
<keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): <keyword=banish>Banish</keyword> a card from your opponent's graveyard.
<keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): <keyword=banish>Banish</keyword> a card from your graveyard.
<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 1
en.fluff: Your engineer's got a pate like stewed meat, but he kens his trade, that's for certain.

en.name: Iris von Everec
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Give an allied unit <keyword=vitality>Vitality</keyword> (4).
en.fluff: I remember so little… Yet when I think of my rose, I begin to recall what was.

en.name: Old Speartip: Asleep
en.tooltip: <keyword=timer>Timer</keyword> 3: <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> Old Speartip from your deck to this row and increase its base power by 6, then <keyword=banish>Banish</keyword> self.\nIf Old Speartip: Asleep takes damage, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> Old Speartip from your deck, then <keyword=banish>Banish</keyword> self instead.
en.fluff: Do not disturb.

en.name: Nivellen
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Move 3 adjacent units to the other row.
en.fluff: Lost? Well, go be lost somewhere else. Somewhere not on my property, that is. Point your left ear to the sun and keep walking, you'll hit the road soon enough. Well? What're you waiting for?

en.name: Alpha Werewolf
en.tooltip: <keyword=immune>Immunity</keyword>. <keyword=thrive>Thrive</keyword>.
en.fluff: Some say lycanthropy's contagious - get bit by a werewolf, you turn into one yourself. Witchers know that's nonsense, of course - only a powerful curse can bring on this condition.

en.name: Skjall
en.tooltip: <keyword=berserk>Berserk</keyword> 5: Destroy self.
en.fluff: Strike his name from the Saga of Elders! No one dare grant him shelter or sustenance!

en.name: Vrygheff
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Trigger the end of turn abilities of 2 allied bronze Soldiers.
en.fluff: "An eye for an eye" only ends when the whole world's blind.

en.name: Queen of the Night
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Give an enemy unit <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> (3).\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): <keyword=purify>Purify</keyword> a unit.
en.fluff: Those seduced by her charms find themselves willing to pay any price.

en.name: Fergus var Emreis
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Give an enemy unit <keyword=spying>Spying</keyword>.\n<keyword=devotion>Devotion</keyword>: Give 3 enemy units <keyword=spying>Spying</keyword> instead.
en.fluff: Usurper demanded that the fallen emperor grant legitimacy to the coup, and when Fergus refused, his 13-year-old son, Emhyr, was tortured. But that changed nothing.

en.name: Endrega Queen
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=consume>Consume</keyword> an allied unit and gain <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword> equal to its provision cost.\n<keyword=barricade>Barricade</keyword>: At the end of your turn, damage self by 1, then <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Drone on this row.
en.fluff: The Endrega Queen can be easily recognized by the specific coloring of its abdomen. Or, more easily, by its monstrous size

en.name: Wererat
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a number of Rats on this row equal to the amount of boost on self, then lose a point of boost for each Rat <keyword=spawn>Spawned</keyword>.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 1\nBefore the end of your turn, <keyword=consume>Consume</keyword> the unit to the right.
en.fluff: As a child, Idarran lived in the canals of Vizima. He was a natural-born genius, and at the age of five, he had already started experimenting on sewer rats.

en.name: Johnny
en.tooltip: Whenever you play a special card, damage a random enemy unit by 2.
en.fluff: Life without savoring the sound of "surreptitious shananacking" is like licking snails through a cloth.

en.name: Sarah
en.tooltip: Whenever you play a special card, boost a random allied unit by 2.
en.fluff: Little Sarah wants to play!

en.name: Stammelford's Tremors
en.tooltip: Damage all enemy units by 1.
en.fluff: The sorcerer Stammelford moved a mountain that obscured the view from his tower. Rumor has it he could only do so for he'd fettered a d'ao, an earth elemental.

en.name: Lacerate
en.tooltip: Damage all units on a row by 2.
en.fluff: A sight more horrid you've never seen… The poor soul lay shredded as the beast lapped up its blood from the ground all around.

en.name: Ceallach Dyffryn
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=purify>Purify</keyword> all allied units on this row.
en.fluff: "Your Imperial Highness…" blurted out the seneschal, whose presence until now had been thoroughly ignored. "I beg your pardon, but Cahir… My son..."

en.name: Auckes
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=lock>Lock</keyword> an enemy unit. If Serrit is in your hand, <keyword=lock>Lock</keyword> all copies of that unit on your opponent's side instead.
en.fluff: Letho's got a plan… what could go wrong?

en.name: Abaya
en.tooltip: <keyword=thrive>Thrive</keyword>. \n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Trigger an allied unit's <keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword> ability.
en.fluff: Seen a lot o' ugly critters in me life – morays, lampreys, blobfish… But never nothin' like this!

en.name: Derran
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Damage self by 3, then move a card from your deck to your graveyard.
en.fluff: Whatever caused this madness must have been terrifying…

en.name: Gael
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Damage an enemy unit by 1. If it's <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> deal 3 damage instead.\n<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: Boost self by the destroyed unit's base power.
en.fluff: A fondness for shiny trinkets is not a trait unique to magpies.

en.name: Margarita Laux-Antille
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=lock>Lock</keyword> an enemy unit.
en.fluff: I care only about what's good for Aretuza and my pupils.

en.name: Coodcoodak
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=purify>Purify</keyword> adjacent units.
en.fluff: Coodcoodak, throwing his head back, howled and growled, screeched and squealed, whined and bleated – all in a medley of voices both known and unknown, domestic and wild, of reality and of myth.

en.name: Istredd
en.tooltip: <keyword=patience>Patience</keyword>.\n<keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Draw up to [1] card(s), then shuffle the same number of cards back into your deck.\nWhenever you draw a unit card, boost it by 1, if it's not a unit, boost self by 1 instead.
en.fluff: Love can make one do crazy things. The loss of love, even more so.

en.name: Ida Emean aep Sivney
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): <keyword=purify>Purify</keyword> a unit.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Give an allied unit <keyword=vitality>Vitality</keyword> (3).
en.fluff: I am a Sage. My power lies in possessing knowledge. Not sharing it.

en.name: Vreemde
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost an allied Soldier and all copies of it by 2.
en.fluff: The Great Sun shall warm the North with its rays, even if it means I must slaughter you all!

en.name: Jotunn
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Boost self by 2 for every unit more your opponent has on the battlefield.
en.fluff: Skellige legend claims the mighty and terrible Jotunn, King of Giants, reigned over the isles in ancient times. He was slain by Hemdall, but with his dying breath he vowed to return for Ragh nar Roog.

en.name: Paulie Dahlberg
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Move a unit to the other row.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Give an allied unit 2 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.
en.fluff: Move yer arses! It's a ploughin' trap!

en.name: Prince Villem
en.tooltip: <keyword=disloyal>Disloyal</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Play a random gold card from your deck.
en.fluff: The boy's not fit to wear the crown. Hasn't sufficient wit nor valor. I know this, you know this… just, he knows it not.

en.name: Glynnis aep Loernach
en.tooltip: <keyword=assimilate>Assimilate</keyword> 2.
en.fluff: She loved every soldier like a son. She cried for each one.

en.name: Djenge Frett
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=bloodthirst>Bloodthirst</keyword> 1): <keyword=lock>Lock</keyword> an enemy unit.
en.fluff: When a warrant says "dead or alive," most bounty hunters'll just kill you. Not me. Should I catch you, you'll hang, and I'll tickle your feet as you expire.

en.name: Prize-Winning Cow
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Transform into Chort.
en.fluff: Mooooo.

en.name: Síle de Tansarville
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 2.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 2.
en.fluff: The Lodge lacks humility. Our lust for power may yet be our undoing.

en.name: Ciaran aep Easnillen
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=lock>Lock</keyword> a unit and move it to the other row.
en.fluff: The path to freedom is paved in blood, not ink.

en.name: Morenn
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Damage an enemy unit by 2.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): <keyword=lock>Lock</keyword> a unit.
en.fluff: Lady Eithné's daughter had inherited her sublime beauty and her wild hatred for all that is human.

en.name: Peter Saar Gwynleve
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Reset the power of a unit.
en.fluff: These are not the hands of an "Excellency," but of a farmer. So we speak peasant to peasant.

en.name: Vanhemar
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Destroy a <keyword=lock>Locked</keyword> enemy unit.
en.fluff: For a fire mage, he's not very… flamboyant.

en.name: Heymaey Flaminica
en.tooltip: At the end of your turn, <keyword=heal>Heal</keyword> all other units on this row by 1.
en.fluff: A flaminica, the highest position among the druidesses, commands a great deal of respect and wields a great deal of power.

en.name: Arnvald
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Transform a damaged allied unit into a Bear Abomination.
en.fluff: His name on the island was synonymous with loyalty. For a time.

en.name: Malena
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Move a unit to the other row.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 1
en.fluff: I hate you, dh'oine. You are all the same.

en.name: Gremist
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): <keyword=purify>Purify</keyword> a unit.\nWhenever you play an Alchemy card, refresh this ability.
en.fluff: An archdruid, a master of alchemy, and the grumpiest old fart in the Isles.

en.name: Barclay Els
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Give each allied Dwarf 1 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>. \nIf they already had <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>, boost them by 1 instead.
en.fluff: Our mead smells rotten to ye, do it? Easy to fix – I'll break yer nose!

en.name: Draig Bon-Dhu
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Move a bronze Warrior from your deck to your graveyard.\n<keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Trigger the <keyword=veteran>Veteran</keyword> ability of a unit in your graveyard.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 1
en.fluff: Hear ye now the tale of the heroic deeds of Clan an Craite.

en.name: Roderick of Dun Tynne
en.tooltip: <keyword=disloyal>Disloyal</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Look at 2 random gold cards from your deck, then play 1 of them.
en.fluff: Roderick lived as a recluse, avoiding society at large. Instead, he preferred the company of a small party of knights. If they can truly be called such...

en.name: Kurt
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Place a <keyword=bounty>Bounty</keyword> on an enemy unit.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): <keyword=purify>Purify</keyword> a unit.
en.fluff: Oy, Kurt, find out what Merigold's hollerin' about, if she needs anything. A hot iron to the tongue, maybe?

en.name: Percival Schuttenbach
en.tooltip: <keyword=harmony>Harmony</keyword> 2.
en.fluff: Underneath the wet hood, instead of a billowy beard, was a long, pointed nose, clearly marking its owner as a member of the old and noble race of gnomes.

en.name: Etriel
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 3.\nIf you control Muirlega, damage it by 7 instead.
en.fluff: People tame wild animals. I talk to them.

en.name: Muirlega
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 3.\nIf you control Etriel, also damage adjacent units by 3.
en.fluff: It has brushes for ears. And human blood on its teeth.

en.name: Coën
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Boost all allied units with power equal to Coën by the amount of boost on Coën.
en.fluff: “There is no such thing as a fair fight. Every advantage and every opportunity that arises is used in combat.” ⁠— Coën

en.name: Octavia Hale
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Draw up to 2 of Octavia's sons to your hand, then shuffle back the same number of cards.\n<keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 2: Boost an allied Witch Hunter by 2. If you destroyed an enemy unit this turn, boost by 3 instead.
en.fluff: A mother is more than just the sum of her children.

en.name: Braenn
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: If you control 2 or more other Dryads, gain <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 1.\n<keyword=charge>Charges</keyword>: 3
en.fluff: Mona…? No… no. I'm Braenn. A daughter of Brokilon.

en.name: Yoana
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=heal>Heal</keyword> an allied unit by 2.\n<keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>: 1\nWhenever an adjacent unit takes damage, gain 1 <keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>.
en.fluff: No one'd ever think I could be a skilled armorer - a human, and a woman to boot. A dwarven blacksmith - that's another story…

en.name: False Ciri
en.tooltip:
<keyword=disloyal>Disloyal</keyword>.
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Play a bronze Tactic from your graveyard and give it <keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.
At the end of your turn, boost self by 1.
<keyword=grace>Grace</keyword> 8: Move self to the opposite row and <keyword=purify>Purify</keyword> self.
en.fluff: "Here she comes," he thought, "our imperial interest. A mock-princess, a mock-queen for Cintra. A mock-ruler for the mouth of the Yarra, future lifeblood of the empire."

en.name: Giant Boar
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Boost self by 1 for each damaged unit.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Boost self by the amount a unit is damaged.
en.fluff: Most men, seeing a massive boar in the woods, mess their trousers and scurry up the nearest tree. A Skelliger, though - he just drools.

en.name: Adalbertus Kalkstein
en.tooltip: <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 2.\n<keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 2: <keyword=purify>Purify</keyword> a unit.
en.fluff: Before Kalkstein departed this world, he left us with some rather unflattering words about our gracious king...

en.name: Sir Skewertooth
en.tooltip: <keyword=intimidate>Intimidate</keyword> 2.\n<keyword=tribute>Tribute</keyword> 2: Gain <keyword=immune>Immunity</keyword>.
en.fluff: Here he is! My knight in swining armor!

en.name: Renfri's Gang
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: If your starting deck has at least 25 units, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> all copies of self from your deck to this row.
en.fluff: What would a princess be without six bloodthirsty henchmen?

en.name: Udalryk an Brokvar
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=bloodthirst>Bloodthirst</keyword> 2): Gain <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage a unit by 1.\n<keyword=charge>Charges</keyword>: 3
en.fluff: The gods have spoken: a sacrifice is required.

en.name: Vincent Meis
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Set the power of an unboosted enemy unit to 1.
en.fluff: By day, Captain of the Vizima City Guard. By night, merciless avenger and defender of the downtrodden.

en.name: An Craite Greatsword
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage self by 6.\nWhenever an enemy unit takes damage, <keyword=heal>Heal</keyword> self by 1.
en.fluff: Ahh, ye gave me a good laugh there, Nordling! Why, this bastard, ye couldn't even grip it, let alone gut me with it.

en.name: Ronvid the Incessant
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost self by 5.\nWhenever you play a Soldier, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> this unit from your graveyard to a random allied row.
en.fluff: This self-dubbed knight roams the world defending the honor of his beloved Maid Bilberry - though none are certain where she lives, if she lives still or if she ever lived at all.

en.name: Pulling The Strings
en.tooltip:
<keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 0.
<keyword=seize>Seize</keyword> an enemy unit with 0 or less power.
Increase <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> by 1 for each unique <keyword=gang>Gang</keyword> category in your starting deck.
Increase the power and decrease <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> by 1 for each unique <keyword=gang>Gang</keyword> category you control.
en.fluff: Aptly named, the Crown represents an authority of the highest degree. One to whom folks sink to their lowest depths for in order to avoid becoming indebted.

en.name: Barbegazi
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=consume>Consume</keyword> an allied unit.\n<keyword=charge>Charges</keyword>: 2
en.fluff: What moments before looked like round rocks among the stalagmites now stared at him with enormous, bright, menacing eyes.

en.name: Roderick de Wett
en.tooltip: <keyword=veil>Veil</keyword>.\n<keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Flaming Rose Footman on this row.\nAt the end of your turn, if the <keyword=order>Order</keyword> is not used, gain 1 <keyword=coin>Coin</keyword>.
en.fluff: Count de Wett is exceptionally loathsome and arrogant, but at least he enjoys a little dice poker on the side.

en.name: Selfeater
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Halve this unit's base power, then <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a copy with the same base power on this row.\nWhenever you play a Relict, increase this unit's base power by 1.
en.fluff: Omnomnomnom.

en.name: Ancient Foglet
en.tooltip: <keyword=veil>Veil</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost self by the total duration of row effects on the opposite side.\nWhenever you apply a row effect, boost self by its duration.
en.fluff: Many primal fears lurk in the hearts of men. The fear of the mist is well–founded…

en.name: Fleder
en.tooltip: When <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> is applied to an enemy unit, boost self by the amount applied.\nCounter: 1\nAt the start of your turn, refresh the Counter.
en.fluff: The children o' the night come as punishment from the gods! We's tolerated wizard-folk and non-human filth in our midst too long! Repent! 'Fore yer soul rots, repent!

en.name: Kingslayer
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=reveal>Reveal</keyword> the top card from your opponent's deck and <keyword=banish>Banish</keyword> it.
en.fluff: The School of the Viper shall be reborn… Letho saw to that.

en.name: Rico Meiersdorf
en.tooltip: Whenever opponent plays a unit while Rico is in your hand or deck, set his power equal to that unit's power.
en.fluff: I never did much like bees.

en.name: Blightmaker
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Move a card in your deck to the top of it. If it was a Mage, <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> The Guardian on this row. If it was a special card, <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play a Cow Carcass.
en.fluff: In an attempt to manufacture a superior grapevine, the empire’s botanists stumbled upon the creation of a malignant alchemical, and thus was sown the seed of a scheme most sinister.

en.name: Endrega Larva
en.tooltip: <keyword=thrive>Thrive</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a base copy of this unit and <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> it to this row.
en.fluff: Fat, plump… and bloodthirsty.

en.name: Kerack Frigate
en.tooltip:
<keyword=resupply>Resupply</keyword>.
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Volunteer on this row.
<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 2
<keyword=crew>Crew</keyword>: Set <keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword> to 1.
en.fluff: “I should buy a boat”, said a Kerackian cat once. Or so claims the drunken ballad.

en.name: Alumni
en.tooltip:
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: If both values are equal to or higher than 4, gain <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>.
<keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Damage an enemy unit by 0.
<keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Boost an allied unit by 0.
Values correspond to the highest <keyword=patience>Patience</keyword> achieved by your Ban Ard Student or Aretuza Student cards.
en.fluff: Deep down, they had both been waiting for this moment for a long time. Live targets had been a bit of a taboo in academia.

en.name: Hawker Smuggler
en.tooltip: <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>: At the end of your turn, boost a random unit in your hand by 1.
en.fluff: I fight for whoever's paying the best. Or whoever's easiest to rob.

en.name: Giantslayer
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Choose an enemy unit. If its base power is higher than self's, gain 3 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.\n<keyword=barricade>Barricade</keyword>: At the end of your turn, damage chosen unit by 1.\n<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: Gain <keyword=resilient>Resilience</keyword>.
en.fluff: Aye, they call me the Giantslayer, and nay, it ain't from bein' a humongous bastard now, is it, ye cocknosed shite!

en.name: Sorceress of Dol Blathanna
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=create>Create</keyword> and play a bronze Scoia'tael special card with a provision cost equal to, or lower than, this card's power.
en.fluff: Whilst you are mesmerized by the fishes, a different elf moves to cut your throat.

en.name: Viper Witcher Mentor
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Set the power of this card to match the provision cost of the top card in your opponent's deck.\n<keyword=adrenaline>Adrenaline</keyword> 2: Set the power of this card to match the provision cost of the highest-cost card in your opponent's deck instead.
en.fluff: Viper mentors are especially cold and ruthless in order to prepare their students for the harsh life that awaits them.

en.name: Messenger of the Sea
en.tooltip: Whenever <keyword=rain>Rain</keyword> or <keyword=storm>Storm</keyword> damages enemy units, boost self by the damage dealt.
en.fluff: A cute little nightmare.

en.name: Reaver Hunters
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a base copy of self on this row and set its base power to 1 less than self.\n<keyword=bonded>Bonded</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): At the end of your turn, damage the highest-power enemy unit by 1.
en.fluff: See this here tattoo? 'At's me, hackin' at a dragon. A DRAGON, m'lady.

en.name: Redanian Secret Service
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=purify>Purify</keyword> an allied unit.\nIf you do not control Redanian Secret Service, when an allied unit gains a status, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> self from your deck to its row.
en.fluff: They say the aristocracy can sniff out a commoner among them. However, liberal application of alcohol and perfume can throw off the scent for long enough to strike up a conversation or two. Perhaps even gain their trust.

en.name: Wagon
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=banish>Banish</keyword> the bronze unit to the right, then gain <keyword=resilient>Resilience</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Transform self into a base copy of the <keyword=banish>Banished</keyword> unit.\n<keyword=exposed>Exposed</keyword>: <keyword=purify>Purify</keyword> self.
en.fluff: The driver swore he was carrying seeds. But seeds don't clank on bumps in the road…

en.name: Nauzicaa Sergeant
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: If your opponent has won a round this game, <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play Battle Preparation.
en.fluff: The Emperor will teach the North discipline.

en.name: Sapper
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Play a Bomb from your hand, then draw a card.\n<keyword=barricade>Barricade</keyword>: Whenever you play a Bomb, damage a random enemy unit by 1.
en.fluff: Aim wherever you want. The shrapnel will take care of it.

en.name: Spotter
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Look at the top 3 units in your opponent's deck, then choose one and gain <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword> equal to its power.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Lose all <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword> and look at the top units in your deck up to that amount, then choose one and gain <keyword=vitality>Vitality</keyword> equal to its power. If it's a bronze Soldier, boost self by its power instead.
en.fluff: The North has nothing with which it could surprise us.

en.name: Farseer
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost an unboosted unit in your hand by the number of boosted units in your hand.
en.fluff: Her words might seem unintelligible at times, but they always contain hidden meanings and tremendous wisdom.

en.name: Townsfolk
en.tooltip: Whenever you gain <keyword=coin>Coins</keyword>, boost self by 1.
en.fluff: You see people, but I see a flock o' sheep that needs fleecin'.

en.name: Fallen Knight
en.tooltip: <keyword=veil>Veil</keyword>. <keyword=intimidate>Intimidate</keyword>.\nWhenever you <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a unit on your side of the battlefield, boost self by 1 for each unit <keyword=spawn>Spawned</keyword>.
en.fluff: He abandoned the righteous fight and the flame in him has long gone.

en.name: Elf and Onion Soup
en.tooltip: Destroy 2 allied units of the same border color, then <keyword=create>Create</keyword> and play a unit of the same color from your faction or neutrals.
en.fluff: Garnish each serving with grated cheese. Add eyeballs to taste. Serve hot.

en.name: Tempest
en.tooltip: <keyword=purify>Purify</keyword> 3 adjacent enemy units and damage them by 2.
en.fluff: A Category 10 on the Bekker scale.

en.name: Bearification
en.tooltip: Transform an artifact into an Elder Bear. If it's on your side of the battlefield, boost it by 4.
en.fluff: Just bear with me.

en.name: Artefact Compression
en.tooltip: <keyword=lock>Lock</keyword> a unit and reset its power.
en.fluff: The figurine expanded in a flash, pulsing and throbbing, changing its shape and structure like a puff of smoke crawling over the floor. Beams of light revealed movement and hardening materials. A moment later, in the center of the magic circle a human form suddenly appeared.

en.name: Scepter of Storms
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play Biting Frost, Impenetrable Fog, or Torrential Rain.
en.fluff: Some call it the Stick of Truth.

en.name: Mysterious Puzzle Box
en.tooltip:
<keyword=disloyal>Disloyal</keyword>.
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a 7-power Lamp Djinn on the opposite row. If neither player has passed, choose a card from your hand.
<keyword=adrenaline>Adrenaline</keyword> 2: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a 7-power Lamp Djinn on the opposite row and destroy self instead.
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Pick a card from your hand.
At the end of your turn, transform the highest-provision chosen card(s) in hand into Thing From the Box, then <keyword=banish>Banish</keyword> self.
en.fluff: A masterfully decorated box brought from a faraway land.\n\nDue to the intricate security, one can assume that the contents are either extremely valuable or unimaginably dangerous. Only the brave⁠—or foolish—would ever consider opening it.

en.name: Devana Runestone
en.tooltip: <keyword=create>Create</keyword> and play a bronze Monsters faction card.
en.fluff: My blades're so sharp, they can cut paper!

en.name: Dazhbog Runestone
en.tooltip: <keyword=create>Create</keyword> and play a bronze Nilfgaard faction card.
en.fluff: Careful. Still hot.

en.name: Zoria Runestone
en.tooltip: <keyword=create>Create</keyword> and play a bronze Northern Realms faction card.
en.fluff: I'm getting a palpable chill from this runestone… did I do something to hurt its feelings?

en.name: Morana Runestone
en.tooltip: <keyword=create>Create</keyword> and play a bronze Scoia'tael faction card.
en.fluff: I grow faint at the very sight of it…

en.name: Delirium
en.tooltip: Split 6 damage randomly between all units on an enemy row.
en.fluff: "Ehh, too big for a humpback. That's a finback." "A finback? With a snout that short? Those herbs've gone to your head!"

en.name: Restore
en.tooltip: <keyword=heal>Heal</keyword> an allied unit, then boost it by the amount it was healed.
en.fluff: Those cursed sorceresses are stealing our thunder! Whyever should folk choose a procedure taking several hours, when some perfumed tart can solve their problem with a wave of her hand?

en.name: Stribog Runestone
en.tooltip: <keyword=create>Create</keyword> and play a bronze Skellige faction card.
en.fluff: Ofieri runemasters can combine these into runewords of incredible power.

en.name: Excommunication
en.tooltip: <keyword=banish>Banish</keyword> an allied unit, then play the top card from your deck.\nIf the target was a Firesworn, look at the top 3 cards from your deck and play 1 of them instead.
en.fluff: Aye, better than the pyre, I suppose... But did ye hear the disappointment in his voice? Now that's real sufferin'.

en.name: Wheel of Fortune
en.tooltip: Damage an enemy unit by a random amount between 1 and 10.
en.fluff: A game where "good aim" is considered subjective.

en.name: Adrenaline Rush
en.tooltip: Boost an allied unit by 8 if there are no other units on that row.
en.fluff: The beast rushed at them wildly, with fury in its eyes, immune to pain and any strikes the defenders could land. Nothing stood to stop it…

en.name: Piercing Missile
en.tooltip: Damage an enemy unit by 4, ignoring its <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.
en.fluff: There's no armor that can't be pierced.

en.name: Will o' the wisp
en.tooltip: Destroy a <keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword> unit.
en.fluff: Fool's fires... those little shiny thingies that shall lead thee to certain doom.

en.name: Red Riders
en.tooltip:
Choose one:
<keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> <keyword=frost>Frost</keyword> on an enemy row for 4 turns.
<keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> <keyword=frost>Frost</keyword> on an enemy row for 2 turns, then replay a bronze Wild Hunt unit.
<keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> <keyword=frost>Frost</keyword> on both enemy rows for 2 turns.
en.fluff: They paint the sky with snow and the earth with fire.

en.name: Experimental Remedy
en.tooltip: Play a Bronze unit from your opponent's graveyard.
en.fluff: Well... At least, I can't make you more dead...

en.name: Assassination
en.tooltip: Damage a unit by 6. Decrease the damage by 1 for each adjacent non-<keyword=spying>Spying</keyword> unit.
en.fluff: Assassin — one of the most popular professions at the imperial court, just after scribe and courtesan.

en.name: Amnesty
en.tooltip: <keyword=seize>Seize</keyword> an enemy unit with 3 or less power.\n<keyword=conspiracy>Conspiracy</keyword>: Also boost it by 2.\n<keyword=devotion>Devotion</keyword>: Always trigger the <keyword=conspiracy>Conspiracy</keyword> ability.
en.fluff: You did what to who? To be fair, I can’t even recall the specifics anymore.

en.name: Forbidden Magic
en.tooltip: Damage an enemy unit by 2. \n<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Kaedweni Revenant and <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> it to a random allied row.
en.fluff: Prohibited? Yes. Eliminated? Far from it.

en.name: Casting Contest
en.tooltip: Boost an allied unit by 5. If it's bronze, reset its <keyword=order>Order</keyword> ability and give it <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>.
en.fluff: Tales of Yennefer of Vengerberg have spurred many an inebriated attempt to replicate her fabled foot-casting. It never ends well.

en.name: Circle of Life
en.tooltip: Damage an enemy unit by 3, then boost a random non-Neutral unit in your hand by 2.\n<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: Boost a non-Neutral unit in your hand instead.
en.fluff: Those who want to destroy Brokilon, who try to burn its trees and kill all the living things in it, will soon enough become nourishment for its soil.

en.name: Backup Plan
en.tooltip: Damage the last unit played by your opponent by 2 and <keyword=create>Create</keyword> a bronze Elf with a <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> ability that was not in your starting deck.
en.fluff: If we can't rob them in the streets, we fight them in the woods!

en.name: Incinerating Trap
en.tooltip: <keyword=Spring>Spring</keyword>: Damage a unit by 3.\n<keyword=ambush>Ambush</keyword>: Damage the next unit your opponent plays on their side by 5.
en.fluff: Careful…! One more step and you'll be turned into molten glass.

en.name: Feral Bond
en.tooltip: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> Skellige Wolves on an enemy row and damage it by 1, then <keyword=create>Create</keyword> a bronze Skellige Warrior that was not in your starting deck.\n<keyword=bloodthirst>Bloodthirst</keyword> 3: You may <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play any bronze Skellige Warrior that was not in your starting deck instead.
en.fluff: When your hour comes, choose the axe. Wolves in these parts tend to take their time.

en.name: Purge
en.tooltip: Damage an enemy unit by 3. Increase the damage by 1 for every Witch Hunter on your side of the battlefield.\n<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: Place a <keyword=bounty>Bounty</keyword> on the highest-power enemy unit.
en.fluff: Thought you could outrun justice, did you, you heathen swine?

en.name: Open, Sesame!
en.tooltip:
<keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 5.
While in your graveyard, whenever you reach 0 <keyword=coin>Coins</keyword>, remove a Counter.
When the Counter reaches 0, gain 4 <keyword=coin>Coins</keyword>.
Counter: 6
en.fluff: I'll have any lock you need picked before you even hire me.

en.name: Maxii Van Dekkar
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Look at your deck in order from top to bottom. You may shuffle your deck, then move a card to the bottom of it.
en.fluff: Magic doesn’t work on her, as she is a proud daughter of the Black Sun—and a bounty hunter that has her eyes on some very powerful sorcerers.

en.name: Alzur's Thunder
en.tooltip: Damage a unit by 5.
en.fluff: We stand not the slightest chance of incanting a spell so complex as Alzur's Thunder. It is claimed Alzur had a voice like a hunting horn and the diction of a master orator.

en.name: Clear Skies
en.tooltip: Boost all units in an ally row by 1.
en.fluff: The sun's shinin', Dromle! The sun's shinin'! Maybe there's hope after all…

en.name: Dimeritium Shackles
en.tooltip: <keyword=lock>Lock</keyword> a unit and damage it by 3.
en.fluff: The mage's arms were twisted and bound behind his back. The Redanians gave the fetters a good shake. Terranova cried out, lurched, bent backwards, bowed forward, then retched and groaned. It was clear of what his manacles were made.

en.name: Rock Barrage
en.tooltip: Damage an enemy unit by 4 and move it to the other row.
en.fluff: Someday, when you are older, you could get hit by a boulder.

en.name: Sandstorm
en.tooltip: Damage units at both ends of an enemy row by 3.
en.fluff: Best case – sand in your teeth. Worst case – buried alive.

en.name: Devil's Puffball
en.tooltip: Damage an enemy unit by 3.\n<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: <keyword=poison>Poison</keyword> adjacent enemy units.
en.fluff: As lethal as it is foul.

en.name: Northern Wind
en.tooltip: Damage a unit by 4.\n<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: <keyword=banish>Banish</keyword> it.
en.fluff: That ought to cool your temper.

en.name: Moon Dust
en.tooltip: <keyword=purify>Purify</keyword> a unit and damage it by 4.
en.fluff: The werewolf lifted and tilted his head, mystified by the silvery dust... Then howled in utter agony.

en.name: Armorer's Workshop
en.tooltip: Boost 3 adjacent units by 2 and give them 2 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.
en.fluff: He'll make a helm out of a pot if need be.

en.name: Arachas Venom
en.tooltip: Damage a unit by 3.\n<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: Also damage adjacent units by 3.
en.fluff: "If substance makes contact with eyes, rinse immediately with cold water, then commence drawing up will."

en.name: Offering
en.tooltip: Destroy a unit with 4 or less power, then boost a unit in your deck by 2.
en.fluff: Both gods and demons alike can be appeased by a plentiful sacrifice.

en.name: Thunderbolt
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost an allied unit by 3.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Boost an allied unit by 3.
en.fluff: The witcher's face changed… his mien turning inhuman, horrifying.

en.name: Odrin
en.tooltip: Odrin is a one man <keyword=crew>Crew</keyword>.
en.fluff: Drinkin' without Odrin is like rowin' without a paddle.

en.name: Petri's Philter
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost an allied unit by 3.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Give an allied unit <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>.
en.fluff: A mage responsible for dozens of brilliant inventions. The mind of a generation. Commonly referred to around the Continent as "that bloke with the dish."

en.name: Predatory Dive
en.tooltip: Each player destroys their lowest-power unit.
