en.fluff: Afraid for their lives, the residents of Hengfors cowered behind thick city walls. A lot of good that did them...

en.name: Spontaneous Evolution
en.tooltip:
Boost an allied unit by 4 and gain an additional effect based on the unit's category:
Insectoid - <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> 3 Drones on the boosted unit's row.
Beast - Boost that unit by 8 instead.
Ogroid - Give all Ogroids in your hand 2 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.
en.fluff: Professor Malaspina accidentally added an extra ingredient to the concoction—compound X.

en.name: Coated Weapons
en.tooltip: Damage an enemy unit by 5.\n<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: If it wasn't a Token, <keyword=banish>Banish</keyword> it and <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a base copy of it on top of opponent's deck.
en.fluff: No need to strike deep when but a scratch will prove fatal.

en.name: Griffin
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Destroy an allied unit on this row. If there are no targets, destroy self.
en.fluff: Griffins like to toy with their prey. Eat 'em alive, piece by piece.

en.name: Boiling Oil
en.tooltip: Damage an enemy unit by 5.\n<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: <keyword=purify>Purify</keyword> adjacent units.
en.fluff: Not good for your skin.

en.name: Nature's Rebuke
en.tooltip: Damage an enemy unit by 5. \n<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: Boost a random allied Treant by 2.
en.fluff: Nature has long endured man's excesses. But even she finally ran out of patience…

en.name: Freya's Blessing
en.tooltip: Play a bronze non-Neutral unit from your graveyard and give it <keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.
en.fluff: Modron Freya, the Great Mother, is the goddess of love, beauty and bounty.

en.name: Nilfgaardian Knight
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost an enemy unit by 2.
en.fluff: Sons of noble houses, born in the City of the Golden Towers, form the elite backbone of the Imperial Army.

en.name: Stunning Blow
en.tooltip: Damage a unit by 5. If it has <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>, damage it by 7 instead.
en.fluff: It clanged like hitting a bell. The Redanian fell to the ground unconscious, dark blood gushing from underneath the dented metal…

en.name: Watchman
en.tooltip: <keyword=shield>Shield</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Give an allied unit a <keyword=shield>Shield</keyword>.
en.fluff: I can't even see over this bloody thing.

en.name: Traveling Merchant
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Shuffle a card from your hand into your deck, then draw a card.
en.fluff: Florens, orens, crowns – I accept them all!

en.name: Cutthroat
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Destroy an enemy unit with 2 or less power.\n<keyword=bonded>Bonded</keyword>: Destroy an enemy unit with 4 or less power instead.
en.fluff: Ahhh, nothin' so soothin' as the sound o' gurglin' blood.

en.name: Eavesdrop
en.tooltip: <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 5.\nDraw a card, then put a card from your hand at the bottom of your deck.
en.fluff: There are always more ears in the room than those you can count.

en.name: Payday
en.tooltip: Damage an enemy unit by 5. Gain a <keyword=coin>Coin</keyword> for each point of excess damage dealt.
en.fluff: I-I already gave ye all me coin!

en.name: Incubus
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> a bronze unit from your opponent's graveyard to the opposite row, then <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> a bronze unit of equal or less provisions from your graveyard to this row.
en.fluff: Women exist to be worshiped.

en.name: Stolen Mutagens
en.tooltip:
Choose a mutagen:
Red - Damage an enemy unit by 4.
Blue - <keyword=poison>Poison</keyword> an allied unit and gain 5 <keyword=coin>Coins</keyword>.
Green - Boost an allied unit by 4 and give it <keyword=veil>Veil</keyword>.
If you control at least 2 Salamandra units, choose an additional mutagen.
en.fluff: Like organ harvesting—but far more lucrative.

en.name: Iron Falcon Knife Juggler
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 1.\n<keyword=bonded>Bonded</keyword>: Also give it <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> (1).\nWhenever you play a <keyword=bonded>Bonded</keyword> unit, refresh the <keyword=order>Order</keyword>.
en.fluff: The weapon's short, but its range is long.

en.name: Wild Hunt Bruiser
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Move an enemy unit to the other row. If the target moves to a row affected by <keyword=frost>Frost</keyword>, damage it by 2.
en.fluff: He considers it an excellent joke - to split the skulls of the living with the skulls of the dead.

en.name: Succubus
en.tooltip: <keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword>: At the end of your turn, if there is another Succubus in your graveyard, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> self from your graveyard to a random row and gain <keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.\n<keyword=adrenaline>Adrenaline</keyword> 4: Don't gain <keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.
en.fluff: Hydration is of utmost importance.

en.name: Gan Ceann
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Increase this unit's base power by 2 for each adjacent Relict.
en.fluff: A head in the hands is worth two on the neck.

en.name: Dwimveandra
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Set an allied Scenario to the final chapter.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Refresh the <keyword=order>Order</keyword> of an allied Location.
en.fluff: There are those who stay at home and those who leave.

en.name: Barghest
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=consume>Consume</keyword> an allied unit.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=dominance>Dominance</keyword>): <keyword=consume>Consume</keyword> an allied unit.
en.fluff: Some claim they're the vanguard of the Wild Hunt. Others that they're vengeance incarnate. Everyone agrees that barghests have no mercy for the living.

en.name: Chimera
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=consume>Consume</keyword> an allied unit.\n<keyword=adrenaline>Adrenaline</keyword> 5: Also boost all copies of the <keyword=consume>Consumed</keyword> unit on that unit's row by 1.
en.fluff: At first, Cosimo combined genes of a fiend and a griffin. Then he added some traces of insectoid and wyvern to the pool, resulting in a creature far worse than the sum of its parts.

en.name: Raging Bear
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an allied unit by 2.
en.fluff: Roooaaar!!!

en.name: Rot Tosser
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play a Cow Carcass.
en.fluff: Let historians debate whether spreading plague in a besieged city is ethical. We just care if it's effective.

en.name: Cyclops
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Destroy an adjacent ally unit and deal its power as damage to an enemy.
en.fluff: Don't stare at his eye, he hates that…

en.name: Tuirseach Veteran
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage self by 3.\n<keyword=berserk>Berserk</keyword> 3: <keyword=heal>Heal</keyword> self.
en.fluff: In my days I've seen wonders no man's ever dreamt of, and done things no man should ever do.

en.name: Alba Armored Cavalry
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): <keyword=lock>Lock</keyword> an enemy unit.
en.fluff: The wedge of riders thundered into the phalanx with crushing momentum. Like a dagger thrust into an exposed belly, the Alba Division swept unhindered through everything between it and the vital organs of the Temerian Infantry.

en.name: Caravan Vanguard
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Boost self by 3.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a base copy of self on this row.\n<keyword=bonded>Bonded</keyword>: Use both abilities.
en.fluff: It's not easy to find one's way among the shifting dunes…

en.name: Caravan Guard
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 1. Increase the damage by 1 for each 3 power the target has.
en.fluff: There's a lot of ways you can die in the desert. Not just from thirst.

en.name: Mage Torturer
en.tooltip: <keyword=veil>Veil</keyword>. <keyword=assimilate>Assimilate</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Give an enemy unit <keyword=spying>Spying</keyword>.
en.fluff: Your pain is my delight.

en.name: Bear Witcher
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage self by 3.\n<keyword=adrenaline>Adrenaline</keyword> 4: Damage self and an enemy unit by 3 instead.
en.fluff: Life alone on the road can be tough⁠—be sure to bring all the bare necessities.

en.name: Phooca
en.tooltip: <keyword=thrive>Thrive</keyword> 2.
en.fluff: Particularly troublesome are the larger, stronger breed—a rare kind of nekker known as phoocas. If you see one, run.

en.name: Imperial Practitioner
en.tooltip: <keyword=assimilate>Assimilate</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a base copy of the last card that went to your opponent's graveyard on top of your deck.
en.fluff: The body is a slab of wet clay. One need only use the correct tools to shape it into something... more.

en.name: Giant Toad
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=consume>Consume</keyword> an allied unit.\nWhen you play a <keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword> unit on your <keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword> row, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> self from your graveyard to the same row, <keyword=consume>Consume</keyword> it and gain <keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.
en.fluff: Don't expect to end up like Sleeping Beauty once the Toad kisses you. Oh, no. You will swell rapidly into what can only be described as a pustulous, varicose grape, and this is before your pores begin to rupture and discharge the coalescent gravy that is your four humors.

en.name: Contaminator
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=banish>Banish</keyword> an enemy unit with 3 or less power, then, if it wasn't a Token, <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> its base copy at the bottom of your opponent's deck.
en.fluff: Destroying the supplies was merely a convienient side effect of the main goal: make them believe the food from their allies is tainted, and leave them with a choice: Nilfgaard or famine.

en.name: Wild Hunt Rider
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=dominance>Dominance</keyword>): <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> all copies of this unit from your deck to this row.
en.fluff: First the buffalo horns atop their helms penetrate one's view, then the crest betwixt them, and finally the skull–like face exposed beneath their visors.

en.name: Nekurat
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Give an enemy unit <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> (2).\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 2\nWhenever you play a Vampire, reduce the <keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword> by 1.
en.fluff: No matter how lightly you tread, how soft your step, he will hear you. He will find you.

en.name: Harpy Egg
en.tooltip: <keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Harpy and <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> it to this row.
en.fluff: A harpy egg omelet - a delicious delicacy, good sir. Quite dear, too, for as you might surmise, the wretches don't part with their eggs willingly.

en.name: Imperial Diviner
en.tooltip: <keyword=assimilate>Assimilate</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=purify>Purify</keyword> a unit.
en.fluff: Emperor Emhyr var Emreis spared no effort to find his daughter, even resorting to arcane magics of the mages and sorceresses he had so vehemently despised.

en.name: Seditious Aristocrats
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost self by 1 for every <keyword=spying>Spying</keyword> enemy unit.\nWhenever an enemy unit gains <keyword=spying>Spying</keyword>, boost self by 1.
en.fluff: They love expensive wine, horse riding, and good old backstabbing.

en.name: Viper Witcher
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Give an enemy unit <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> (2).\n<keyword=adrenaline>Adrenaline</keyword> 6: If it's not a Token, <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a base copy of that unit at the top of your opponent's deck.
en.fluff: Viper Witchers are trained to fight with twin blades, often referred to as “fangs”. This style focuses on fast and furious strikes aimed to overwhelm their target, be it monster or man.

en.name: Master of Puppets
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=seize>Seize</keyword> a bronze enemy unit, then move self to the opposite row.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 2
en.fluff: Do you feel in control?

en.name: Kikimore Stalker
en.tooltip:
<keyword=veil>Veil</keyword>.
<keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=predator>Predator</keyword>): Damage an enemy unit by 1 or <keyword=consume>Consume</keyword> an allied Drone.
<keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>: 1
Whenever you <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> one or more Insectoids, gain a <keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>.
en.fluff: Peek-a-boo, it's after you!

en.name: Hunting Pack
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: If an enemy unit has a status, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> all copies of this unit from your deck to this row.
en.fluff: The hounds of the Van Moorlehems have an extraordinary sense of smell - and extremely sharp teeth.

en.name: Blue Stripes Commando
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> all copies of this unit from your deck to this row.
en.fluff: I'd do anything for Temeria. Mostly though, I kill for her.

en.name: Aretuza Adept
en.tooltip: Whenever an allied unit's <keyword=patience>Patience</keyword> is triggered, boost self by 1.
en.fluff: The adepts' every whim is catered to - they live like princesses at Aretuza. And in turn half the city lives off servicing them: seamstresses, milliners, confectioners, delivery boys…

en.name: Lyrian Landsknecht
en.tooltip: <keyword=formation>Formation</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage a unit by 1.\n<keyword=inspired>Inspired</keyword>: Damage it by 3 instead.
en.fluff: Best not laugh at their silly-arse hats. Believe me.

en.name: Ard Feainn Crossbowman
en.tooltip: <keyword=flanking>Flanking</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 1.\n<keyword=barricade>Barricade</keyword>: At the end of your turn, damage a random enemy unit by 1 if you played a Soldier this turn.
en.fluff: Many thought that mounted crossbowmen wouldn't work. Until they saw them in action.

en.name: Battering Ram
en.tooltip:
<keyword=resupply>Resupply</keyword>.
<keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Move self to the <keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword> row.
<keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Move self to the <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword> row, then damage the highest-power enemy unit by 3.
<keyword=crew>Crew</keyword>: Choose the enemy unit to damage.
<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 2
en.fluff: Not gonna open up, eh? Guess we gotta knock harder.

en.name: Rivian Pikeman
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 2.\n<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: Reduce the <keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword> of each unit on this row by 1.\n<keyword=inspired>Inspired</keyword>: Always trigger the <keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword> ability.
en.fluff: Get off your high horse and face me!

en.name: Cat Witcher Saboteur
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Move an enemy unit to the leftmost position on its row and damage it by 1. Increase the damage by 1 for each card it passed.
en.fluff: “Needless to say, the ill fame of their deeds hangs like a dark cloud over our reputation to this day.” ⁠— Vesemir

en.name: Griffin Witcher
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Damage an enemy unit by 1.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 1\n<keyword=adrenaline>Adrenaline</keyword> 3: At the end of your turn, damage a random enemy unit by 3 and <keyword=lock>Lock</keyword> self.
en.fluff: Silver swords are great, yeah. But have you ever tried silver-plated arrowheads?

en.name: Griffin Witcher Mentor
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Draw your top unit and boost it by 1, then shuffle a card from your hand back into your deck.\n<keyword=adrenaline>Adrenaline</keyword> 4: Draw your top 2 units and boost them by 1, then shuffle 2 cards from your hand back into your deck instead.
en.fluff: Knowledge will keep you alive far longer than might, dear boy.

en.name: Antherion
en.tooltip: <keyword=harmony>Harmony</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=infused>Infuse</keyword> an allied unit with "<keyword=harmony>Harmony</keyword>".
en.fluff: To lay eyes upon a mythical antherion is to know one was well off the beaten path.

en.name: Reinforced Ballista
en.tooltip: <keyword=formation>Formation</keyword>. <keyword=resupply>Resupply</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage a unit by 1.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 1
en.fluff: Never manages to hit the same place twice, which, upon further reflection, might constitute a real problem.

en.name: Vrihedd Brigade
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 2.\nWhenever moved, damage a random enemy unit by 2.
en.fluff: "Vrihedd? What's that mean?" "Trouble."

en.name: Mahakam Marauder
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Gain <keyword=vitality>Vitality</keyword> equal to an allied unit's <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.\n<keyword=barricade>Barricade</keyword>: Boost self by that amount instead.
en.fluff: Hunting on Mahakam's craggy cliffs is not particularly easy… but nor are dwarves particularly put off by danger.

en.name: Mahakam Volunteers
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: If you control a Dwarf, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> all copies of this unit from your deck to this row.
en.fluff: Hoooahhh! Hoooaahhh! Hooo! Prepare yer hineys, clowns! Soon we'll be comin' 'round! Tae kick 'em till ye've feet for frowns!

en.name: Immortal Cavalry
en.tooltip: <keyword=shield>Shield</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a base copy of this unit on this row.
en.fluff: Maybe camels aren't as swift as horses… but at least they don't die after two days in the desert.

en.name: Bloody Good Friends
en.tooltip: <keyword=insanity>Insanity</keyword>.\n<keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 1: Give an enemy unit <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> (1). If it's boosted, damage it by 1 instead.
en.fluff: I'll kill you as soon as we kill them!

en.name: Kerack City Guard
en.tooltip: <keyword=veil>Veil</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Move an enemy unit to the other row.\nAt the end of your turn, if the <keyword=order>Order</keyword> is not used, boost self by 1.
en.fluff: Geralt thought there were no ugly women, but in the guardhouse of Kerack he felt compelled to revise this view.

en.name: Hamadryad
en.tooltip: <keyword=symbiosis>Symbiosis</keyword>.\nAt the end of your turn, if this unit has <keyword=vitality>Vitality</keyword>, boost self by 1.
en.fluff: Hamadryads form a deep life-long bond with their tree – and its squirrels, of course.

en.name: Duén Canell Guardian
en.tooltip: <keyword=veil>Veil</keyword>. <keyword=symbiosis>Symbiosis</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 2.
en.fluff: You have conquered the world, d'hoine, you are everywhere, everywhere you bring with you what you call progress. But we don't want you or your progress here.

en.name: Viper Witcher Alchemist
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): <keyword=reveal>Reveal</keyword> a random unit from your opponent's deck and boost self by its power.
en.fluff: What doesn’t kill you makes you stronger. Or weaker. It depends, really.

en.name: Cat Witcher
en.tooltip: At the end of your turn, move self to the other row and damage a random enemy unit on the opposite row by 1.\n<keyword=adrenaline>Adrenaline</keyword> 3: Damage it by 2 instead.
en.fluff: Members of the School of the Cat are ill-famed due to their penchant for frenzy and bloodlust in the heat of battle. Even when their enemies capitulate, beg for mercy... Cats never stop killing.

en.name: Naglfar's Crew
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> <keyword=frost>Frost</keyword> on an enemy row for 2 turns.\nAt the end of your turn, if there is <keyword=frost>Frost</keyword> on the opposite row, boost self by 1.
en.fluff: Humans don’t know what powers the Naglfar. What is the source of its magic? For those that discover the truth... Well, it’s already too late for them.

en.name: An Craite Longship
en.tooltip: <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>: Whenever your opponent plays a unit on their side of the battlefield, deal 1 damage to it.
en.fluff: They say Hemdall's heart swells whenever the longships sail out on a raid.

en.name: Drummond Shieldmaiden
en.tooltip: When this unit is damaged, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> all copies of it from your deck to this row.
en.fluff: They'll shatter on our shields like waves on a craggy shore.

en.name: Nauzicaa Brigade
en.tooltip: If your opponent has won a round this game, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> self from your deck to a random allied row when you play a Soldier.
en.fluff: They call us Death's Heads. Care to find out why?

en.name: Duchess's Informant
en.tooltip: <keyword=disloyal>Disloyal</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play a base copy of a non-<keyword=disloyal>Disloyal</keyword> bronze enemy unit.
en.fluff: Anna Henrietta wakes every morn to the tune of her songbirds.

en.name: Tidecloak Hideaway
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Boost an allied unit by 1 for every Pirate in your hand.
en.fluff: Once a terror of the high seas, it now sits idle and fat with gold, unable to leave port.

en.name: Halfling Safecracker
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost self by 1 for each Crime in your hand.
en.fluff: With ears sharp as his, he could've been a musician. Alas, one cannot get rich as quickly from applause.

en.name: Mutated Hounds
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Give an enemy unit <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> (2).\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): <keyword=poison>Poison</keyword> a unit.
en.fluff: Out of man's best friend we made his worst enemy.

en.name: Dwarven Chariot
en.tooltip:
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Boost self by 4 and gain 2 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> 2 Rowdy Dwarves on your <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword> row.
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Give an allied unit 1 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.
<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 1
en.fluff: You can draw anything you like, my dear dwarves. But you can't build it, mark my words.

en.name: Bear Witcher Mentor
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost self by 1 for every damaged allied unit.\n<keyword=adrenaline>Adrenaline</keyword> 3: Boost self by 1 for every damaged unit instead.
en.fluff: If you’re unsure of the way, just keep a lookout for markers⁠—the frozen corpses of would-be witchers.

en.name: Salamandra Abomination
en.tooltip: <keyword=tribute>Tribute</keyword> 1: <keyword=poison>Poison</keyword> self.\nWhenever this unit is <keyword=poison>Poisoned</keyword>, boost self by 2.\n<keyword=adrenaline>Adrenaline</keyword> 6: At the end of your turn, <keyword=purify>Purify</keyword> self.
en.fluff: Salamandra’s scientists were so preoccupied with whether they could, they never once considered if they should.

en.name: Salamandra Mage
en.tooltip: <keyword=tribute>Tribute</keyword> 5: Damage 3 adjacent enemy units by 2.\nWhenever you pay a <keyword=tribute>Tribute</keyword> ability, gain 1 <keyword=coin>Coins</keyword>.\n<keyword=adrenaline>Adrenaline</keyword> 5: Gain 2 <keyword=coin>Coins</keyword> instead.
en.fluff: Building a fire warms people for a day, but setting them on fire…

en.name: Havfrue Singer
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=heal>Heal</keyword> an allied unit by 2.\nThe first time you <keyword=heal>Heal</keyword> an allied unit during your turn, <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Deafening Siren on this row.
en.fluff: No human can match sirens in singing. Some, however, are talented enough to compel sirens to listen.

en.name: Little Bird
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=infused>Infuse</keyword> self with a <keyword=gang>Gang</keyword> category of a unit in your deck.\n<keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 2: Boost an allied unit by 1 for each unique <keyword=gang>Gang</keyword> category you control.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 1
en.fluff: Hearsay and rumours were generally dismissed as mere half-truths. Yet Reuven, with his slew of little birds perched in public houses throughout Novigrad, knew instinctively which half could be put to use.

en.name: Drummond Queensguard
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=berserk>Berserk</keyword> 3): <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a base copy of self and <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> it to this row.
en.fluff: The queen is guarded by the hardiest and fiercest shieldmaidens Skellige's ever known.

en.name: An Craite Raiders
en.tooltip: <keyword=veteran>Veteran</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=bloodthirst>Bloodthirst</keyword> 3): Gain <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage a unit by 2.
en.fluff: Cabbage, really? It’s just the worst when there’s nothing good to plunder.

en.name: Bear Witcher Quartermaster
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage an allied unit by 1, then <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Witcher Student on this row.\n<keyword=charge>Charges</keyword>: 2
en.fluff: Supply him with enough Mahakam mead, and he might just tell you a tale of how a bear took his shield and arm too!

en.name: Griffin Witcher Ranger
en.tooltip: <keyword=formation>Formation</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost self by 1 for each unit on an enemy row.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Transfer all boost from self to an allied unit.
en.fluff: Griffin Witcher Rangers are unparalleled masters in the art of tracking and hunting, even amid the most inhospitable of environments. No matter the trail, they won’t rest until their prey is captured, or killed.

en.name: Melusine Cultist
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> <keyword=rain>Rain</keyword> on an enemy row for 2 turns.\nAt the end of your turn, if there is <keyword=rain>Rain</keyword> on the opposite row, boost the unit to the right by 1. If there is <keyword=storm>Storm</keyword> on the opposite row, boost adjacent units by 1 instead.
en.fluff: But we can still eat fish, can't we?

en.name: Knight-Errant
en.tooltip: At the end of your turn, boost self by 1 for each adjacent boosted unit and damage self by 1 for each adjacent damaged unit.\n<keyword=grace>Grace</keyword> 9: Give adjacent units <keyword=shield>Shield</keyword>, then <keyword=infused>Infuse</keyword> them with "Whenever this unit loses <keyword=shield>Shield</keyword>, boost it by 2".
en.fluff: Traversing the fine line between idiom and idiot.

en.name: Vrihedd Vanguard
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Boost self by 1 for each Elf in your hand.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Boost self by 1 for each Elf on this row.
en.fluff: Temerians, Redanians, all the same. Better off dead.

en.name: Svalblod Priest
en.tooltip: At the end of your turn, damage the unit to the right by 1, then boost self by 2.
en.fluff: The cruelty of Svalblod priests proved so fierce, so merciless that – upon the cult's collapse – they were condemned and cast out to the high seas aboard longships with nary a paddle nor sail to guide them.

en.name: Sly Seductress
en.tooltip: <keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 3: Gain a <keyword=shield>Shield</keyword>.\nWhenever your opponent plays a unit, boost self by 1.\n<keyword=bonded>Bonded</keyword>: Whenever your opponent plays a card, boost self by 1.
en.fluff: The sweeter her words, the more bitter your losses.

en.name: Witch Hunter Executioner
en.tooltip: <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 2.\n<keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 1: Give an enemy unit <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> (1). If it has a <keyword=bounty>Bounty</keyword>, damage it by 1 instead.
en.fluff: It'd be a right shame if I cut any of your beautiful hair.

en.name: Keeper of the Flame
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost adjacent units by 1.\n<keyword=tribute>Tribute</keyword> 4: Boost all units on this row by 1 instead.\nDecrease this card's <keyword=tribute>Tribute</keyword> cost by 1 for each allied Cleric.
en.fluff: The flame shall forever burn, for evil shall forever corrupt!

en.name: Cleric of the Flaming Rose
en.tooltip: <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 3.\n<keyword=tribute>Tribute</keyword> 2: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Firesworn Zealot on this row.\n<keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 1: Transform a Firesworn Zealot into a Flaming Rose Footman.
en.fluff: We have two eyes, two ears, but only one tongue, so that we would look and listen twice more than we speak.

en.name: Highland Warlord
en.tooltip: <keyword=veteran>Veteran</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Increase the damage of your Raid cards by 1 for the rest of the game.
en.fluff: Honor!? Ha! You know what happens to honorable men? They’re mourned.

en.name: Sewer Raiders
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=hoard>Hoard</keyword> 4): <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> all copies of this unit from your deck to this row.
en.fluff: Built for movin' shite, but it moves coin just as well.

en.name: Deranged Corsair
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=infused>Infuse</keyword> an enemy unit with "<keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> <keyword=cataclysm>Cataclysm</keyword> on this row for 2 turns", then <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> <keyword=cataclysm>Cataclysm</keyword> on its row for 1 turn.
en.fluff: Who ever said you had to be dead to haunt the seas?

en.name: Treasure Huntress
en.tooltip: <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 3.\n<keyword=hoard>Hoard</keyword> 9, <keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 3: <keyword=infused>Infuse</keyword> an allied unit with "At the end of your turn, gain 1 <keyword=coin>Coin</keyword>".
en.fluff: No island, cape nor bay can guard their secrets from this restless soul and her trusted companion.

en.name: Shady Vendor
en.tooltip: <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 1.\n<keyword=tribute>Tribute</keyword> 4 (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): <keyword=create>Create</keyword> and play a bronze 4-provision Crime.\n<keyword=tribute>Tribute</keyword> 5 (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): <keyword=create>Create</keyword> and play a bronze 5-provision Crime.
en.fluff: If he ain’t got it, you don’t need it.

en.name: Crownsplitter Thug
en.tooltip: <keyword=intimidate>Intimidate</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 3.
en.fluff: Frilly frock or Mahakam steel breastplate – wouldn't have mattered.

en.name: Cat Witcher Mentor
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost self by the number of other cards on this row. \n<keyword=adrenaline>Adrenaline</keyword> 4: Whenever a card appears on this row, boost self by 1.
en.fluff: If you fall, it’s over. Your nine lives are up, kid.

en.name: Ice Giant
en.tooltip: No ability.
en.fluff: Fled one time in my life. From the Ice Giant. And I'm not a bit ashamed.

en.name: Sea Serpent
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost self by 0 and damage an enemy unit by 3.\nIncrease the boost by 1 for each opponent turn in which <keyword=rain>Rain</keyword> or <keyword=storm>Storm</keyword> triggered this round.
en.fluff: Hire a dragonslayer? For some oversized eel? Ha! Mainlander nonsense!

en.name: Rotfiend
en.tooltip: <keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword>: Damage a random enemy unit by 5.
en.fluff: You'll smell them long before you see them.

en.name: Mantlet
en.tooltip: <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>: Whenever you play a unit, give it 1 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.\n<keyword=barricade>Barricade</keyword>: Give it 2 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword> instead.
en.fluff: Something like the bastard child of a shield and a palisade.

en.name: Siren
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=consume>Consume</keyword> an allied unit.\n<keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword>: Boost adjacent allied units by 2.
en.fluff: Legends claim they lure sailors to their doom with their entrancing songs… though more likely, the sailors were more entranced by their other ample charms.

en.name: Venendal Elite
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost self by 1 for each Tactic in your hand.
en.fluff: Ebbing is famed for its top-notch mercenaries and light cavalry.

en.name: Alp
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Give an enemy unit <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> (3).\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Give an enemy unit <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> (3).
en.fluff: The townsfolk, long plagued with horrific nightmares, posted a desperate plea for help... "Hmm. An alp, gotta be," the witcher grumbled to himself.

en.name: King Cobra
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=poison>Poison</keyword> an enemy unit.
en.fluff: As long as I play it'll "dance". But when I stop…

en.name: Witch Apprentice
en.tooltip: <keyword=sabbath>Sabbath</keyword>: At the end of your turn, boost self by 2.
en.fluff: Mistress said I would have to toss it on the spit after I finish my studies, but she was just kidding. Right...?

en.name: Dimun Pirate
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Move the top card from your deck to your graveyard.\nIf you control a Ship, cancel this ability.
en.fluff: Can see the fear in their eyes. Fear o' me… fear o' Clan Dimun!

en.name: Wyvern
en.tooltip: <keyword=thrive>Thrive</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Damage an enemy unit by 2.
en.fluff: Imagine a cross between a winged snake and a nightmare. Wyverns are worse.

en.name: Alba Pikeman
en.tooltip:
<keyword=flanking>Flanking</keyword>.
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Give an enemy unit <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> (1).
<keyword=charge>Charges</keyword>: 0
At the end of your turn, gain 1 <keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>. If this unit has at least 3 <keyword=charge>Charges</keyword>, gain 1 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword> instead.
en.fluff: Pledge your allegiance to our Emperor, Emhyr var Emreis… or die.

en.name: Standard Bearer
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost self by 1 for each boosted enemy unit.
en.fluff: "You shall defend this standard if it costs you your lives! Gloir aen Ard Feainn!"

en.name: Doppler
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Choose a unit in your hand, then boost self by the number of units in your hand with the same primary category.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Boost self by 1 for each unique primary category among units in your hand.
en.fluff: Humans despise dopplers so much, they feel mere execution does not suffice - so they tie any they catch to a stake, cover them in thick clay and bake them in a fire.

en.name: Cintrian Royal Guard
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost self by 3 for every other Cintrian Royal Guard under your control.
en.fluff: Queen Calanthe handpicked her personal guard with meticulous care. Each must serve with unconditional loyalty, stand more than six feet tall, and possess a devilishly handsome jawline.

en.name: Ard Feainn Heavy Cavalry
en.tooltip:
<keyword=flanking>Flanking</keyword>.
At the end of your turn, gain 1 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.
<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>: When this unit reaches 5 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>, move self to the <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword> row.
<keyword=barricade>Barricade</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Whenever your opponent plays a unit on their side of the battlefield, lose all <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword> and damage it by the same amount, then <keyword=lock>Lock</keyword> self.
en.fluff: When Emhyr declared that his cavalry would stomp his enemies into the mud, we thought he was speaking metaphorically. We were wrong.

en.name: Carroballista
en.tooltip:
<keyword=resupply>Resupply</keyword>.
<keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Damage an enemy unit by 2.
<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 3
<keyword=crew>Crew</keyword>: At the end of your turn, gain 1 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.
en.fluff: This ballista's on the wagon.

en.name: Thirsty Dame
en.tooltip: Whenever an enemy unit receives a status, boost self by 1.
en.fluff: My teeth are red? Oh, that's from the wine…

en.name: Impera Enforcers
en.tooltip:
<keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 1.
<keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>: 1
<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: Gain 1 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.
Whenever an enemy unit gains <keyword=spying>Spying</keyword>, gain 1 <keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>.
en.fluff: Members of the emperor's fanatic body guard fight to the bitter end.

en.name: Damned Sorceress
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Remove a unit's <keyword=shield>Shield</keyword>, then boost self by 2. \n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 1
en.fluff: Sabrina's curse spared no one, not even her fellow practitioners.

en.name: Aen Elle Slave Trader
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Gain <keyword=vitality>Vitality</keyword> equal to the total duration of <keyword=frost>Frost</keyword> on your opponent's side of the battlefield and <keyword=infused>Infuse</keyword> an enemy unit with "At the end of your turn, if there's an enemy Aen Elle Slave Trader with higher power than your own, set own power to 1, then <keyword=lock>Lock</keyword> self".
en.fluff: Why, we treat our stock with the utmost dignity of course, by providing them with every opportunity to serve the greatest of the Aen Elle.

en.name: Reinforced Trebuchet
en.tooltip: <keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>: At the end of your turn, damage a random enemy unit on the <keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword> row by 1.\n<keyword=crew>Crew</keyword>: Damage a random enemy unit by 1 instead.
en.fluff: Feel that? The earth trembles each time Big Bertha looses a stone.

en.name: Slave Driver
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage a bronze allied unit by 1, then <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a 1-power copy of it on this row. If it was a Soldier, <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play the copy instead.
en.fluff: What drives a slave driver? A solitary purpose: to see his orders carried out to the letter.

en.name: Ard Feainn Light Cavalry
en.tooltip: <keyword=flanking>Flanking</keyword>.\n<keyword=barricade>Barricade</keyword>: At the end of your turn, damage the last unit played by your opponent by 1.
en.fluff: Light cavalry, heavy burden!

en.name: Temerian Drummer
en.tooltip: At the end of your turn, boost the unit to the right by 1.
en.fluff: Not the career he had in mind when he told mummy he wanted to be a musician.

en.name: Lyrian Arbalest
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage a unit by 1. \n<keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>: 1\nWhenever you play a card with an <keyword=order>Order</keyword>, gain 1 <keyword=charge>Charge</keyword> .
en.fluff: I can find the bull's-eye from a hundred paces! Perhaps not with my first shot, mind you...

en.name: Cintrian Spellweaver
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage a unit by 1.\n<keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>: 1\nWhenever you play a Mage or a Spell, gain 1 <keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>.
en.fluff: Reality is so terribly tedious...

en.name: Highwaymen
en.tooltip: When you play a <keyword=bonded>Bonded</keyword> unit that you already control a copy of, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> self from your deck to your <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword> row.\n<keyword=exposed>Exposed</keyword>: Move self to the top of your deck.
en.fluff: We'll torture the merchant and sell the horses.

en.name: Temerian Infantry
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 1 for each boosted unit on this row.
en.fluff: Temeria! Temeria! Gods shed all grace on thee! And smite thy foes with horrid woes, for all eternity!

en.name: Ghoul
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): <keyword=consume>Consume</keyword> a bronze unit in your graveyard.
en.fluff: If ghouls are part of the Circle of Life… then it's one vicious circle.

en.name: Dol Blathanna Sentry
en.tooltip: <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>: Whenever an enemy unit moves, damage it by 1.\n<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>: Whenever an allied unit moves, boost it by 1.
en.fluff: As long as we stand, no human foot shall trample Dol Blathanna's meadows.

en.name: Magne Division
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Play a Tactic from your hand, then draw a card.
en.fluff: I know the Emperor defends all his lands... but a garrison in this blasted waste is like a chastity belt on a grave hag.

en.name: Dryad Ranger
en.tooltip: <keyword=harmony>Harmony</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Damage an enemy unit by 2.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): <keyword=poison>Poison</keyword> an enemy unit.
en.fluff: I do not live in the forest of Brokilon. I am a part of it.

en.name: Naiad Fledgling
en.tooltip: Whenever your <keyword=symbiosis>Symbiosis</keyword> is triggered, give the unit to the left <keyword=vitality>Vitality</keyword> (2).\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Remove all <keyword=vitality>Vitality</keyword> from an allied unit, then boost self by the same amount.
en.fluff: There's more to life than frolicking about naked in ponds. No one has a convincing answer as to what, however.

en.name: Arena Endrega
en.tooltip: <keyword=insanity>Insanity</keyword>.\n<keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 1: Damage an enemy unit by 1.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 1
en.fluff: Strong as an ox, dumb as a box.

en.name: Boatbuilders
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Give an allied unit 2 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>. If you control a Ship, gain <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Give an allied unit 1 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 1
en.fluff: There's no more respected profession on the islands than boat building. The worst cutthroats bow and ask how things are going…

en.name: Mage Assassin
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 2.\nWhen moved to the top of your deck during your turn, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> self to a random allied row and damage a random enemy unit by 2.
en.fluff: Somewhere deep within Nilfgaard’s imperial archives is a manuscript titled “Forty-Seven Ways to Kill a Man”. It’s a surprisingly jovial read.

en.name: Elven Seer
en.tooltip: When you target this unit with a bronze special card, <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play a copy of that special card.\nCounter: 1
en.fluff: I predict a bad future for your race, dh’oine.

en.name: Tuirseach Skirmisher
en.tooltip: When this unit is <keyword=discard>Discarded</keyword>, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> it from your graveyard to your <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword> row.
en.fluff: Friends we show heart, foes we show our axe. Remember that.

en.name: Crow Messenger
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> all copies of this unit from your graveyard to this row.\nIf you hold an Alchemy card, also <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> all copies from your deck.
en.fluff: The Crowmother has a thousand eyes and each one is closely watching.

en.name: Trained Hawk
en.tooltip: <keyword=harmony>Harmony</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Damage an enemy unit by 2.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Move a unit to the other row.
en.fluff: I whistle once, it comes back. I whistle twice, it comes back with your eyes in its talons.

en.name: Reaver Scout
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> and play a base copy of an allied Bronze Soldier, excluding self.
en.fluff: Haven't had much luck with monsters of late, so we enlisted.

en.name: Half-Elf Hunter
en.tooltip: <keyword=harmony>Harmony</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> an Elven Deadeye on this row.
en.fluff: Hated by men, reviled by elves and always picked last during schoolyard games. No wonder half-elves tend to have a chip on their shoulder.

en.name: Redanian Archer
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Damage an enemy unit by 1. \n<keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>: 1\n<keyword=barricade>Barricade</keyword>: At the end of your turn, gain 1 <keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>.
en.fluff: The last thing you'll hear is the twang of the bowstring being let go.

en.name: Whisperer of Dol Blathanna
en.tooltip: <keyword=veil>Veil</keyword>.\nWhen you play a special card, <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a base copy of self on this row and remove a Counter.\nCounter: 1
en.fluff: You won't find more fertile land than in the Valley of Flowers, and with a little magic you can count on a ripe harvest up to three times a year.

en.name: Siege Master
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Reduce an allied unit's <keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword> by 1.\nWhen you play a Siege Engine, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> self from your hand to the left of it, then draw a card.
en.fluff: I never miss twice.

en.name: Dol Blathanna Archer
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Damage an enemy unit by 3.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Damage 2 units by 1.\n<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> an Elven Deadeye on this row.
en.fluff: Take another step, dh'oine. You'd look better with an arrow between your eyes.

en.name: Drummond Warmonger
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage 3 adjacent enemies by 1.\n<keyword=bloodthirst>Bloodthirst</keyword> 5: Damage all enemies on a row by 1 instead.
en.fluff: Think o' the greater good?! War's the greatest good, the greatest bad, the greatest damn anythin' man's ever come up with!

en.name: Dimun Smuggler
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: If played next to a Ship, <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a base copy of self on this row.\n<keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage a unit by 1.
en.fluff: Spikeroog's a barren backwater, but that don't bother us - everythin' we need, we take from you.

en.name: Casino Bouncers
en.tooltip: <keyword=insanity>Insanity</keyword>.\n<keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 1: <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> all copies of this unit from your deck to this row.
en.fluff: Junior said our nasty mugs was frightenin' off all the coin. Don't rightly see 'ow this helps any...

en.name: Firesworn Scribe
en.tooltip: <keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>: Whenever you <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> one or more units to the battlefield, gain 1 <keyword=coin>Coin</keyword>.\n<keyword=tribute>Tribute</keyword> 2: Boost self by 2.
en.fluff: Wouldn't disturb him if I were you. Those quills are bloody sharp.

en.name: Coerced Blacksmith
en.tooltip: <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 2.\n<keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 1: Boost an allied unit by 1.
en.fluff: Do ye prefer a full coin purse or a full set of fingers?

en.name: Anglerfish
en.tooltip: At the end of your turn, if there is <keyword=rain>Rain</keyword> or <keyword=storm>Storm</keyword> on both enemy rows, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> self from your deck to your <keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword> row.\nAt the end of your turn, if neither enemy row has <keyword=rain>Rain</keyword> or <keyword=storm>Storm</keyword>, move self to the bottom of your deck.
en.fluff: The good news is, you'll never actually encounter one outside of your deepest, darkest nightmares.

en.name: Salamandra Assassin
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Place a <keyword=bounty>Bounty</keyword> on an enemy unit.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=poison>Poison</keyword> the enemy unit with a <keyword=bounty>Bounty</keyword>.
en.fluff: A name and bag full of gold. That's all I need.

en.name: Vial of Forbidden Knowledge
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Boost an allied unit by 4 and give it <keyword=vitality>Vitality</keyword> (4).\nAt the start of the game, if both players have this card in their deck, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> self to a random allied row and transform.
en.fluff: A single globule of the magical liquid can turn a simpleton into a savant.

en.name: Biting Frost
en.tooltip: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> <keyword=frost>Frost</keyword> on an enemy row for 3 turns.
en.fluff: Best thing about frost? Bodies of the fallen don't rot so quickly.

en.name: Impenetrable Fog
en.tooltip: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> <keyword=fog>Fog</keyword> on an enemy row for 3 turns.
en.fluff: A good commander's dream… and a bad one's horror.

en.name: Torrential Rain
en.tooltip: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> <keyword=rain>Rain</keyword> on an enemy row for 3 turns.
en.fluff: Even the rain in this land smells vile.

en.name: Wyvern Scale Shield
en.tooltip: Boost an allied unit by 4 and give it a <keyword=shield>Shield</keyword>.\nWhile in your graveyard, when you play a unit, give it a <keyword=shield>Shield</keyword>, then <keyword=banish>Banish</keyword> self.
en.fluff: Stronger than your average shield and far more stylish.

en.name: Crow's Eye
en.tooltip: <keyword=purify>Purify</keyword> an allied unit and boost it by 3.
en.fluff: A certain famous pirate once so loved this intoxicating herb, he earned the nickname 'Crow's Eye.' The theatrical version of his legend omits this, however, to the great consternation of pirate lore sticklers.

en.name: Golden Froth
en.tooltip: Boost 3 adjacent units by 2.
en.fluff: Smell that? That's the smell of happiness.

en.name: Thaw
en.tooltip: Boost an allied unit by 4 and give it <keyword=veil>Veil</keyword>.
en.fluff: It heralds the coming of spring... Which, in turn, heralds the coming of war.

en.name: Spring Equinox
en.tooltip: <keyword=purify>Purify</keyword> all units on a row.
en.fluff: The days grow longer and the dresses of maidens grow shorter.

en.name: Pact
en.tooltip: Boost a unit by 6 and give it <keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.
en.fluff: Your wishes he grants, as he swears to adore you – Gold, silver, jewels... he lays riches before you – Dues need be repaid, and he will come for you – All to reclaim, no smile to console you!

en.name: Epidemic
en.tooltip: Destroy a 4-provision cost unit.
en.fluff: Epidemics respect no persons, no borders.

en.name: Hideous Feast
en.tooltip: Damage an enemy unit by 3 and boost an allied unit by 3.
en.fluff: The fool paid heed to superstition, stuffed his ears with wax and didn't hear the warnings. He ran his ship straight into the rocks.

en.name: Imperial Diplomacy
en.tooltip: <keyword=create>Create</keyword> and play a bronze card from your opponent's faction.
en.fluff: A spy? No, that's saying far too much. I consider myself more of an observer.

en.name: Obsidian Mirror
en.tooltip: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> 1-power copies of 3 enemy bronze units on their opposite row.
en.fluff: Beware to those who would gaze too long into its obsidian sheen, for one knows not what might gaze back.

en.name: Buhurt
en.tooltip: Boost an enemy unit by 3, then an allied unit by 9.
en.fluff: The one ONLY absolute iron-clad rule is: no crotch shots!

en.name: Winch
en.tooltip: Boost an allied unit by 5 and reduce its <keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword> by 3.
en.fluff: It's a winch. Not much to flap your jaw about.

en.name: Mad Charge
en.tooltip: Boost an allied unit by 5 and give it 2 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.\nIf it's a Knight, also give it <keyword=vitality>Vitality</keyword> (2).
en.fluff: You can't stop a galloping cavalry horse. So if things go bad, the only thing to do is to lower your lance, close your eyes and pray to the gods.

en.name: Smoke them out!
en.tooltip: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> 2 Volunteers on an allied row. \nIf you control a boosted unit, also boost <keyword=spawn>Spawned</keyword> Volunteers by 1.
en.fluff: Fight fire with fire, fight people with fire, fight non-humans with fire... Basically it’s best to fight everything with fire!

en.name: Practice Makes Perfect
en.tooltip: Shuffle an allied bronze Mage back into your deck, then play a random bronze Mage from your deck. Boost the unit you played by 0.\nIncrease the boost by 1 for each unit with <keyword=patience>Patience</keyword> you played this game.
en.fluff: A lesson a day keeps mediocrity away.

en.name: Waylay
en.tooltip: Damage an enemy unit by 3 and <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> an Elven Deadeye on a random allied row
en.fluff: I spit on Scoia'tael ideals, but not on their coin.

en.name: Tempering
en.tooltip: Boost an ally by 5. If it's a Dwarf, also give it 2 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.
en.fluff: Dwarven steel is very tough. Almost as tough as the dwarves themselves.

en.name: Gutting Slash
en.tooltip: Deal 4 damage to a unit.\n<keyword=bloodthirst>Bloodthirst</keyword> 2: Damage a unit by 6 instead.
en.fluff: Man or tree, a Skelligan axe fells it all the same.

en.name: Primal Savagery
en.tooltip: Damage an enemy unit by 2.\n<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Bear Abomination and <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> it to a random allied row.
en.fluff: Not all of Svalblod's worshippers wield bow and blade. They've simply no need.

en.name: Assault
en.tooltip: Damage an enemy unit by 4.\nIf you control 2 Salamandra units deal 6 damage instead.
en.fluff: Human life is fragile. Especially in Novigrad.

en.name: Smuggle
en.tooltip: <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 3.\n<keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Flaming Rose Footman on an allied row.
en.fluff: Whoever said that the dead are good for nothing? They make for such great smuggle-bags.

en.name: Hysteria
en.tooltip: Place <keyword=bounty>Bounty</keyword> on an enemy unit and damage it by 3. If it already has a <keyword=bounty>Bounty</keyword>, damage it by 6 instead.
en.fluff: Somebody’s poisoned the waterhole! With innards!

en.name: Confession Extractor
en.tooltip: <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 4.\nWhile in your graveyard, damage an enemy unit by 1 whenever you place a <keyword=bounty>Bounty</keyword> on it.\nCounter: 3
en.fluff: Whether they spit lies or cry truths, it matters not⁠—the Extractor always gets its confession.

en.name: Eventide Plunder
en.tooltip: <keyword=create>Create</keyword> a 4-provision cost unit with a <keyword=fee>Fee</keyword>.
en.fluff: Wouldn't be right to let all this rot in port. We's doin' 'em a favor, really.

en.name: Dimeritium Bomb
en.tooltip: Damage a unit by 4 and give it <keyword=veil>Veil</keyword>.
en.fluff: An important part of every Witch Hunter's kit. In one muted flash, it turns the most powerful sorcerer into pork jelly ripe for cutting.

en.name: Swallow
en.tooltip: Boost a unit by 6.
en.fluff: Symbolizing spring and rejuvenation, the swallow lent its name to this potion that accelerates the rate at which wounds scab over and heal.

en.name: Mahakam Ale
en.tooltip: Boost a unit by 5 and remove its <keyword=lock>Lock</keyword>.
en.fluff: Considered to be the dwarves' greatest contribution to world culture.

en.name: Spores
en.tooltip: Reset the power of a unit.
en.fluff: Carried by the wind across the Continent... Sowing madness and blight where they fall.

en.name: Dancing Star
en.tooltip: Damage an enemy unit by 3.\n<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: Damage the unit to the right by 1 less.
en.fluff: A spectacular sight – until it explodes in your face.

en.name: Samum
en.tooltip: Damage a unit by 3.\n<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: Move adjacent units to the other row.
en.fluff: Zerrikanian alchemists have learned to harness the energy of hot desert storms and bind it into an arcane mixture.

en.name: Red Haze
en.tooltip: Choose an enemy unit, then damage one adjacent enemy unit by its power.
en.fluff: Perhaps the most insidious invention of Zerrikanian alchemists. And there's no shortage to choose from.

en.name: Inspirational Ballad
en.tooltip: Give an allied unit <keyword=vitality>Vitality</keyword> (6).
en.fluff: War's not so horrific when you put a catchy tune to it.

en.name: Undying Thirst
en.tooltip: Give an enemy unit <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> (6).
en.fluff: Some appetites can never be sated.

en.name: Teleportation
en.tooltip: Reset an allied unit's power. If it's a bronze unit, replay it instead.
en.fluff: There was a flash and he stopped seeing, hearing or feeling anything⁠—apart from cold. Cold was the only thing felt inside the black nothingness, amid silence, amorphousness and timelessness, because the teleport dulled and extinguished all other senses.

en.name: Arachas Nest
en.tooltip: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> 4 Drones on an allied row.
en.fluff: Damn, the filth's o'errun us… We need a witcher or there's no livin' 'ere!

en.name: Feast of Blood
en.tooltip: <keyword=purify>Purify</keyword> an enemy unit and damage it by 3.\nIf you control a Vampire, also give it <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> (3).
en.fluff: Vampires have been known to fast for years at a time. Yet once the hunt resumes, they feed and feed until frenzied and drunk on blood.

en.name: Natural Selection
en.tooltip: Damage an enemy unit by 4, then <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Drone on a random allied row for each point of excess damage dealt.
en.fluff: The strongest will survive. So not you.

en.name: Bleeding Effigy
en.tooltip: <keyword=banish>Banish</keyword> a bronze unit from your opponent's graveyard, then boost an allied unit by its power.\nIf you control Bloody Mistress or Gernichora, you may target gold units.
en.fluff: A drop of blood, a hair from the head, a fragment of a nail…

en.name: Megascope
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Choose a bronze allied unit.\n<keyword=timer>Timer</keyword> 2: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a base copy of chosen unit to the right of Megascope.
en.fluff: In order to communicate at a distance, one must construct a magical artefact⁠—a megascope⁠—using magic.

en.name: Ointment
en.tooltip: Boost an allied unit by 5. If it was a bronze Soldier, trigger its end of turn ability.
en.fluff: Will it help? Who knows. Shouldn't do any harm, though. Probably.

en.name: Tourney Joust
en.tooltip: Remove an enemy unit's <keyword=shield>Shield</keyword> and damage it by 4, or give an allied unit a <keyword=shield>Shield</keyword> and boost it by 4.
en.fluff: Fame and glory eternal await the victor of this year's annual chivalric tourney!

en.name: Battle Preparation
en.tooltip: Boost an allied unit by 4 and give it 2 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.\nIf it's a Soldier, boost it by 6 and give it 2 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword> instead.
en.fluff: Many a knight met an untimely death because of his shoddily tied breastplate coming undone.

en.name: Bombardment
en.tooltip: Split 4 damage randomly between all enemy units. Increase the damage by 1 for each Siege Engine you control.
en.fluff: Castle won't batter itself down, now will it? Get them trebuchets rollin'!

en.name: Target Practice
en.tooltip: Boost an allied unit by 4. If there is a Witcher on the boosted unit's row, also <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Witcher Student on that row.
en.fluff: Most Griffins can split an apple in two from a hundred paces. Just make sure you don’t move.

en.name: Dryad's Caress
en.tooltip: <keyword=purify>Purify</keyword> an allied unit and boost it by 3.\nIf you control a Dryad, also give it <keyword=vitality>Vitality</keyword> (3).
en.fluff: Shh, shh... Evelienn va maeth, elaine blath...

en.name: Making a Bomb
en.tooltip: Move an enemy unit to the other row and give it <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> (4). If it's the only unit on that row, damage it by 4 instead.
en.fluff: You’ll probably want to follow the instructions…

en.name: Mardroeme
en.tooltip: Damage a unit by 3, then boost it by 9.
en.fluff: Eat enough of them, and the world will never be the same…

en.name: Crow's-eye Rhizome
en.tooltip: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> 2 Crows in allied row. If you control a Druid, <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> 3 Crows instead.
en.fluff: Fatally poisonous. Unless you know how to prepare it…

en.name: Armor Up
en.tooltip: Damage an enemy unit by 2.\n<keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> 3 Witcher Students on the opposite row, damage them by 1, then give them 1 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.
en.fluff: Why try to sidestep the blow, when you can easily bear the brunt?

en.name: Tears of Siren
en.tooltip: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> <keyword=rain>Rain</keyword> on an enemy row for 2 turns, then <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Deafening Siren on the opposite row.
en.fluff: It is said they only cry for love lost. A pity they only love once in a lifetime…

en.name: Slander
en.tooltip: <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 3.\nPlace a <keyword=bounty>Bounty</keyword> on an enemy unit.
en.fluff: All Novigradians have two great passions: coin and hearsay.

en.name: Fisstech
en.tooltip: <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 4.\n<keyword=poison>Poison</keyword> a unit.
en.fluff: Large pupils, chattering teeth, a mad cackle... Aye, that's fisstech for ye.

en.name: Dip in the Pontar
en.tooltip: <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 3.\nDamage an enemy unit by 3.
en.fluff: The Pontar's got more bodies than fish these days.

en.name: Line of Credit
en.tooltip: Destroy an allied unit or artifact, then gain 7 <keyword=coin>Coins</keyword>.
en.fluff: Illiterate, ye say? A moment, if ye could. I'll draw us up another agreement...

en.name: Bloody Good Fun
en.tooltip: <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 4.\nSpend all your <keyword=coin>Coins</keyword> and damage an enemy by the same amount.
en.fluff: What do ye mean, "Why?" The game was beginnin' to drag!

en.name: Shakedown
en.tooltip: <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 3.\nBoost an allied unit by 3.
en.fluff: Nae need to be stingy, pal. There's plenty to go 'round.

en.name: Swindle
en.tooltip: <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 4 - 6.\nFor each allied Crownsplitters, increase the minimal amount by 1.
en.fluff: There are a hundred ways to fleece a sheep. And Cleaver's crew knew them all.

en.name: Ard Feainn Tortoise
en.tooltip: <keyword=exposed>Exposed</keyword>: Boost an enemy unit with the most power by 3.
en.fluff: Close formation, clench your sphincters! Left, right, left, steady!

en.name: Congregation
en.tooltip: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> 2 Firesworn Zealots on an allied row.\nIf there is a Firesworn unit on that row, <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> 3 Firesworn Zealots instead.
en.fluff: Our church is not this temple, not our scripture. It is our people, our community, we who have faith.

en.name: Strays of Spalla
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Shuffle a gold card from your hand into your deck, then draw a bronze card and boost self by 4.\n<keyword=bonded>Bonded</keyword>: Boost self by 4 instead.
en.fluff: Awoo, awoo, awooooo!

en.name: Bomb Heaver
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 1.\nIf you have a Bomb in your hand, damage it by 3 instead.
en.fluff: Knew a young couple once—got separated right after the weddin'. Bomb in the carriage'll do that.

en.name: Pellar
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=purify>Purify</keyword> a unit.
en.fluff:
Gather spirits for this wake,
A passing soul ne'er forsake,
Hear my call, my humble plea,
Unbind his chains, set him free.

en.name: Iron Falcon Troubadour
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a 1-power <keyword=lock>Locked</keyword> copy of a <keyword=bonded>Bonded</keyword> unit from your starting deck on this row.
en.fluff: When I play even dying's more pleasant.

en.name: Squirrel
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=banish>Banish</keyword> a card from your opponent's graveyard.
en.fluff: Just one badass squirrel. Nothing less, nothing more.

en.name: Celaeno Harpy
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=consume>Consume</keyword> an allied unit.\n<keyword=bonded>Bonded</keyword>: Also <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Harpy Egg on this row.
en.fluff: Common harpies feed on carrion. Celaeno harpies… they feed on dreams.

en.name: Foglet
en.tooltip: <keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> <keyword=fog>Fog</keyword> on the opposite row for 3 turns.
en.fluff: Fog creeps on little cat feet. Foglets creep over the bodies of their victims.

en.name: Maerolorn
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Trigger a bronze allied unit's <keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword> ability.
en.fluff: No gate nor wall can stop them. Just one tiny crack — that's all they need...

en.name: Ice Troll
en.tooltip: At the end of your turn, if you control fewer units than your opponent, boost self by 1.
en.fluff: Trolls come in many varieties, with differing shapes, sizes and predilections, though always with about as much brains as a bucket of rusty nails.

en.name: Cursed Knight
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Transform an allied unit that is not a Cursed Knight into a Cursed Knight without changing its power.
en.fluff: He fights an endless war whose beginning he no longer remembers.

en.name: Oxenfurt Scholar
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Give an allied unit <keyword=vitality>Vitality</keyword> (2).
en.fluff: Balderdash! Your blatant obfuscation of teleological and ontological axioms is an embarrassment to the field! Ostentatious verbiage for its own sake!

en.name: Wagenburg
en.tooltip: <keyword=barricade>Barricade</keyword>: At the end of your turn, give 1 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword> to adjacent units.
en.fluff: Dh'oine can turn anything into a weapon. Even a simple wagon…

en.name: Iron Falcon Infantry
en.tooltip: At the end of your turn, boost self by 1 if this is the only card on its row.\n<keyword=bonded>Bonded</keyword>: At the end of your turn, boost self by 1 instead.
en.fluff: You have to look good on the battlefield too.

en.name: Desert Banshee
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=consume>Consume</keyword> an allied unit.\nWhenever you play a unit with the <keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword> ability, boost self by 1.
en.fluff: You're worried you'll die of thirst in the sands? Relax. You won't make it that long.

en.name: Eternal Eclipse Deacon
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=infused>Infuse</keyword> a unit in your hand with the Cultist category.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=infused>Infuse</keyword> a unit in your deck with the Cultist category.
en.fluff: Once you see beyond the occult fumes and elitist allure, only then you cease to be a piece and become a player.

en.name: Cursed Damsel
en.tooltip: <keyword=thrive>Thrive</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Halve own power and destroy an enemy unit with power up to the power removed from self.
en.fluff: An innocent girl surrounded by mutilated corpses of her sisters and servants. Don't you pity her? She must be yearning for a comforting embrace.

en.name: Slyzard
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=consume>Consume</keyword> an allied unit on this row.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 1
en.fluff: No man alive, no matter his brawn, no matter his skill, can parry a blow dealt by the tail of a slyzard, the pincers of a giant scorpion or the claws of a griffin.

en.name: Endrega Warrior
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=consume>Consume</keyword> your adjacent units. For each <keyword=consume>Consumed</keyword> Insectoid, gain 1 <keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>.\n<keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Drone on this row.\n<keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>: 1
en.fluff: Where I come from no one was afraid of the Big Bad Wolf or Baba Yaga. Instead, we had an Endrega nest in the shrubs beyond the village.

en.name: Aen Elle Aristocrat
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=dominance>Dominance</keyword>): Move an enemy unit to the other row.\nAt the end of your turn, <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> <keyword=frost>Frost</keyword> for 1 turn on each enemy row on which <keyword=frost>Frost</keyword> was applied this turn.
en.fluff: Those born with a silver spoon in their mouth rarely care to learn how it got there in the first place.

en.name: Fiend
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost all <keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword> units in your hand by 1.
en.fluff: A fiend looks a bit like a deer. An enormous, evil deer.

en.name: Impera Brigade
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage all <keyword=spying>Spying</keyword> units on the opposite row by 1.
en.fluff: The Impera Brigade never surrenders. Ever.

en.name: Master of Disguise
en.tooltip: At the end of your turn, if there is a <keyword=lock>Locked</keyword> enemy unit, boost self by 1.
en.fluff: O Great Sun which dost in Heavens fly, save us from the lice which do so stubbornly infest our bloomers.

en.name: Bruxa
en.tooltip: <keyword=thrive>Thrive</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Give an enemy unit <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> (2).
en.fluff: The vampiress lunged in a blur, unleashing an inhuman shriek. The wall of sound slammed into the witcher like a battering ram – splintering his ribs, forcing the air from his lungs, and sending tendrils of pain down his spine.

en.name: Vicovaro Novice
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Draw a card, then move a card from your hand to the top of your deck.
en.fluff: Mages in Nilfgaard are disposable. If one disappoints the Emperor, a dozen others await to provide what he requires.

en.name: Blue Stripes Scout
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a base copy of a bronze non-Neutral allied unit at the bottom of your deck.
en.fluff: Blue Stripes and Scoia'tael are similar in one regard – hatred fuels both.

en.name: Kaedweni Cavalry
en.tooltip: <keyword=shield>Shield</keyword>.\nWhenever this unit loses its <keyword=shield>Shield</keyword>, boost self by 2.
en.fluff: Always wondered – how the blazes do those lads handle nature's call…?

en.name: Dwarven Agitator
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Give 1 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword> to 2 Dwarves in your hand.\nWhenever you play a Dwarf, give it 1 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.
en.fluff: "Mark me words, if ye dinnae get up off yer arses, humans're gonnae come here an' steal our wenches!"

en.name: Aedirnian Mauler
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Damage an enemy unit by 2.
en.fluff: Ugh, these guys can be a real headache.

en.name: Kaedweni Knight
en.tooltip: When played or <keyword=summon>Summoned</keyword> from the deck, boost self by 3.
en.fluff: Not every man in the Kaedweni Army supports his king's politics. Yet not a single one would dare say that out loud.

en.name: Toussaint Knight-Errant
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 2. If it has at least 6 power, damage it by 4 instead.
en.fluff: White steed, shiny-arse armor... Aye, 'tis a knight-errant alright. Fetch the coffin maker!

en.name: Cintrian Artificer
en.tooltip: <keyword=formation>Formation</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Give an allied unit a <keyword=shield>Shield</keyword>.
en.fluff: What shall I call it? Perhaps Andúril...

en.name: Arena Ghoul
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: On turn end, destroy self.\n<keyword=tribute>Tribute</keyword> 1: Cancel the <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> ability.
en.fluff: He'll be a perfect fit for your arena. Just like a mutt lickin' your plate after dinner.

en.name: Siege Ladder
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Move an allied unit to the other row.\n<keyword=crew>Crew</keyword>: Also boost it by 2.
en.fluff: What?! Now you tell me you're afraid of heights?!

en.name: Van Moorlehem Hunter
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>) Give an enemy unit <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> (2).\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): <keyword=lock>Lock</keyword> a unit.
en.fluff: Rather than beasts, he prefers to stalk poachers. But they don't come as often anymore into the woods surrounding the palace…

en.name: Traveling Priestess
en.tooltip:
<keyword=veil>Veil</keyword>.
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Gain 1 <keyword=charge>Charges</keyword>. Whenever this unit is put back into your deck, increase the number of <keyword=charge>Charges</keyword> by 2.
<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Boost an allied unit by 1.
Whenever this unit is <keyword=inspired>Inspired</keyword>, gain <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>.
<keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>: 0
en.fluff: Many devotees of the goddess Melitele branch out from the central sanctuary in Ellander to roam the Northern Realms. Most head out as midwives or healers. Others preach messages of peace and love. The rare few choose an itinerant lifestyle, living off of wild berries, and helping out folks along their travels who are struck by misfortune. The presence of such pilgrims is a sign for the forlorn that Melitele has not forsaken them.

en.name: Naiad Pondkeeper
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Damage an enemy unit by an allied Wandering Treant's power, then reset the Wandering Treant.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): <keyword=infused>Infuse</keyword> a non-<keyword=symbiosis>Symbiosis</keyword> allied unit with "<keyword=symbiosis>Symbiosis</keyword>".
en.fluff: Anyone wandering this far from civilization couldn't possibly expect to be missed.

en.name: Siege Tower
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Gain <keyword=vitality>Vitality</keyword> (2).\n<keyword=crew>Crew</keyword>: Boost self by 2 instead.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 2
en.fluff: The latest rage in assaults on walled cities.

en.name: Nekker
en.tooltip: <keyword=thrive>Thrive</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a base copy of this unit and <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> it to this row.
en.fluff: These little guys are almost cute, if you ignore the whole vicious killer aspect.

en.name: Vrihedd Sappers
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=purify>Purify</keyword> an allied unit.\nIf you control an Elf, <keyword=purify>Purify</keyword> any unit instead.
en.fluff: No matter what you may have heard, elves don't take human scalps. Too much lice.

en.name: Dol Blathanna Bowman
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 1 for each row that separates it from this unit.
en.fluff: You might manage to hide from them, but once spotted, don't bother trying to run.

en.name: Daerlan Soldier
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: If you control a Soldier, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> all copies of this unit from your deck to this row.\nAt the start of the game, <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a copy of self in your deck.
en.fluff: Learned a lot at Braibant Military Academy. How to scrub potatoes, for instance.

en.name: Kaedweni Revenant
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage a unit by 1.\n<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a base copy of Kaedweni Revenant and <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> it to this row.
en.fluff: Doomed to repeat the same day over and over again, just like the employees of Cianfanelli Bank.

en.name: Cintrian Knight
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy by 2.\n<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: Gain <keyword=vitality>Vitality</keyword> (2).\n<keyword=grace>Grace</keyword> 6: Boost self by 2.
en.fluff: For whom does the bell toll?

en.name: Svalblod Cultist
en.tooltip: At the end of your turn, <keyword=heal>Heal</keyword> the unit to the left by 1 and damage the unit to the right by 1.
en.fluff: They... They's butcherin' folk, Captain! S-sacrifices to a bear god or some such!

en.name: Radovid's Royal Guards
en.tooltip: <keyword=formation>Formation</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Boost an allied unit by 2.\n<keyword=inspired>Inspired</keyword>: Give it 2 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.
en.fluff: They'll do anything for their king. They know what he'll do to them if they refuse.

en.name: Tuirseach Invader
en.tooltip: <keyword=veil>Veil</keyword>. <keyword=veteran>Veteran</keyword>.
en.fluff: Mother of four, ya sayeth? Well, then she shouldst been smarter than running 'round with an axe.

en.name: Elven Swordmaster
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Damage an enemy unit by 1.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 2\nWhenever you play an Elf, decrease the <keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword> by 1.
en.fluff: Combat is a dance, and you must never allow your opponent to lead.

en.name: Dryad Matron
en.tooltip: At the end of your turn, move self to the rightmost position on this row, then boost the unit to the left by 1.
en.fluff: She teaches young dryads many useful skills: fletching arrows, communing with the forest, slitting the throats of men...

en.name: Failed Experiment
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=poison>Poison</keyword> self.\n<keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 4: Move <keyword=poison>Poison</keyword> from self to another unit.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 3
en.fluff: Even failed experiments can serve a purpose. How else would one be expected to push the boundaries of knowledge?

en.name: Tuirseach Axeman
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Damage a unit by the amount it is already damaged
en.fluff: Swords are for wenches. Get yourself an axe.

en.name: Brokvar Archer
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Damage an enemy unit by the amount of damaged units on their side.
en.fluff: So ye can hit a movin' target at two hundred paces? Me, too. In a storm.

en.name: Emissary
en.tooltip: <keyword=disloyal>Disloyal</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost an ally by 7.
en.fluff: But… but there's no justice in it! One does not kill the messenger!

en.name: Forest Whisperer
