en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): <keyword=poison>Poison</keyword> an enemy unit.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Give an allied unit <keyword=vitality>Vitality</keyword> (3).
en.fluff: The dryads of Brokilon mastered a unique craft – to shape trees at will... And breathe into them life.

en.name: Cleaver's Muscle
en.tooltip: <keyword=shield>Shield</keyword>.
en.fluff: Those who try to cheat Cleaver are in for a rude awakening... And a rough landing.

en.name: Armored Drakkar
en.tooltip: At the end of your turn, if Armored Drakkar has no <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>, gain 2 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.\n<keyword=exposed>Exposed</keyword>: Boost self by 1.\n<keyword=Bloodthirst>Bloodthirst</keyword> 2: Boost self by 2 instead.
en.fluff: You can't take it upriver… but you can certainly take it to chase the imperial fleet.

en.name: Crow Clan Preacher
en.tooltip: Whenever you play an Alchemy card, boost self by 1.\n<keyword=bonded>Bonded</keyword>: Boost self by 2 instead.
en.fluff: A lot of learning awaits you. And a lot of mistakes.

en.name: Vernossiel's Commando
en.tooltip: At the end of your turn, boost self by 1 if you control only Elf units.\nIgnore the condition if you control Vernossiel.
en.fluff: Only a swish could be heard... Followed by six men tumbling dead to the ground.

en.name: Dimun Warship
en.tooltip: Whenever you play a Pirate, damage self and a random enemy unit by 1.\n<keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword>: <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> the highest-power bronze Pirate from your graveyard to this row.
en.fluff: Clan Dimun warships are light and fast, perfect for racing down slow merchant frigates.

en.name: Dimun Corsair
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Remove up to 2 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword> from an allied unit and boost self by the same amount.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 2\nWhenever you play a Ship, decrease the <keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword> by 1.
en.fluff: The sea's ours, along with everythin' that floats, swims or sails in it!

en.name: Crow Clan Druid
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=banish>Banish</keyword> an allied Crow, then play a 4-provision Alchemy card from your graveyard and give it <keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.
en.fluff: Wise men claim that animals are mindless automatons. Wise men don't know what they're talking about.

en.name: Vrihedd Saboteur
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost an allied unit by 1.\nIf you control an artifact, boost an allied unit by 3 instead.
en.fluff: The gates were ordered to be closed… But they didn't budge.

en.name: Dimun Pirate Captain
en.tooltip: <keyword=Deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 1.\n<keyword=Bloodthirst>Bloodthirst</keyword> 2: Damage it by 3 instead.
en.fluff: Haul together, hoist the colors high!

en.name: An Craite Marauder
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Split 3 damage randomly between all enemy units.
en.fluff: You daft? You mean to sail to Skellige? Those barbarians'll tear you to shreds!

en.name: Brokilon Sentinel
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 2.\n<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> all copies of this unit from your deck to this row.
en.fluff: Brokilon is not merely the forest you see before you. She yet lives on in the cities, villages, and fields you so callously carved from her flesh. We shall yet reclaim what you have stolen from her.

en.name: Renegade Mage
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 1.\n<keyword=tribute>Tribute</keyword> 1: Damage it by 3 instead.
en.fluff: I really hope that's boot leather I smell burning...

en.name: Witch Hunter
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Place a <keyword=bounty>Bounty</keyword> on an enemy unit.
en.fluff: Long coats, wide-brimmed hats, and crooked grins – witch hunters are hard to miss.

en.name: Tax Collector
en.tooltip: <keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>: At the end of your turn, gain 1 <keyword=coin>Coin</keyword>.
en.fluff: Just between rat catcher and latrine shoveler on this year's most desirable professions list.

en.name: Eternal Fire Priest
en.tooltip: Whenever you <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> one or more units to the battlefield, boost self by 1.
en.fluff: Closer, my sheep, gather closer. May the Eternal Fire warm your souls!

en.name: Eternal Fire Inquisitor
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Destroy an allied Firesworn Token, then boost self by 4.\n<keyword=timer>Timer</keyword> 2: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a base copy of the destroyed Token on this row.
en.fluff: The burning light of the Eternal Fire reveals all!

en.name: Terror Crew Plunderer
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage a unit by 2.\nIf it's an ally, boost self by 4.
en.fluff: They say diamonds are a girl's best friend. But my best friend is a knife. I can use it to get anything else I want.

en.name: Lonely Champion
en.tooltip: <keyword=immune>Immunity</keyword>.\n<keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Destroy all Firesworn Tokens on this row, then boost self by their total power.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 2
en.fluff: So long as he continues the righteous fight, the Order and its flame endure.

en.name: Scoia'tael Neophyte
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a base copy of this unit on the other row.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Transform an allied Elf into an Elven Deadeye.
en.fluff: Many nonhumans, fed up with the racism and xenophobia they encounter in the cities, decide to join the Scoia'tael.

en.name: Oxenfurt Naturalist
en.tooltip: <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 2.\n<keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 1: Give an allied unit <keyword=vitality>Vitality</keyword> (1).
en.fluff: When handling mandrake, you must always remember to don a pair of protective... Wait, where are my gloves?

en.name: Kikimore Warrior
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Destroy an allied unit, then <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Kikimore Warrior and <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> it to this row.
en.fluff: Come spring, the buggers start to burst through the woodwork. Literally.

en.name: Fisstech Trafficker
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Give <keyword=poison>Poison</keyword> to a unit. If it's an ally, gain 3 <keyword=coin>Coins</keyword>.
en.fluff: Addictive? Why, not at all! I've quit several times before!

en.name: Eternal Fire Disciple
en.tooltip: <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 2.\n<keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 1: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Firesworn Zealot on this row.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 1
en.fluff: Look into your hearts, dear brethen. Does a contempt for injustice not burn within it?

en.name: Tuirseach Bearmaster
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost self by the number of unique allied Beasts. \n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage self by own boost, then damage that many enemy units by 1.
en.fluff: Don't touch him. Don't look him in the eyes. In fact… don't go anywhere near him.

en.name: Tidecloak Ransackers
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 2.\n<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: Gain 2 <keyword=coin>Coins</keyword>.\n<keyword=hoard>Hoard</keyword> 5: Always trigger the <keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword> ability.
en.fluff: There's more wealth in Novigrad than in all of Skellige – and the number of poor saps to match.

en.name: Elder Bear
en.tooltip: No ability.
en.fluff: We're going on a bear hunt! We're going to catch a–– THAT THING'S HUGE! RUN!

en.name: Blindeye Apothecary
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): <keyword=heal>Heal</keyword> an allied unit.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Boost an allied unit by 4.\n<keyword=tribute>Tribute</keyword> 0: Combine both <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> abilities instead.
en.fluff: After her husband died in a tragic carriage accident, she threw herself completely into her work.

en.name: Kikimore Worker
en.tooltip: <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>: Whenever you play an Insectoid, gain 1 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.\n<keyword=exposed>Exposed</keyword>: Destroy self.
en.fluff: They say it can eat a whole man in armor down to the bone in less than a minute. I'd rather not find out if it's true.

en.name: Street Urchins
en.tooltip: <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword>: 3.\n<keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 1: Boost self by 1.
en.fluff: When I was five, I stole candy. Now I'm six and I work in robbery.

en.name: Aen Elle Conqueror
en.tooltip: <keyword=veil>Veil</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Destroy self.\n<keyword=devotion>Devotion</keyword>: Cancel the <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> ability.
en.fluff: For his noble kind morality is but a whim enjoyed by others. More specifically, those who lose.

en.name: Nekker Warrior
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: If this card would not trigger any of your <keyword=thrive>Thrive</keyword> units, damage self by 3 and <keyword=infused>Infuse</keyword> self with "<keyword=thrive>Thrive</keyword>".
en.fluff: Take heed, gents, there's nekkers under this here bridge.

en.name: Noonwraith
en.tooltip: <keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> 2 Rats on a random enemy row.
en.fluff: Contrary to popular belief, farmers don't stop work in the middle of the day to hide from the heat - they hide from the Noonwraith.

en.name: Werewolf
en.tooltip: <keyword=immune>Immunity</keyword>.
en.fluff: Some say lycanthropy's contagious - get bit by a werewolf, you turn into one yourself. Witchers know that's nonsense, of course - only a powerful curse can bring on this condition.

en.name: Peasant Militia
en.tooltip: Whenever you play a unit with <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>, boost self by 1.
en.fluff: We's the militia. We keep the peace.

en.name: Ofiri Merchant
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Swap the top card of your opponent's deck with yours.
en.fluff: I have that which you desire. As well as that which you have never seen before…

en.name: Fortune Teller
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Give <keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword> to a unit.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Give <keyword=veil>Veil</keyword> to a unit.
en.fluff: Her prophecies have never been wrong – mainly because she always predicts something bad to happen.

en.name: Lesser Witch
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a base copy of self in your graveyard.\n<keyword=bonded>Bonded</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a base copy of self on this row instead.
en.fluff: Less powerful, but no less terrible.

en.name: Scout
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Move a unit to the other row.
en.fluff: If our scouts don't come back, we turn around. The yokels claim these woods are full o' squirrels - and I don't mean the nut-gatherin' kind.

en.name: Vran Warrior
en.tooltip: Whenever a unit is destroyed during your turn, boost self by 1.
en.fluff: They sat still on their horses, seemingly relaxed. He saw their weapons – short spears with wide tips. Swords with oddly forged guards. Battle axes. Toothed gisarmes.

en.name: Dwarven Mercenary
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage self by 1 for each non-Dwarf unit in your hand.
en.fluff: The key's mixin' pleasure an' business – like smackin' foes and gettin' coin for it.

en.name: Alchemist
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Swap the power of 2 allied units.
en.fluff: Two ounces of calcium equum, one ounce of rubedo…

en.name: Archespore
en.tooltip: <keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword>: <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> all copies of this unit from your deck to this row.
en.fluff: Folklore claims they sprout from soil watered with the blood of the dying. Thus they flourish in grounds consecrated by pogroms, dark rituals or brutal murders.

en.name: Cockatrice
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 1 for each adjacent Beast.
en.fluff: Always strikes between the vertebrae, under your left kidney or straight into your aorta. That way, it only needs to strike once.

en.name: Forktail
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage all other units by 1.
en.fluff: As for forktails, bait them thusly: pound a stake in the soil, bind a goat to it, then hide ye in nearto shrubbery posthaste.

en.name: Slave Infantry
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Transform an allied unit into Slave Infantry.
en.fluff: A free man's got a choice. A slave's choices are made for him.

en.name: Bridge Troll
en.tooltip: <keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword>: Boost the lowest-power allied unit by 4.
en.fluff: This here bridge? Trolls built it a long time ago. Sat under it, made folk pay 'em a hefty copper to pass. Thing is, not many folk pass this way. So they all packed up, went their way. Not the bridge, though. It stayed.

en.name: Garkain
en.tooltip: At the end of your turn, if there is a <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> enemy unit, boost self by 1.
en.fluff: Blood on the ceiling, entrails on the wall... Got garkain written all over it.

en.name: Plumard
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Give an enemy unit <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> (2).\n<keyword=bonded>Bonded</keyword>: Give an enemy unit <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> equal to its base power instead.
en.fluff: One alone poses no great threat. But a dozen? Gods be with you.

en.name: Ducal Guard
en.tooltip: <keyword=flanking>Flanking</keyword>.\nAt the end of your turn, boost self by 1 if you used your leader ability this turn.
en.fluff: And whatever you do, never, EVER, mention the duchess's sister. Right, so... Welcome to Her Majesty's royal guard!

en.name: Endrega Eggs
en.tooltip: <keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> 3 Drones on this row.
en.fluff: If you find some it's best to burn the entire forest down. Then run as far away as you can.

en.name: Naglfar's Taskmaster
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=purify>Purify</keyword> an enemy unit.\n<keyword=dominance>Dominance</keyword>: <keyword=purify>Purify</keyword> a unit instead.
en.fluff: She ensures the ship is sustained by squeezing the life essence from those insignificant human vermin.

en.name: Hybrid
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): If a unit was destroyed during this turn, boost self by 5.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): <keyword=consume>Consume</keyword> an allied unit.
en.fluff: When one head just isn’t enough.

en.name: Knight Challenger
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Gain <keyword=vitality>Vitality</keyword> equal to the amount of boost an enemy unit has.\n<keyword=grace>Grace</keyword> 8: Boost all units by 1.
en.fluff: While you were studying the blade, he mastered his hair.

en.name: Kikimore Hatchling
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Remove 1 boost from self, then <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Drone on this row.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 1\nWhenever you play an Organic card, boost self by 1.
en.fluff: As a general rule, the more brightly colored the egg, the less you'll want to fry it.

en.name: Wild Hunt Hound
en.tooltip: <keyword=dominance>Dominance</keyword>: At the end of your turn, boost self by 1.
en.fluff: Cry 'Havoc!', and let slip the dogs of war.

en.name: Wolf Pack
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 2.
en.fluff: "Relax, I know how to tame wolves…"– Dunbar the Hunter's last words.

en.name: Combat Engineer
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Give 1 <keyword=charge>Charge</keyword> to all allied Machines in hand, deck, and on the battlefield.
en.fluff: Want irrefutable proof of civilization's advance? Look at war. Man gets better at killing with each one.

en.name: Mangonel
en.tooltip: Whenever an enemy unit gains <keyword=spying>Spying</keyword>, damage units adjacent to it by 1.
en.fluff: This model specializes in slinging corpses and ripe dung.

en.name: Infiltrator
en.tooltip: <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>: On round end, shuffle this unit into your opponent's deck.
en.fluff: You can run, but you'll never hide.

en.name: Slave Hunter
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 1. Increase the damage by 1 for each adjacent Soldier.\nIf the target is left at 1 power, <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a 1-power <keyword=lock>Locked</keyword> copy of it to the right of self.
en.fluff: The trick is to break their wills - but not their bodies.

en.name: Recruit
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Play a bronze Soldier from your deck, then shuffle self into your deck.
en.fluff: His is not to reason why, his is but… to peel one damned spud after another.

en.name: Fangs of the Empire
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Give an enemy unit <keyword=poison>Poison</keyword>.
en.fluff: For a courtesan, a single drop. For a rock troll, an entire bottle. And for Nordling scum? Why waste good poison when a rusty dagger will do?

en.name: Nightwraith
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> 2 Rats on this row.\n<keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> 2 Rats on this row.
en.fluff: How much damage can a pale, emaciated woman, entangled in a ripped dress, do? A lot, it turns out.

en.name: Van Moorlehem Servant
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Copy all statuses (excluding <keyword=infused>Infused</keyword>) from an enemy unit to another enemy unit. Boost self by the number of status copied that way.
en.fluff: They say she's served the Moorlehems for thirty years. And she hasn't aged a day…

en.name: Viper Witcher Adept
en.tooltip: At the end of your turn, boost self by 1 if your opponent has more cards in the deck than you.
en.fluff: Each student is given a pet to raise during their stay at Gorthur Gvaed, in order to form a strong emotional bond throughout their training. Years later, before becoming a fully-fledged witcher, they are ordered to slaughter their companion in cold blood.

en.name: Bear Witcher Adept
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage self by 4.\nAt the end of your turn, <keyword=heal>Heal</keyword> self by 1. While not damaged, gain 1 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword> instead.
en.fluff: To become a Bear Witcher, all students must pass the Trial of the Mountain. This requires venturing to the peak of Mount Gorgon to retrieve a special runestone as proof of ascent—an especially brutal challenge, as many boys freeze to death long before they find the summit.

en.name: Illusionist
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a base copy of a bronze unit from your opponent's graveyard on the right of this card and set its power to 1.\n<keyword=bonded>Bonded</keyword>: Don't set its power to 1.
en.fluff: “When you are few, make them believe you are many. If they still attack, well... you were fucked either way.” ⁠- Unnamed Nilfgaardian strategist

en.name: Toxicologist
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=infused>Infuse</keyword> an enemy unit with "Whenever a card enters or leaves your deck, damage self by 1", then, if it wasn't a Token, <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> its copy at the bottom your opponent's deck.
en.fluff: Voted least likely to live to old age by the other chemists in the academy. And that was really saying something.

en.name: Wild Hunt Warrior
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 2.\n<keyword=dominance>Dominance</keyword>: Also <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> <keyword=frost>Frost</keyword> on its row for 1 turn.
en.fluff: The White Frost is coming.

en.name: Fire Scorpion
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage a unit by 1. \n<keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>: 1\nWhenever you play a Tactic, gain 1 <keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>.
en.fluff: Name's terribly misleading, makes it sound like some corpulent reddish arachnid, not an exquisitely engineered weapon of mass destruction...

en.name: Wild Hunt Navigator
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost an allied unit by the duration of <keyword=frost>Frost</keyword> on its opposite row.\n<keyword=dominance>Dominance</keyword>: Boost an allied unit by the total duration of <keyword=frost>Frost</keyword> on your opponent's side instead.
en.fluff: For hundreds of years, Avallac'h tried to recreate the Elder Blood gene through back breeding - yet the elven children thus fostered were but dim sparks compared to Lara's flame.

en.name: Disgraced Brawler
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=bloodthirst>Bloodthirst</keyword> 3): <keyword=lock>Lock</keyword> self.\n<keyword=berserk>Berserk</keyword> 3: Destroy self.
en.fluff: Skellige's no home to murderers and rogues... Their crimes must be repaid in blood.

en.name: Thanedd Turncoat
en.tooltip:
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Give an enemy unit <keyword=spying>Spying</keyword>.
<keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=conspiracy>Conspiracy</keyword>): Damage an enemy unit by 1.
Whenever an enemy unit gains <keyword=spying>Spying</keyword>, reduce the <keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword> by 1.
<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 2
en.fluff: Hell hath no fury like a sorceress scorned.

en.name: Hermit
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage self by 4.\n<keyword=berserk>Berserk</keyword> 6: At the end of your turn, damage the unit to the right by 1, then <keyword=heal>Heal</keyword> self by 2.
en.fluff: Oh, good Lady, bless your faithful servant with a fat flounder.

en.name: Eternal Eclipse Initiate
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=infused>Infuse</keyword> a bronze enemy unit with "Whenever your opponent plays a Cultist, damage self by 1. <keyword=deathwish>Deathwish</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a base copy of self on the opposite row, <keyword=infused>Infuse</keyword> it with the Cultist category, then set its power to the number of Cultists your opponent controls".
en.fluff: The air of mystery, the promise of power - enough to obtain a whole set of pawns for your chessboard.

en.name: Orchard Mantrap
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): <keyword=consume>Consume</keyword> an allied unit. This unit triggers <keyword=thrive>Thrive</keyword> an additional time.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): <keyword=infused>Infuse</keyword> 2 allied units with "<keyword=thrive>Thrive</keyword>".
en.fluff: Retribution for all innocent fruit cannibalized by mankind!

en.name: Drowner
en.tooltip: <keyword=thrive>Thrive</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Move an enemy unit to the other row and damage it by 2.
en.fluff: Though the witchman lusts for gold, for the smiting of a drowner thou shalt give him but a silver penny, or three halfpence, at most.

en.name: Deithwen Arbalest
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Give an enemy unit <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> (3).\n<keyword=conspiracy>Conspiracy</keyword>: Damage it by 3 instead.
en.fluff: I aim for the knees. Always.

en.name: Alba Spearman
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage 2 enemy units by the number of statuses on units adjacent to the targets.
en.fluff: Death and glory!

en.name: Tridam Infantry
en.tooltip: Whenever this unit receives a boost, damage a random enemy unit by 1.
en.fluff: Soldiers loyal to the old baron of Tridam left the city with Falibor, thus becoming renegades wanted by the law.

en.name: Heymaey Spearmaiden
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 2, then damage self by 2.
en.fluff: "Skellige women are wild and unpredictable. All units are to treat them as serious threats and never underestimate their capabilities." - General Directive to the Invading Forces of the Imperial Armada

en.name: Lyrian Cavalry
en.tooltip: Whenever you play a unit with <keyword=order>Orders</keyword>, boost self by 1.
en.fluff: A horseman's worth no less than his steed. And Lyrian horses are among the Continent's best.

en.name: Lyrian Scytheman
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost self by 1 for each boosted unit on this row.
en.fluff: Our folk they feed, and our foes they bleed.

en.name: Menagerie Keeper
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 2. If you have a Tactic in your hand, also give it <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> (2).
en.fluff: If there's one thing Nilfgaardians love more than blood-soaked arena battles, it's blood-soaked arena battles with exotic beasts.

en.name: Cintrian Enchantress
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Give an allied unit <keyword=vitality>Vitality</keyword> (2). \n<keyword=bonded>Bonded</keyword>: Give it <keyword=vitality>Vitality</keyword> (4) instead.
en.fluff: The ladies of the Cintrian court are oft touted for their stately elegance – and equally impressive aptitude for magic

en.name: Dryad Fledgling
en.tooltip: <keyword=harmony>Harmony</keyword>.
en.fluff: Having recently tasted of the Water of Brokilon, she yet feels strange in her new skin... Her gift for killing, on the other hand, bloomed without delay.

en.name: Angry Mob
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 2.\n<keyword=conspiracy>Conspiracy</keyword>: Boost self by 2.
en.fluff: Wanna know their secret? They are always angry.

en.name: Griffin Witcher Adept
en.tooltip: <keyword=shield>Shield</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Transform an allied Witcher into a base copy of Griffin Witcher Adept.
en.fluff: At Kaer Seren, students are afforded the luxury of choice when it comes to their final Trial. They either locate and retrieve a griffin’s egg, or recite the entirety of Liber Tenebrarum verbatim. To Old Keldar’s dismay, no one has ever chosen the latter.

en.name: Ban Ard Student
en.tooltip: <keyword=patience>Patience</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>).\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Damage an enemy unit by [0].
en.fluff: Kaedweni Intelligence considers Ban Ard a hot spot for recruitment, and expelled students⁠—of which there are many⁠—often find themselves swiftly enlisted within the secret service.

en.name: Aretuza Student
en.tooltip: <keyword=patience>Patience</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>).\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Boost an allied unit by [0].
en.fluff: Knowledge beyond measure is a sorceress’s greatest treasure.

en.name: Redanian Agent
en.tooltip: <keyword=veil>Veil</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Boost a unit in your deck by 1.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 2
en.fluff: Eight-time champion of solo hide-and-seek.

en.name: Siege Support
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Reduce the <keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword> of an allied unit by 1.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Boost an allied unit by 1.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Give an allied unit <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>.
en.fluff: "You gotta recalibrate the arm by five degrees."\n"Do what by the what now?"

en.name: Cintrian Envoy
en.tooltip: <keyword=formation>Formation</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Look at 3 random cards from your deck. You may move 1 to the top of it.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 2
en.fluff: She thought service in the diplomatic corps would mean a quiet life behind a desk. She and her blistered feet were sorely mistaken...

en.name: Little Havfrue
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=bonded>Bonded</keyword>): Increase this unit's base power by 2.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage self by 4 and <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> <keyword=rain>Rain</keyword> on an enemy row for 2 turns.
en.fluff: They will not hesitate to shower you with gifts and affection. They will proudly profess their unwavering adoration and unyielding devotion. Yet, I ask you, when has a man ever given up his legs for love? Hmm?

en.name: Squire
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Boost the next unit you play by 2. If it is a Knight, also <keyword=infused>Infuse</keyword> it with "At the end of your turn, boost self by 1".
en.fluff: 25th of Blathe -- Vizima is four days off. Provisions are running low. Nothing to hunt.\n26th of Blathe -- Ambushed. Lost the cauldron to a brigand's battle-axe.\n27th of Blathe -- Half an hour is not enough to wash a sallet. I can still smell our "makeshift" stew.

en.name: Ballista
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 1. \n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 2.
en.fluff: What crossbows want to be when they grow up.

en.name: Dun Banner
en.tooltip: Whenever Dun Banner receives a boost, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> all copies of it from your deck to this row.
en.fluff: Stay calm, everyone. And be alert. The true owners of those cloaks and beaver–skin caps might be elsewhere.

en.name: Vrihedd Dragoon
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Move a unit to the other row. If it's an enemy, damage it by 1. If it's an ally, boost it by 2.
en.fluff: Most terrible things I've witnessed? The Catriona plague, the razing of Vengerberg and the charge of the Vrihedd Dragoons.

en.name: Mahakam Defender
en.tooltip: <keyword=inspired>Inspired</keyword>: At the end of your turn, boost self by 1.
en.fluff: I'm telling ye, we're born fer battle – we slash straight at their knees!

en.name: Elven Wardancer
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 1. If Elven Wardancer is already boosted, damage an enemy unit by 3 instead.
en.fluff: You mean to say the she–elf danced amidst the fray? Have you lost your mind, corporal?!

en.name: Svalblod Butcher
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an allied unit by 2, then give an enemy unit <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> (3).
en.fluff: Mercenaries fight for coin. Knights duel for honor. He kills for blood.

en.name: Pyrotechnician
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Damage a random enemy unit and self by 4.
en.fluff: An extraordinarily risky, and thus much revered, Mahakam trade. Its best-known practitioner was a dwarf by the name of Mikkel Bay.

en.name: Elven Scout
en.tooltip: Whenever an allied Trap is triggered, boost self by 2.
en.fluff: They say elves leave no tracks in the snow, but if you ask me, "they" are just a pack of village idiots, babbling nonsense.

en.name: Dryad Grovekeeper
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Gain <keyword=vitality>Vitality</keyword> (2).\n<keyword=bonded>Bonded</keyword>: Gain <keyword=vitality>Vitality</keyword> (4) instead.
en.fluff: Is it true? That flowers in Brokilon bloom seven times a year? But... How can that be?

en.name: Miner
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Boost an allied unit by 2.\nIf it's a Dwarf, also give it 4 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.
en.fluff: Which moron's whistling in the mine?!

en.name: Dwarf Berserker
en.tooltip: <keyword=barricade>Barricade</keyword>: At the end of your turn, damage self by 1 then damage a random enemy unit by 1.
en.fluff: I know I'm going to die. So I'm making sure I'll have company.

en.name: Drummond Berserker
en.tooltip: At the end of your turn, damage self and a random enemy unit by 1. \n<keyword=berserk>Berserk</keyword> 3: Transform into a Bear Abomination.
en.fluff: Tis but a scratch, aye?

en.name: Kerack Marine
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Boost an allied unit by 2.\n<keyword=devotion>Devotion</keyword>: Boost an allied unit by 4 instead.
en.fluff: I spy with my little eye something that is… green. Oh, shite! That’s a dryad!

en.name: Kerack Cutthroat
en.tooltip: <keyword=formation>Formation</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Give an enemy unit <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> (3).
en.fluff: He massacred that poor dryad’s body to the point that even her own mother would no longer be able to recognize it.

en.name: Abandoned Girl
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Transform into a Young Dryad without changing power, and gain <keyword=vitality>Vitality</keyword> equal to the number of Dryads on this row.
en.fluff: People believe that sick girls will spread their illness among the dryads, but in reality, Brokilon protects its children. Abandoned ones, too.

en.name: Cat Witcher Adept
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Give an enemy unit <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> equal to the number of units on that unit's row.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Give an allied unit <keyword=vitality>Vitality</keyword> equal to the number of units on that unit's row.
en.fluff: Cat students hone their balance by walking a tightrope blindfolded. Failure is easy to shrug off at first, but throughout their training, the walk gets higher⁠—and more perilous⁠—as they work toward their final Trial, where failure is not so forgiving.

en.name: Meditating Mage
en.tooltip: <keyword=patience>Patience.</keyword>\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Gain <keyword=vitality>Vitality</keyword> [0].\n<keyword=bonded>Bonded</keyword>: Also gain <keyword=resilient>Resilience</keyword>.
en.fluff: To become one with air, think away the ground.

en.name: Chameleon
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=infused>Infuse</keyword> self with a random Scoia'tael primary category that you don't control.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Replay self, then reduce own base power by 1.
en.fluff: Its own mother wouldn't be able to tell you of its true colors.

en.name: Trickster
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Move the last played enemy unit to another row and <keyword=infused>Infuse</keyword> it with "Whenever your opponent plays an Elf, damage self by 1".
en.fluff: Living among humans for so many years had revealed some unique vulnerabilities to the Scoia'tael. For one, apparently not all dh'oine recognize sarcasm...

en.name: Kaedweni Sergeant
en.tooltip: <keyword=formation>Formation</keyword>. \n<keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Boost an allied unit by 1.\n<keyword=charge>Charges</keyword>: 2
en.fluff: Forward, you sorry sods! Forward or you'll see the Nilfgaardians are the least of your worries!

en.name: Dimun Light Longship
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Damage self and an enemy unit by 1.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 1
en.fluff: Escape them? In the waters of Skellige? Good luck.

en.name: Elven Scribe
en.tooltip: Whenever you play a special card, remove a Counter.\nCounter: 3\nWhen the Counter reaches 0, boost self by 6.
en.fluff: Knowledge, my dear, is a privilege, and privileges are only shared among equals.

en.name: Poor Fucking Infantry
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Left Fucking Flank and a Right Fucking Flank on each side of this unit.\n<keyword=bonded>Bonded</keyword>: Also boost self by 3.
en.fluff: I's a war veteran! Spare me a crown?

en.name: Watcher of the Valley
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Give an enemy unit <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> equal to the amount of boost on this card.\n<keyword=bonded>Bonded</keyword>: Damage it by that amount instead.
en.fluff: He notched his staff for every interloper who thought to try their luck. Soon, the notches, much like the intruders, could no longer be distinguished.

en.name: An Craite Warcrier
en.tooltip: <keyword=Bloodthirst>Bloodthirst</keyword> 1: At the end of your turn, boost self by 1.
en.fluff: Every man, woman and child in Skellige can split a foe with an axe. Only a select few can split enemy ears with a rage-filled cry.

en.name: Field Medic
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost adjacent units by 2.
en.fluff: Stitch red to red, white to white, and everything will be all right.

en.name: Hawker Healer
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Boost an allied unit by 2.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): <keyword=heal>Heal</keyword> an allied unit by 4.
en.fluff: Sure, I'll patch you up. Gonna cost you though.

en.name: Vrihedd Officer
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Damage an enemy unit by 2.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Boost an allied unit by 2.\n<keyword=bonded>Bonded</keyword>: Use both abilities.
en.fluff: Hatred burns brighter than any fire, and cuts deeper than any blade.

en.name: Blue Mountain Elite
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Damage an enemy unit by 3 if it is the only unit on its row.
en.fluff: By the time we'd heard them, it was already too late…

en.name: Mahakam Guard
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost self by the number of allied Dwarf units on this row.
en.fluff: Only one punishment for disturbin' the peace in Mahakam: a hammer to the heid.

en.name: An Craite Warrior
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Give an enemy unit <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> (3). If played from the graveyard, damage an enemy unit by 3 instead.
en.fluff: Our clan's bards will sing of my deeds long after you're dead and forgotten!

en.name: Heymaey Skald
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Draw a card, then <keyword=discard>Discard</keyword> a card.
en.fluff: The deeds of Clan Heymaey will go down in history.

en.name: Ban Ard Tutor
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost an allied Mage by 4.
en.fluff: I'm constantly comparing the achievements of Aretuza's adepts with the work done by the lads at Ban Ard, and my conclusion constantly falls in favor of the girls.

en.name: Panther
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Damage an enemy unit by 2.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Give an enemy unit <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> (4).
en.fluff: An Oxenfurt scholar once examined a panther and declared it was nothing more than a leopard of a different color. The panther seemed indifferent to this pronouncement and gobbled him up before he could complete his research.

en.name: Heymaey Protector
en.tooltip: Whenever an adjacent unit takes damage, boost self by 1.
en.fluff: He fears nothing save Freya's wrath... and his wife's.

en.name: Svalblod Fanatic
en.tooltip: <keyword=berserk>Berserk</keyword> 2: Transform into a Bear Abomination.
en.fluff: Not all are worthy of Svalblod's blessing.

en.name: Courier
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Look at the top 3 cards from your opponent's deck and move one to the top.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Look at the top 3 cards from your deck and move one to the top.
en.fluff: 'Tis not steel and blood that wins wars, but information.

en.name: Dryad Enchantress
en.tooltip: <keyword=symbiosis>Symbiosis</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Give an allied unit 4 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Give an allied unit <keyword=vitality>Vitality</keyword> (4).
en.fluff: The dryads used to stay on the sidelines, avoiding the conflict between the races. But times change…

en.name: Payroll Specialist
en.tooltip: <keyword=tribute>Tribute</keyword> 1: Move a unit to the other row.
en.fluff: Guards in Novigrad work for very little money, yet live like kings. Just another paradox of the Free City…

en.name: Drummond Villager
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Give the unit to the right <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> (4), then give an enemy unit <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> (4).
en.fluff: The lovely jointress, mother of four, wondrous cook, and last but not least – a fierce warrior.

en.name: Mage Infiltrator
en.tooltip: <keyword=disloyal>Disloyal</keyword>.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage adjacent units by 3.\n<keyword=deathblow>Deathblow</keyword>: Move self to the opposite row and remove <keyword=spying>Spying</keyword>.
en.fluff: In her spare time, she likes playing practical jokes on others. Her favorite gag is switching footwraps and headwear.

en.name: Redanian Knight
en.tooltip: <keyword=barricade>Barricade</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): At the end of your turn, boost self by 1.\n<keyword=exposed>Exposed</keyword>: Move self to the <keyword=melee>Melee</keyword> row, then damage the highest-power enemy unit by 2.\n<keyword=grace>Grace</keyword> 8: Boost adjacent units by 1.
en.fluff: For glory! For Radovid!

en.name: Hawker Support
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost a unit in your hand by 1. If that unit was already boosted, boost it by 3 instead.
en.fluff: Elf, dwarf, makes no difference – long as they've got coin.

en.name: Savage Bear
en.tooltip: <keyword=Deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Gain 1 <keyword=charge>Charge</keyword> for each Savage Bear in your graveyard.\n<keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Give an enemy unit <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> (2).\n<keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>: 1
en.fluff: "Tame"? Och, lad, Skelligers might train bears, but that don't at all mean they tame 'em…

en.name: Brokvar Hunter
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Damage a unit by 1.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 2\nWhenever you play a Beast, reduce the <keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword> by 1.
en.fluff: Better believe we can hunt. Thing is, not much game on Spikeroog…

en.name: An Craite Blacksmith
en.tooltip: <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: Boost an allied unit by 1.\n<keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>: 1\nWhenever you play a Warrior, gain 1 <keyword=charge>Charge</keyword>.
en.fluff: Remember me words – a good shield can save yer life.

en.name: Redanian Elite
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost self by 6.\n<keyword=exposed>Exposed</keyword>: Reset own power.
en.fluff: I'll die for Redania, I'll kill for Redania… I'll even eat worms for Redania!

en.name: Dol Blathanna Bomber
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage 2 random enemy units by 2.
en.fluff: They track like hounds, run like deer and kill like heartless demons.

en.name: Svalblod Ravager
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Damage an enemy unit by 2.\n<keyword=bloodthirst>Bloodthirst</keyword> 2: Also give it <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> (2).
en.fluff: A two-handed axe? Seems no one told him that.

en.name: Wretched Addict
en.tooltip: At the end of your turn, if <keyword=poison>Poisoned</keyword>, boost self by 2.
en.fluff: I'd sell me own mum for a whiff. And I'd cut 'er throat for two.

en.name: Sea Jackal
en.tooltip: <keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 2: Boost self by 2.\n<keyword=hoard>Hoard</keyword> 7: Boost self by 3 instead.
en.fluff: You ever lift rings off a body that's been left to soak for two weeks? No? Then don't complain.

en.name: Cutup Lackey
en.tooltip: Whenever you play a Crime card, damage a random enemy unit by 1.\n<keyword=bonded>Bonded</keyword>: Increase the damage by 1.
en.fluff: The boss always gets to have the most fun. Truth be told, I prefer to watch anyway.

en.name: Bare-Knuckle Brawler
en.tooltip: <keyword=intimidate>Intimidate</keyword>.\n<keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 1: Damage the highest-power enemy unit by 1.
en.fluff: "Is tha' all that's left of 'im?"\n"Think I'm goin' tae boak..."

en.name: Terror Crew Axe-wielder
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 2.\n<keyword=exposed>Exposed</keyword>: Damage a random enemy unit by 2.
en.fluff: But dear Skelligers, what use do you have for axes? There are no trees in the sea…

en.name: Passiflora Peaches
en.tooltip: <keyword=hoard>Hoard</keyword> 4: At the end of your turn, boost self by 1.
en.fluff: They'll mess with your head, break your heart and empty your purse.

en.name: Mutants Maker
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Destroy an allied unit, then gain 3 <keyword=coin>Coins</keyword>.\n<keyword=devotion>Devotion</keyword>: Gain 3 <keyword=coin>Coins</keyword> instead.
en.fluff: I’m a scientist, truly. I can’t help it if the Oxenfurt professors were just too narrow-sighted to appreciate my particular research methods.

en.name: Oakcritters
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Give an enemy unit <keyword=bleeding>Bleeding</keyword> (4).\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a base copy of self on this row.\n<keyword=devotion>Devotion</keyword>: Use both abilities.
en.fluff: They especially like to chew on fingers, which to them are just like juicy carrots.

en.name: Salamandra Lackey
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: <keyword=purify>Purify</keyword> an allied unit and gain 2 <keyword=coin>Coins</keyword> for each status removed.
en.fluff: Lackeys are expected to perform their first five jobs for no pay, demonstrating their passion for the gig.

en.name: Vigilantes
en.tooltip: Whenever a <keyword=bounty>Bounty</keyword> is placed on an enemy unit, damage it by 2.
en.fluff: The alderman’s wife worked all night on these here costumes⁠—you should be damned grateful, you swines!

en.name: Pearl Diver
en.tooltip: <keyword=timer>Timer</keyword> 3: Gain 6 <keyword=coin>Coins</keyword>.
en.fluff: Can ye hold yer breath 'till dis candle burns out? No? Then don't tell me five hundred oren is too much for a pearl.

en.name: Oxenfurt Guard
en.tooltip: <keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 2: Boost adjacent units by 1. If that reduced your <keyword=coin>Coins</keyword> to 0, boost them by 2 instead.\n<keyword=cooldown>Cooldown</keyword>: 1
en.fluff: Cooler heads will prevail... provided they're holding the cards.

en.name: Back-Alley Chemist
en.tooltip: <keyword=zeal>Zeal</keyword>. <keyword=order>Order</keyword>: <keyword=poison>Poison</keyword> an allied unit and boost it by 2.
en.fluff: I do this for my family, always for my family!

en.name: Savvy Huckster
en.tooltip:
<keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 1.
<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 1.
<keyword=fee>Fee</keyword> 1: Gain <keyword=vitality>Vitality</keyword> (1).
<keyword=bonded>Bonded</keyword>: Increase the <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> and damage by 1.
en.fluff: Good sir, half a crown per stone!? That’s a crime! I’ll take twenty.

en.name: Dwarven Skirmisher
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Damage an enemy unit by 3. If it survived, gain 1 <keyword=armor>Armor</keyword>.\n<keyword=order>Order</keyword> (<keyword=barricade>Barricade</keyword>): Damage an enemy unit by 3.
en.fluff: Worked a pickaxe all me life. Battleaxe won't be any trouble.

en.name: An Craite Armorsmith
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Boost an allied unit by 2. If it's damaged, boost it by 4 instead.
en.fluff: Ye're in for a poundin'.

en.name: Whale Harpooner
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Move an enemy unit to the other row, then damage it by the number of units on that row.
en.fluff: Skelligers have long known that harpoons are effective against more than mere whales...

en.name: Beggar
en.tooltip: <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 3.\n<keyword=bonded>Bonded</keyword>: <keyword=profit>Profit</keyword> 5 instead.
en.fluff: Say what you will about his technique, I think he captured your good side.

en.name: Fence
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): Gain <keyword=vitality>Vitality</keyword> equal to your <keyword=coin>Coin</keyword> count.\n<keyword=tribute>Tribute</keyword> 3: Boost self by your <keyword=coin>Coin</keyword> count instead.
en.fluff: I prefer the term "curator."

en.name: Temple Guard
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=melee>Melee</keyword>): Boost 3 adjacent allied units by 1.
en.fluff: Halt! Who goes there?! Firesworn or heretic?

en.name: Mutant Killer
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 1.\n<keyword=hoard>Hoard</keyword> 4: Damage an enemy by 3 instead.
en.fluff: You have to keep him on a leash, muzzled and with blinders on, otherwise it'll be trouble.

en.name: Mutant
en.tooltip: When <keyword=poison>Poisoned</keyword>, <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a base copy of self on this row.\nCounter: 1
en.fluff: With the right tools you can shape the human body like wet clay.

en.name: Brokvar Warrior
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage an enemy unit by 3.\nIf the target is damaged, repeat the <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword> ability with a different target and decrease the damage by 1.
en.fluff: RAAAAAAAAAGH!!!

en.name: Heymaey Herbalist
en.tooltip: <keyword=Deploy>Deploy</keyword> (<keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword>): <keyword=heal>Heal</keyword> an allied unit by 3 and boost it by 3.
en.fluff: "We don't burn cunning women in Skellige - we take their advice."

en.name: Scapegoat
en.tooltip: <keyword=disloyal>Disloyal</keyword>.\n<keyword=profit>Profit</keyword>: 7.\n<keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Place a <keyword=bounty>Bounty</keyword> on self.
en.fluff: Fact often gives way to fiction.

en.name: Seagull
en.tooltip: <keyword=deploy>Deploy</keyword>: Damage 3 units by 1, then <keyword=spawn>Spawn</keyword> a Seagull in your graveyard for each target that is damaged or destroyed.\nWhen an enemy unit is destroyed, <keyword=summon>Summon</keyword> self from your graveyard to your <keyword=ranged>Ranged</keyword> row, then gain <keyword=doomed>Doomed</keyword>.
en.fluff: People often fear crows and ravens as portents of death, while ignoring the ultimate source of shock and terror: the common seagull.
